loans.name: Muath Group

texts.en:
This group is called Muath and its members are Munirh, Ghniah, Saba and Huda, all women living in Sana`a, Yemen.

Saba (the tallest woman in the photo) is a 34-year-old married mother of four children and the owner of her own business. She is requesting a loan of 40000 YER from AMB to buy materials such as needles and strings for sewing shoes, since competition has affected her sales a great deal and she needs more merchandise to offer her clients. She hopes to increase both her clientele and her income.

She also hopes to open a shoe store to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials such as needles and strings for her business.

loans.name: Alfiha Group

texts.en:
Alfiha's group is comprised of three hardworking women Raedh, Ghadh, Laila and one man Elyas. They live in Aden, Yemen. Raedh is 43 years old and lives in Aden, Yemen. She is married and has four children. 

For the past 20 years, Raedh has been working hard to manage her small hairdressing business. She is the woman standing in the center of the photo.

To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB. The loan will be used to buy cosmetic materials like combs, makeup, etc to sell and will help her to generate greater profits and earn money for her business. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a big beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic materials like combs, makeup, etc to sell

loans.name: Al-Ekhlass Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Ekhlass and consists of four women: Rogyh, Amnh, Zain and Ameerh who are hardworking ladies. They took a loan of 200,000 YER. 
 
Rogyh is 55 years old and a loving mother of seven children. She is the woman who is standing in the photo.  She has tried to work hard. She has a strong determination to improve her standard of living. 

Due to the high costs of commodities, she has requested a loan of 50,000 YER to buy bedroom supplies like blankets, cushions, etc. In the future, she plans to send all of her children to school. She also hopes to buy furniture supplies for her home.

loans.use: to buy bedroom supplies like blankets, cushions, etc. for her business

loans.name: Altareq Group

texts.en:
This group is called Altareq which is made up of 4 members: Ashwag, Fatima, Haind and Zainb, all of whom live in Sana`a, Yemen. They took out a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB. 

Fatima is a 48-year-old married woman with 4 children and they live in Sana`a, Yemen. (She is the second woman from the left side.) She is working hard to cover her family`s expenses. That is why she is requesting the loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy bricks, cement and sand to renew her house.  She has several children and she wants to make them more comfortable.

Fatima’s dream is to have more income and to improve the construction of her house which will improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and sand for her house.

loans.name: Yassr

texts.en:
Yassr, who is 36 years old, is married and has 2 children. He lives with them in Ibb, Yemen. His business is a small chicken store where he sells chickens for his clients.

He is requesting the amount of 100,000 YER to purchase more chickens. This purchase will generate greater sales in his business, and therefore Yassr's income will be better, and his customers will find everything in one place. 

Yassr's dream is the idea of expanding his business even more, and, when that happens, opening a phone accessories shop.

loans.use: to purchase chickens for his business

loans.name: Delfa

texts.es:
Delfa tiene 39 años, está casada con Denis, con quien tiene tres hijos de 16, 10 y 2 años de edad. Juntos viven en su casa propia construida en la comunidad nativa de Alto Incariado.
Ella es una mujer empeñosa, cuenta con cinco parcelas de terreno que la comunidad le brindó, allí produce café, plátanos y achiote. “De mis cuadras de café cosecho como 25 sacos y sin abono”, menciona. Por eso está vez piensa invertir en la compra de abono para producir en mayor cantidad. Sus cosechas las vende en las cooperativas de su ciudad, mientas que el plátano y achiote lo expende a compradores del mismo mercado mayorista. Con la ayuda de su esposo y otros operarios que contrata puede atender a todos sus cultivos y así obtener buenos frutos. 

Este es el quinto crédito que obtiene de MFP, por eso muestra seguridad al decir que pagará con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Shantzoshis”, un grupo unido y sólido.
Con este dinero podrá comprar bolsas de abono, pagará al personal que contratará para el apoyo en el trabajo de la poda y sembrío de nuevas plantitas de café.
texts.en:
Delfa is 39 years old, and is married to Denis with whom she has 3 children, aged 16, 10 and 2. They all live together in their own home, which is located in their home community of Alto Incariado. She is a tenacious woman who has 5 plots of land, granted to her by the community, where she produces coffee, bananas and annatto. "I get 25 sacks of coffee beans from my plot without using fertilizers", she tells us. Consequently, this time she wishes to invest in buying fertilizers in order to increase her production. She sells these harvests in her community cooperatives, whereas the bananas and annattos she sells to buyers in the same wholesale market. With help from her husband and other contracted workers, she is able to tend to all of her crops and, as such, she reaps good rewards.
This is her fifth loan with MFP, which shows her to be a solid borrower who will fulfill her repayment schedule punctually. She belongs to the "Shantzoshis" Communal Bank, a strong and united group.
With this loan she will be able to buy bags of fertilizers, and she will pay her contracted workers for the support they provide in pruning and sowing the new coffee plants.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to pay the day workers that work on her plots.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 46 years old and a married man who has 8 children. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He emigrated from KSA (Saudi Arabia), where he was working in a business store. The main benefit being that he will succeed in starting his activity once again and that he will consequently be able to earn money for his family, on top of continuing working, something he likes very much. He sells clothes. 

He is a very hardworking and resourceful man, as he always looks for ways to earn money in order to help paying for his family’s expenses. He applied for a loan of 300,000 YER from AMB to buy clothes like shirts and pants, etc. for his business. He hopes to buy a car and a house.

loans.use: to buy clothes like shirts and pants, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en:
Fatema is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son Mohammad appears in her Kiva profile photo, taken in the store.

Fatema is a 40-year-old woman. She is married and a mother to five sons and two daughters. Her two daughters are married and three of her sons are school students. Her husband and two of her sons are employed with low salaries, which are not enough to cover the family's needs and pay the education expenses. 

For the past month, Fatema has been selling clothes. Still, she needs to improve her project and get more support to cover the store's costs. She is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing a new collection of summer clothes to resell. This will enable her to compete with others and attract new customers to buy from her store. That will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase a new collection of summer clothes to resell.

loans.name: Abdulhamid

texts.en:
Abdulhamid is a 42-year-old man. He is married and has 7 children; almost all of them attend school.

He has been working as a seller of groceries since 2008. He has received a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB for the purchase of general food products for his grocery store. He wants open a bookshop. He wants to become a wholesaler and provide a bright future to his family.

loans.use: purchase general food products for his grocery business

loans.name: Ramdan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Ramdan and consists of three women: Fawziah, Susan and Muna. They live in Aden, Yemen. They took out a loan of 150,000 YER.

Susan is 45 years old, married and has five children. She is the woman who has her face covered in the photo. She lives with them in Aden, Yemen. She sells many businesses like perfumes, incense, etc.  She is focused on her business because this is a great help in improving their economic conditions. As time passes and her customers' needs grow, she doubles her seriousness. But seriousness and hard work aren't enough. 

As a result, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy perfumes, clothes, etc as additional commodities to sell. She hopes to gain more profits through these goods in order to be able to provide a good living for her family.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, clothes, etc for her business

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en:
Khitam, who appears in the photo pictured next to her vehicle, is a 42-year-old woman. She is married and a mother to seven daughters. Three of her daughters are university students. Khitam's husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs and pay the education expenses.

For the past three years, Khitam's husband has also been selling plastic products like plates and cups from a stall he has. That has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover the costs.

Khitam wants to live in better conditions with her family, so she is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her complete the price of purchasing a new vehicle. This will facilitate the movement of Khitam and her family from one place to another and help Khitam's husband to carry the plastic products to his stall, which will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To complete the price of purchasing a vehicle.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 39-year-old housewife caring for four children. She is helping her husband, who is serving in the military, by supporting the family financially from the business she has, which is animal sales.

She has a small barn beside her house that holds sheep and goats. She uses some of them to sell milk and others for animal sales itself. She has applied for this loan to do some enhancements to the barn and get more food for the animals.

loans.use: to do some enhancements to the barn.

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en: Sultan is a 21-year-old single guy, and he is the oldest among four other siblings. He is a university student majoring in finance and banking. He has applied for this loan in order to pay for his upcoming semester fees. After he gets his bachelor degree he hopes to apply for a masters degree in the same field.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is 49 years old, married, and lives in Ibb, Yemen. He has eight children. To help cover household expenses, he started repairing fridges 30 years ago. He is professional in this field. His main difficulty is the slump in attracting more clients, so he asked for a loan of 100,000 YER to buy spare parts for his repair business. In the future, he wants to expand his business and, if possible, add another secondary business to ensure the wellbeing of his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his refrigerator repair business.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta sua mãe enviando alguma ajuda para alimentação. 	
É militar e quadro do Ministério da Defesa, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (aros para portas, areia, cimento, pedra, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
No futuro deseja crescer de categoria, concluir e mobilara a casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo devidamente para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é terminar a sua obra, vedar e oferecer melhor conforto a sua família.
texts.en: Marcelino is the father of 2 children who go to school.  He lives in his own home and also supports his mother by sending her money for food.  He is a member of the military in the Ministry of Defense.  He will use this loan to buy construction materials (door frames, sand, cement, stone, iron, etc.) to keep working on his home.  In the future, he hopes to rise in rank and to finish and furnish his home.  To do this, he promises to pay off his loan on time to be able to request more from Hluvuku.  His challenge is to finish his home and to seal it to offer better comfort to his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (door frames, sand, cement, stone, iron, etc.)

loans.name: Rosa Melania

texts.es: Rosa vive en Duran en el barrio conocido como Los Helechos. Ahí tiene una casa propia de cemento que cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, pocos barrios de su sector cuentan con alcantarillado y camino pavimentado. A sus 27 años está casada con Ángel con quien tiene 2 hijos de etapa escolar. En su domicilio Rosa tiene un taller de costura el cual empezó hace un año con la ayuda de su esposo. El oficio lo aprendió hace 10 años por que su madre ejercía esta profesión la cual le gusto mucho, como su esposo era empleado en una empresa ella le ayudaba con los gastos recibiendo costuras y realizando arreglos cuando sus clientes lo solicitaban. Fue cuando su esposo dejo el trabajo que equiparon un poco el taller, con la liquidación compraron una maquinas industriales y ambos se dedicaron a obtener resultados. Ahora tiene varias personas empleadas que realizan la confección ya que sus principales cliente son pequeñas empresas y vendedores locales. Comenta que como vive en un sector donde las calles no están asfaltadas su principal problema es la transportación y el costo que tiene. Con el préstamo va a comprar otra máquina industrial y telas para la confección.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in Duran in the suburb know as Los Helechos. She has her own house built of cement which has light and running water. Few neighbourhoods in her area have sewerage systems or paved streets.

At 27 years of age, she is married to Angel, with whom she has 2 school age children. 

At home, Rosa has a sewing workshop, which she started with her husband's help. She learnt the job 10 years ago because her mother was in this profession and enjoyed it. As her husband was employed by a business she helped with their expenses by taking in clothes for repairs when her customers requested it.

It was when her husband left work that they began to equip the workshop, with the settlement they bought some industrial machines and both worked hard to achieve results. Now, she has various employees who do the sewing as her main customers are small businesses and local sales people. 

She comments that, as she lives in an area where the roads are not paved, her main difficulty is transportation and its cost. 

With the loan she is going to buy another industrial machine and fabrics for sewing.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine and fabrics

loans.name: Onelia

texts.es:
Onelia tiene 37 años, está casada con Liborio, con quien tiene tres hijos de 17, 11 y 6 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura hace más de 20 años, desde que unió su vida a la de su esposo. Cuenta con tres cuadras de terrenos de cultivos donde produce café y algo de plátanos. Acaba de plantar café en una cuarta parte de parcela la que estará lista para las cosechas dentro de 3 años, para ello, Onelia debe cuidar con esmero sus plantaciones. A la vez, tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes que instaló en su vivienda, así abastece de víveres a los comuneros de su zona. Ella quiere seguir creciendo, tanto con la agricultura y con en su bodega, por eso no duda en seguir esforzándose.

Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Shantzoshis”, del que siente identificación por ser un grupo solidario.
Con este dinero podrá pagar al personal que contratará para la limpieza de su cafetal que quedó débil después de la última cosecha.
texts.en:
Onelia is 37 years old and is married to Liborio, with whom she has 3 children aged 17, 11 and 6. They all live together in their own home, located in a native community. She has worked in agriculture for more than 20 years ever since she married her husband. She has 3 plots of cultivable land where she grows coffee and some bananas. She has just planted coffee on a fourth plot which will be ready to harvest in 3 years and, as such, Onelia must show great care in looking after her plants. At the same time, she also has a little grocery shop, which she has set up in her home, from where she supplies groceries to the people in her neighborhood. She wishes to keep on growing her business, as much in agriculture as in her shop, and without a doubt she will continue to strive for this.
This will be her fifth loan with MFP, so she gives her word that she will be punctual in fulfilling her monthly repayment schedule. She belongs to the "Shantzoshis" Communal Bank, which is known for being a united group. With this money, she will be able to pay the works that she will contract to clear her coffee plantation which has been weakened by the last harvest.

loans.use: To pay the workers who clear her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilder tiene 30 años, su pareja es Roxana, con quien tiene tres hijos de 5 y 3 años y un bebé de 8 meses. 
Él tiene tres cuadras de terrenos de cultivo donde siembra café y algo de plátanos. Tiene buenas plantas de café que le botan granos desde enero hasta mayo, todo gracias a los cuidados que les brinda. “Les echo abono, les corto la maleza, limpio sus hojas de las arañeras”, menciona. El plátano que cosecha le ayuda en los gastos diarios, pues cosecha dos veces al mes. Él sabe que con mucho esfuerzo puede adquirir otros terrenos y ampliar su producción, por eso se esmera todos los días en sus cultivos. Actualmente cosecha de 30 a 35 sacos de café, pero anhela llegar a los 50, es una de sus metas. 

Este es el quinto crédito que recibe de MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Shantzoshis”, un grupo sólido y organizado.
Con este dinero podrá pagar a los jornaleros que contratará para la limpieza de sus terrenos. Además comprará víveres y alimentos para preparar la comida de los trabajadores.
texts.en:
Wilder is 30-year-old and his partner is Roxana and he has three children with her: an eight-month-old baby and a five and three-year-old.

He has three blocks of land parcels under cultivation where he grows coffee and some bananas.  He has good coffee plants that put out coffee berries from January until May thanks to his care for the plants.  “I give them fertilizer, I prune them, I clean the leaves of spider webs and pests,” he tells us.  He harvests bananas twice a month.  He knows that with great effort he can acquire more land parcels and expand his production, this is why he takes great pains to care for his plantings every day.  He is currently harvesting 30 to 35 sacks of coffee but he hopes to get to 50, this is one of his goals.

This is his fifth loan with MFP and he commits to making punctual monthly payments.  He belongs to the communal bank “Shanzoshis,” a solid and organized group.

With this money he will pay the workers that he hires to clear his land.  He will also buy supplies and food to prepare meals for his workers.

loans.use: to pay the workers who work on his land.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa, a 28-year-old single conservative lady, asked her only brother to take her place in the photo.

Using her first loan has helped her bring more food products to the store, which helped her to get more clients. Now she has applied for this youth loan in order to increase the quantity of goods she has in the store.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of goods she has in the store.

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya, a 25-year-old conservative married lady, asked her brother to be shown in the photo instead.

Raya wants to support her brother in continuing his higher education to get his Masters degree, so for that she has applied for this educational loan to pay for his registration fees.

loans.use: to pay for her brother's registration fees.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a 40-year-old married man with five children.  He and his family  live in Ibb, Yemen.

For the past four years, he has owned and operated an auto body repair shop, and he has a good reputation among customers. The project is a profitable one, but he needs more support to cover the costs of operation.

He is requesting a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy a generator and make some necessary repairs. This will increase his business efficiency and improve the family's income.

loans.use: to buy generator for his repair business

loans.name: Abdulrzaq

texts.en:
Abdulrzaq is 41 years old, and he works hard to support his family. He is married and has a bus transportation business in Taiz, Yemen.

He requested a loan of 100,000 YER through AMB to buy tools and equipment for his bus.

In the future, he would like to save enough money so he could afford to open a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for his bus

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil, a 33-year-old resident of Sana`a, Yemen, is the father of one child, still in school. Khalil has owned a taxi for three years, having purchased it with savings and money lent by his relatives.

Khalil is now requesting a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to purchase spare parts for repairing his taxi. He believes the additional income from this loan will help him to provide a better education for his child.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for repairing his taxi.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is 31 years old and married with two children. He operates a spare parts shop to earn a living. In the beginning, he had a car and then he sold it to open a spare parts for car decoration business. He has one employee. He is taking a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to purchase necessary spare parts like stereos, cover wheels, etc, which has helped to grow his business. He hopes to expand his business to increase his profit income.

loans.use: to purchase necessary spare parts like stereo, cover wheels, etc for his business

loans.name: Saron

texts.en: Saron is 27 years old. She is single and resides with her sister in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her sister have been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $7 per day. Saron wants to rebuild her house. With this goal in mind, Saron is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house. This money will help her provide better living condition for her family. In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop of her own to generate more income to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en: Sopheak is 23 years old. She is married and resides with her mother in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been employed as a chef for more than two years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is employed as a sale representative and h earns about $4 per day. Due to the difficulty with her family’s transportation, Sopheak is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials (doors, door frames, windows, etc.).

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo tiene 35 años, es soltero y hace 7 años que decidió vivir solo y construir una casita rústica en medio de los terrenos que la comunidad y sus padres le otorgaron. Eduardo se dedica a la agricultura, siembra café y plátanos. Para vender sus productos tiene que recorrer una hora de viaje para llevarlos a la zona donde encuentra transporte para llevarlos a la ciudad. “Es rentable la venta de café, por eso cuido con más esfuerzo el cafetal”, menciona. Eduardo ofrece sus granos de café a las cooperativas de su zona, por eso no pierde. Una de sus metas es mejorar su producción de café, para ello comprará más plantitas y bolsas de abono.

Este es el crédito número 5 que recibe de MFP, da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Shantzoshis” y menciona que le agrada el trabajo con socios responsables.
Invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en el pago de los operarios que contrató para la cosecha de café y para la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 35 years old, he is single and 7 years ago decided to live alone and build a country cottage in the midst of the land that the community and his parents gave to him. 

Eduardo works in agriculture and sows coffee and bananas. In order to sell his products he has to travel for an hour to take them to the area where there is transport to carry them to the city. "The sale of coffee is very profitable, because of this I have put the most effort into the coffee plantation" he mentions.

Eduardo offers his coffee grains to the local co-ops, because of which he doesn't lose out. One of his goals is to improve the production of coffee, for which he must buy more plants and bags of manure.

This is the 5th loan that he will receive from MFP, he gives his word to be punctual in his monthly payments. He belongs to the communal bank "Shantzoshis" and mentions that he is grateful to work with responsible members.

He will invest the money from this loan in paying the labourers that he hired to sow the coffee and to clean his crops.

loans.use: to pay the labourers who work on his land.

loans.name: Santo Marlene

texts.es: Doña Santos tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos adolecentes los cuales estan estudiando.  Tiene mas de 20 años de tener su propio negocio de pulperia donde ofrece a sus clientes productos para el consumo diario en el hogar.  Esta solicitando es financiamiento con el objetivo de fortalecer su inventario comprando granos, ropita de bebé y otras cositas que su clientela le solicita.
texts.en: Santos is 42 years old, she is married and has two teenage children who are both studying. She has had her own business, a small grocery store, for more than 20 years. She offers her customers products that are used on a daily basis in the home. She has requested this loan to use to restock her inventory, to buy grains, baby clothes and other things her customers have requested.

loans.use: to buy products for her business.

loans.name: Sameer

texts.en:
Sameer is 32 years old, married, and a father of three children. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He owns a house which he is currently in the process of furnishing, so as to be able to provide furniture for his family. 

To this end, he needs support from AMB from which he requested a loan of 280,000 YER. With it, he will purchase furniture like blankets and cushions as well as carpets. He takes care of his family, providing food and paying the bills. Currently, his only concern is to complete construction and to be in a stable situation.

loans.use: to purchase furniture like blankets and cushions as well as carpets.

loans.name: Reaksmey

texts.en: Reaksmey is 24 years old. She is married and blessed with one child.  She and her family live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has worked in a garment factory for more than three years, earning about $3 per day. Her husband is a sculptor who earns about $10 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Reaksmey is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase timbers to use in sculpting statues to sell. This money will help her husband generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business and help her child go to school and earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase timbers to use in sculpting statues to sell

loans.name: Acacio

texts.pt:
Viúvo e pai de 1 filho que frequenta a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É militar e quadro do Ministério da Defesa, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (janelas, cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
No futuro deseja terminar a sua casa, subir de categoria para aumentar o seu salário, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo devidamente para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é adquirir um meio de transporte para melhorar as condições de deslocação para o seu serviço.
texts.en: Acacio is a window and the father of one son who goes to school.  He lives in his own home and doesn't support anyone else.  He is a member of the military and the Ministy of Defense.  With his current loan, he will buy construction materials (windows, cement, sand, stone, etc.) to continue working on his home.  In the future, he hopes to finish his home and to rise in rank to increase his salary.  To do this, he promises to make his payments on time so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.  His challenge is acquiring a means of transportation to improve his home's conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (windows, cement, sand, stone, etc.) to continue work on his home.

loans.name: Latifa

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 5 filhos destes 3 ainda frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém para além da sua família. 	
Tem um negócio próprio de venda de produtos alimentares diversos, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (amendoim, açúcar, feijão, óleo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja desenvolver mais o seu negócio introduzindo outros produtos, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo segundo o calendário para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é dependência financeira e a saturação do mercado.
texts.en:
A married mother of 5 children, of which 3 are still at school, the borrower lives in her own home with her family and does not support anyone else besides.
She has her own business selling a range of food products, and with this loan she hopes to buy products (nuts, sugar, beans, oil and other items) to increase her stock level.
In the future she hopes to develop her business further by introducing new products, and as such she promises to punctually fulfill her repayment schedule so that she can apply again to Hluvuku.
The challenges that she faces are financial dependency and saturation of the market.

loans.use: To buy and sell products (peanuts, sugar, beans, oil and other items).

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo tiene 42 años, su pareja es Judi, de 34 años. Viven en la casa que compraron hace 5 años, desde su unión. Tienen un hijo de 15 años, por quien trabajan para que tenga un mejor futuro.
Él es profesor en un colegio de su localidad, esa es su labor principal, la cual disfruta mucho porque ama a sus alumnos. Esto lo realiza desde hace 18 años. Pero, adicionalmente tiene un pequeño puesto donde brinda el servicio de fotocopiado, cobrando muy cómodo, pues cada fotocopia cuesta 10 céntimos de sol. Lo que es conveniente para Hugo, porque con este negocio puede tener un dinero extra además de su sueldo mensual y también la fotocopiadora le es de gran ayuda para sus labores como maestro, así no le falta material de clase, ni para él, ni a sus alumnos. Ya que en los colegios del gobierno no tienen suficiente presupuesto para cubrir esos gastos, y él lo hace con su propia máquina.

Está muy agradecido con el apoyo financiero que consigue en MFP, por lo que se compromete ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago. Asimismo, se siente alegre por formar parte de su banco comunal, pues sus compañeros son muy responsables. 
Con los 2,500 nuevos soles que ahora solicita podrá comprar repuestos para su máquina fotocopiadora.
texts.en:
Hugo is 42 years old, his wife is Judi, who is 34 years old. They live in the house that they bought five years ago. They have one son, who is 15 years old, whom they work hard for so that he can have a better future. 

He is a teacher in a school in the same area where he lives. This is his primary job, which he enjoys very much because he loves his students. He has been a teacher for 18 years. Additionally, he has a small business where he offers photocopying services, charging a very fair price at 10 cents (PEN) a copy. This works out well for Hugo, because it is additional income and it is also very useful in his work as a teacher because he never is lacking in materials for his class, for himself or for his students. In government run schools, there are not enough funds to cover these expenses, so he is able to use his own copy machine to do so.     

He is very thankful for the financial support that he receives through MFP, which is why he promises to make his repayments on time. He is also happy to be a part of his communal bank, because the other group members are very responsible. 

With the 2,500 nuevo soles which he has requested in this loan, he will be able to buy parts for his photocopy machine.

loans.use: to buy parts for his photocopy machine.

loans.name: Martha Jeaneth

texts.es: Doña Martha es casada, tiene 4 hijos en edad escolar.  Es pequeña comerciante del municipio de Santo Domingo.  Esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de continuar mejorarando su vivienda construyendo un muro de retencion en la parte trasera y evitar que se le meta el agua, con el credito anterior logro mejorar una pared y levantar otra parte estilo minifalda para poco a poco ir construyendo su vivienda con mejroes condiciones.
texts.en:
Martha is married and has 4 school age children. She is a trader in the Santo Domingo municipality.

She is requesting her third loan with the objective of continuing to improve her home by building a retaining wall at the back to stop it letting in water.

With her previous loan she succeeded in improving a wall and erecting another part in order to improve the condition of her home little by little.

loans.use: to build a retaining wall.

loans.name: La Quebradilla Iv Group

texts.es:
El señor Amilcar Lucas está casado, tiene 23 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas y habas, lleva 6 años de experiencia, inicio este negocio con su padres, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a las oficios de la casa.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compras de semillas, y sembrar mas papas y mas habas, en el futuro espera tener más terrenos cultivado y tener un medio de trasporte propio para vender su productos, Los demás integrantes se dedican al mismo oficio, la siembra de papas y habas.
texts.en:
Amilcar Lucas is married and is 23 years old. He finished three years of primary school. He has two children and makes a living as a farmer, planting potatoes and broad beans. He has six years of experience farming. He started the business with his parents, he is supported by his wife who take care of the household chores. 

He became a part of a communal bank group so that he could request a loan to use to buy seeds, to plant more potatoes and broad beans. In the future he hopes to have more land to farm and have his own form of transportation so that he can sell his own products. 

The other group members also make a living planting potatoes and broad beans.

loans.use: to buy potato and broad bean seeds.

loans.name: Bryan

texts.en:
Bryan is a responsible son who has committed himself to the farming business. He is 24 years old, and he has labored more than eight years on his family's farmland. Within these years of staying in this muddy and tricky source of income, he has learned the hardship of being the eldest in the family. His father has done with this experience, and now Bryan is the one who endures this occupation. 

One of his woes is the lack of capital. So Bryan is requesting a loan of P10,000 to buy the necessities needed in farming such as  seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. He is hoping that through these inputs, he can grow his proceeds and lift up his family's unprivileged lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy the necessities needed in farming, such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Binh

texts.en: Mrs Binh was born in 1971. She has two sons and they are both adults. The older son got married; the younger son is a student. Her husband is a chairman of a pig-raising cooperative. His income is 3,000,000 VND a month. Mrs Binh sells pork in the market for a living. She gets 3,000,000 VND a month. The total income of her family is 14,000,000 VND. She has participated in the loan program of SEDA since 2006. Last cycle, she borrowed 8,066,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to enlarge her pork butcher's stall in the market.

loans.use: to enlarge her pork butcher's stall in the market.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Mrs. Lien was born in 1980. She has two children who are studying at primary school. Her husband is a building worker. He earns 4,000,000 VND per month. She buys small pieces of metal and recycles them. She has participated in the loan program of SEDA since 2007. Last cycle, she borrowed 8,066,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy more scrap metal and resell it. Then she would be able to  let her children go to school continuously.

loans.use: to buy more scrap metal and resell it

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is a positive person who believes that ”as long as you are alive there is always hope for you”. He always thinks of that when he experiences burdens and trials in life. He knows that these trials will pass.

Poor living is already one of his problems that needs to be overcome. And to find a solution and achieve the hope of life, he works hard in his farming business. He usually plows, sows and put fertilizers his farmland. To maintain and develop his business, he is asking for assistance from ASKI that provides hopes to small farmers like him. A loan amount of PHP 15,000 will be used to buy seeds, three bags of fertilizer and insecticides. Oliver was not blessed with an above-average way of living so he practices to become a valuable creation and he hopes that his two children will adopt this view.

loans.use: to buy seeds, three bags of fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Las Luminosas Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “LAS LUMINOSAS” inicia su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes donde la señora Patricia es la presidenta. Las actividades que desarrollan dentro del grupo son distintos, entre ellos tenemos: Tejido de guantes, costura de pollera, venta de frutas, venta de golosinas, tienda de barrio, tejido de chompas. 
La señora Patricia cuenta que hace cinco años que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que para esto fue invitada por una promotora; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de guantes, mismo que trabaja hace varios años.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana por mayor) los que comprarán de las ferias tradicionales de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo venderá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Luminosas" is starting it first cycle at the Villa Adela regional office. The group is made up of eight members and Patricia is the president. The group covers various business sectors, including: knitting gloves, sewing skirts, fruit sales, sweet sales, local store and knitting jumpers.

Patricia joined a Communal Bank within Pro Mujer five years ago and was invited to be a promoter. Currently she has a business knitting gloves, which she has had for several years. 

The loan that she is taking now is to raise her capital (by buying wholesale wool), which she will buy at the traditional markets in the city of El Alto and after the manufacturing process she will sell them to order. 

This work supports her family as she is single and has two childen.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy wholesale wool.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Mrs Lien was born in 1958. Her husband is an alcohol cook. He gets 2,000,000 VND each month. Her three children are all adults. Mrs Lien grows vegetables, cooks alcohol and glues recycled paper bags for a living. From that, she gets 3,000,000 VND per month. The total income of her family is 7,000,000 VND. She has participated in the loan program of SEDA since 2006. Last cycle, she borrowed 8,938,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to improve her alcohol process and buy more recycled paper bags to glue. Then she hopes she will have enough money for her daughter’s wedding.

loans.use: to improve her alcohol process and buy more recycled paper bags to glue.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger works hard to earn his living. He is 43 years of age, married and has two children. His two children both go to school. His wife is the owner of a restaurant.

Roger has been operating his motorcycle transport for two years. He is able to earn about P6,000 a month. This amount goes immediately to their daily meals, allowances for the children and other school fees. For this reason, his income is no longer enough, so he is requesting a loan amount of P15,000. He will use this amount to purchase new wheels and tires for his transportation business. He knows that he will be able to let his two children finish their studies due to his sacrifices and patience in running his transportation business.

loans.use: to buy new wheels and tires for his motorcycle

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Mrs. Hang was born in 1963. Her husband is dead. She has a daughter who recently got married. Her son is a bus ticket seller. 

Mrs. Hang raises chickens and glues cement bags for a living. She earns 3,000,000 VND per month. She has taken part in the loan program of SEDA since 2006. Last cycle, she borrowed 8,066,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy more cement bags to glue and buy feed for her chickens.

loans.use: to buy more cement bags to glue and buy feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Lanso Group

texts.fr: Mr Akossi est marié à une cultivatrice. Il est père 07enfants dont 05 scolarisés. L’ainé a 18ans et le dernier 02ans. Il est né en 1984 et exerce depuis 2000 l’activité de cultivateur. C’est un travail qu’il apprécie car il s’y met à fonds pour tirer profit des richesses de la terre. 06 personnes l’aident dans l’exécution de ses taches et il s’approvisionne généralement à SOKODE(en R2GION CENTRALE). Ce troisième prêt qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter des outils afin d’avoir un bon rendement pour satisfaire les clients. Il est le responsable du groupement nommé LANSO constitué de 03 hommes qui sont dans la culture du mais, du riz et autres. Leurs souhaits est d’augmenter leurs superficies cultivables, scolariser leurs enfants et construire un logement.
texts.en:
Mr. Akossi is married to a farmer. He is the father of seven children aged 2 to 18, five of whom go to school. Born in 1984, he has been a farmer since 2000. He appreciates his work and is fully dedicated to it as a means of capitalizing on what the land has to offer.  Six people assist him with his work. He usually gets his supplies in SOKODE (central region). 

He is seeking this third loan to buy farming equipment, which will help to improve his yield and satisfy customer demand. 

He is the representative of the group LANSO consisting of three men who grow maize, rice and other crops. They wish to expand their farmable area, support their children’s education, and build homes.

loans.use: to buy farming equipment.

loans.name: Agoyi  Clautilde

texts.fr: Agoyi Clautilde est mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgé a 18 ans et le moins âgé a 05 ans. Spécialisée dans la vente des mèches et des pagnes depuis des années, Agoyi Clautilde s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de la sous région. Ses clients sont composés des habitants du quartier et de ses environs. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de combler les attentes de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a bénéficié d'un financement à Finadev. Ce financement lui permettra d'acheter un carton de mèches, des pagnes et de maximiser son intérêt pour le bien-être de la famille et surtout pour la poursuite de la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Agoyi Clautilde is married and the mother of three children who attend school.  The oldest is 18 years old and the youngest is 5.  She has specialized in selling hair pieces and pagnes (colorful lengths of cloth used for clothing) for many years.  Agoyi Clautilde gets her supplies in one of the markets in her region.  Her customers come from her neighborhood and surrounding areas.  In the hopes of strengthening her business and to fulfill the demands of her customers, she has requested and benefited from a loan through Finadev. This money will allow her to buy a case of hair pieces, pagnes, and will maximize her profits for the well being of her family, especially the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a case of hair pieces and four VLISCO brand pagnes.

loans.name: Rosas De Rosas Pampa Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “ROSAS DE ROSASPAMPA” inicia su segundo ciclo en el Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes donde la señora Ceferina es la presidenta.  Las actividades que desarrollan dentro del grupo son distintos, entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de ropa usada, pastelería, venta de fruta. 
La señora Ceferina cuenta que es el primer año que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que para esto fue invitada por su amiga; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida, mismo que trabaja hace varios años aprendiendo el mismo de su amiga.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de cereales y verduras) los que comprarán de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que le gustan las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Rosas de Rosaspampa" is starting its second cycle in the Villa Exaltación regional office. The group is made up of eight members and Ceferina is the president. The developing businesses within the group are varied and include: food sales, clothing sales, sale of used clothing, bakery and fruit sales.

This is the first year that Ceferina is a member of a Communal Bank within Pro Mujer and she was invited by a friend. Currently, she has a food sales business, in which she has worked for several years learning the trade from a friend.

The loan that she will take is to raise her capital (buying cereals and vegetables), which she will buy at the markets in the city of El Alto and after manufacturing she will sell at the markets in La Paz. This work supports her family as she is married and as six children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health and credit training.

loans.use: to buy cereals and vegetables.

loans.name: Tan

texts.en: Mrs. Tan was born in 1963. Her husband raises ducks for a living. His income is about 3,000,000 VND. She has a daughter who got married. Her son is a student. Mrs. Tan raises ducks and duck eggs for a living. She earns 3,000,000 VND per month. She has taken part in the loan program of SEDA since 2007. Last cycle, she borrowed 8,066,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy more feed for her ducks and buy more duck breeds.

loans.use: to buy more feed for her ducks and buy more duck breeds.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao is 32 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling desserts for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is involved in fishing. Approximately, he earns $4 per day. 

In order to improve her family's finances, Sao is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase rice to produce sweet cakes to sell. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business to earn more income for the family and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice to produce sweet cakes to sell

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mean is 58 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband runs a taxi service (motorcycle taxi). He earns about $3 per day. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $6 per day. 

Because their present motorbike is old, Mean is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband's taxi service. This purchase will help her husband to attract more customers and earn more money to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband's taxi service

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huong is 32 years old. She has three children. They are studying at primary school. She is a carpenter. She earns 4,200,000 VND a month from her carpentry. She has participated in the loan program of SEDA since 2011. Last cycle, she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to enlarge her carpentry business and buy more wood to make stuff. Then she hopes her business could bring in enough money for her children’s education fees and to rebuild her house. 

 Mrs. Ngan is 34 years old. She wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to do carpentry work. 
 
 Mrs. Kha is 50 years old. She wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to sell vegetables in the market.    
 
 Mrs. Thuy is 26 years old. She wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to do carpentry work.
 
 Mrs. Thịnh is 19 years old. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to sell vegetables in the market.

loans.use: to enlarge her carpentry business and buy more wood to make stuff.

loans.name: Ram

texts.en:
Ram is 52 years old. She is married and resides with six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in fishing for more than ten years, earning approximately $7 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Four of her children are employed. They are garment workers and construction workers. They earn about $14 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Ram is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved  on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Pisey

texts.en:
Pisey is 38 years old. She is married and blessed with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been making creels to sell for more than twenty years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband runs a business purchasing creels and flat baskets from villagers to resell. He earns about $10 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Pisey is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce the expenses of her transportation. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
Saodat is a very talented young woman. She is purposeful and always finishes all her work perfectly on time. Saodat wants to get more success in life and that’s why she must work hard. Three years ago she began own business. Her business is to make dresses for women. Saodat works in her house. She has many customers and many of them are glad about Saodat’s work because she makes very beautiful dresses. 

Saodat is not married. She lives with her parents. Saodat’s parents love her very much. Saodat wants to develop her business. She is asking for a loan to buy a new dress-making machine. She would be very happy if you help her.

loans.use: To buy a new dress-making machine

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Mrs Lan is 37 years old. She has two children. One child is studying at secondary school, and one is an adult. She is a carpenter. She earns 4,600,000 VND a month from her work. She has participated in the loan program of SEDA since 2009. Last cycle, she borrowed 7,840,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,736,000 VND to enlarge her carpentry business and buy more wood to make stuff. Then, she hopes her business could bring in enough money for her child's education fees.

loans.use: to enlarge her carpentry business and buy more wood to make stuff.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva tiene 59 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy empeñosa, además de servicial y amable. Su pareja es Ladislao, quien es comerciante y el padre de sus hijos. Viven con dos de sus nietos, su hija y su yerno, en la casa que logró comprar con el apoyo de su pareja. 

Su negocio es el alquiler de juegos de billar y la venta de golosinas y bebidas, para lo que instaló su local en un espacio de su vivienda. Se inició hace más de 2 años, ya tenía mesas de billar que fueron traídas de otra localidad, donde vivían anteriormente. Cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo en la atención al público. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja, además le gusta porque no se aburre. Para el fututo, tiene planes de ampliar su negocio e instalar un local para venta de comida.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP y está muy contenta de saber que cuenta con un apoyo financiero para mantenerse con su negocio. Por tanto se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas como en el crédito anterior.
Con el monto solicitado, de1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en el arreglo de su local; pintará las paredes y comprará más bebidas y golosinas para la venta.
texts.en:
Elva is 59 years old.  She is a hard-working and tenacious woman who is very helpful and kind.  Her partner is Ladislao, who is a salesman and the father of her children.  The couple live with two of their grandchildren, their daughter and son-in-law.  Elva lives in a house that she managed to buy with the support of her partner.

Elva's business is renting out pool tables and selling candies and drinks.  She set up her business in a space in her home.  She started her business more than two years ago.  She already had pool tables which were brought in from another town where she used to live.  She has her husband's help in dealing with her customers.  She considers her business to be fairly profitable because it makes her good profits.  She also likes it because she doesn't get bored.  In the future, she has plans to expand her business and set up premises for selling food.

This is Elva's second loan through MFP and she is happy to know that she has financial support so that she can continue in her business.  She pledges to make her repayments on time as she did with her previous loan.

Elva plans to invest the 1,500 soles she has requested in fixing up her premises.  She will paint the walls and buy more drinks and candies to sell.

loans.use: to paint the walls of her premises and to buy drinks and candies to sell

loans.name: Sok Mon

texts.en: Sok Mon is 28 years old. She is married and resides with her parents and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband runs a taxi service (motor taxi). He earns about $5 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sok Mon is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike to sell. This money will help her husband generate additional income to support their family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to sell

loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Thu is 48 years old. She has two adult children. She raises pigs and grows vegetables for a living. She earns from it 2,800,000 VND a month. This is her first year in SEDA's credit program. In this first loan cycle, she wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to enlarge her pig farm and buy more pig breeds.

loans.use: to enlarge her pig farm and buy more pig breeds.

loans.name: Y's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Y is 46 years old. Her two children are adults. She has been a carpenter for five years. She earns 4,200,000 VND a month from it. This is the first time she has taken part in SEDA’s credit program. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to expand her carpentry business and buy more wood.

Mrs. Minh is 38 years old. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND for her carpentry work.

Mrs. Hoa is 23 years old. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND for her carpentry work.

Mrs. Thinh is 20 years old. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND for her carpentry work.

Mrs. Thuy is 18 years old. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND for her business that sells fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To expand her carpentry business and buy more wood

loans.name: Gulshanoy

texts.en: Gulshanoy is the only breadwinner in her family. She is a widow and brings up her son alone. Some years ago, she had very difficult life. Gulshanoy began her own business to earn a living. She has sold women's underwear for more than 11 years in the local market. She has a wide assortment of goods. As Gulshanoy is a purposeful person, she makes good on all her plans. That’s why she is successful in business. She aims to become more successful in her dealings, and she is asking a loan to buy more goods for developing her business. She awaits your help.

loans.use: To buy goods for the new season

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en: Alberto is an industrious husband and father who operates a farming business. He devotes himself to this business because he wants to raise his family out of poverty. At his age of 43, he knows the difficulties, risks, and harshness in farming. But he keeps on working because this is the only source of income he has. Through his experiences, he now knows the things to do in order to develop his business. Now, he is requesting additional working capital in the amount of PHP 15,000 to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and to pay labor costs. These inputs will be a great help in developing his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Elosy

texts.en:
Elosy is a farmer in Nkubu area of Central and has been in farming for ten years in her rural home area. Her farm produces mainly cereals like sorghum which are sold within the local market. She operates a retail shop business to supplement her farming income. She is married with three children aged between 13 and 2 years.

Elosy has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy a water pump to use in supplying water to her farm. She hopes to improve her farming income and educate her children. She plans to buy more land to expand her farming business.

Elosy says lack of farm inputs and harsh climatic conditions are the major challenges.

loans.use: To buy a water pump

loans.name: Saram

texts.en: Saram is 33 years old. She is married and blessed with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling sizzling cake for more than two years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a taxi driver who earns about $14 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Saram is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase construction materials to build a grocery store. This money will help her get an appropriate place to sell groceries. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase constrcution materials to build a grocery store

loans.name: Sok Nan

texts.en: Sok Nan is 29 years old. She is single and resides with her parents in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for more than six years, earning approximately $12 per day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sok Nan is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Rosas Blancas Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “ROSAS BLANCAS” inicia su segundo ciclo en el Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes donde la señora Lidia es la presidenta.  Las actividades que desarrollan dentro del grupo son distintos, entre ellos tenemos: venta de pasancalla, venta de CD’s y DVD’, confección de mantas y faldas, venta de cachivaches, venta de chocolate, venta de raspadillo, tejido de chompas, venta de dulces. 
La señora Lidia cuenta que hace dos años que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que para esto fue invitada por la promotora; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda distribuidora de huevos, mismo que trabaja hace varios años aprendiendo el mismo de un trabajo anterior.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de huevos por mayor) los que comprarán de la ciudad de Cochabamba y posteriormente lo comercializará en su tienda de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que le gustan las capacitaciones en salud.
texts.en:
The “Rosas Blancas" communal bank is beginning its second loan cycle through the Villa Exaltación regional office. It is made up of eight members, and  Lidia is the chairperson. The livelihoods carried on in the group are varied, and include: selling pasancalla (sweet Bolivian popcorn), selling CD’s and DVD’s, making shawls and skirts, selling knick-knacks, selling chocolate, selling shaved ices, knitting sweaters and selling candy. 

Lidia tells us that she joined a communal bank within Pro Mujer two years ago, and was invited to do so by the field worker. Currently she has a business distributing eggs through her store, work she has been doing for several years, having learned it in a previous job. 

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital (buying eggs at wholesale) which she will purchase in the city of Cochabamba and later sell in her store. 

This form of work helps her family move forward, as she is in a common-law relationship and has two children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the health training.

loans.use: To buy eggs at wholesale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora (who is in the picture with one of her cows) is a resident of Kitale in western Kenya where she lives with her family of four children.  They are between sixteen and five years. She is 45 and has been active in farming for fifteen years. She mostly produces milk. She sells milk, poultry, and horticultural products to the local market. She runs her farm with the help of one farmhand.

Flora has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her boost her poultry business. She ventured into poultry farming with her first loan of 20,000 KES. She now has full confidence in the potential of her business, and this is the main reason why she is seeking a second loan for it. She hopes to double her farming income and meet her family's basic needs more easily.

Flora says animal diseases, market price fluctuations, and the high cost of production are her major challenges.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is married to Emilio, her business partner. They do not have any children and still wish to have a child someday. The couple is engaged in furniture making, and so far they can say their business is doing well, as they help each other.

Margarita wants to improve their business. This is why she is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 18,000 that they can use as additional capital. They are planning to use the loan to purchase wood and other materials needed in furniture making. 

Margarita has a principle in life: “You have to stick to one business and die for it if you really want to succeed.”   That really shows her strong determination to work hard, for she wants to save for their future.

loans.use: To purchase wood and other materials needed in furniture making

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en: Gerardo 58, has been engaged in the farming business for over 25 years. Throughout these years, he recognized the hardship of operating this business. He almost retired but when he thought of the welfare of his family, he felt guilty because he had promised to make their living situation better. And to achieve this easier, he is requesting additional working capital in the amount of PHP 15,000. The funds would be used to purchase fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for labor cost. He hopes that this amount will let his business grow in order to meet his promise to his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Srey Mom

texts.en: Srey Mom is 47 years old. She is married and blessed with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in rice cultivation and animal fattening for more than twenty years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a farm worker who earns about $2 per day. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about $4 per day. In order to improve her farming work, Srey is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a hardworking man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been operating a retail business for a period of 8 years. He started with capital he earned from agriculture where he harvested maize and sold it at a very good price. He says that price fluctuation is a factor affecting the business. He would like to educate his children and expand his business into new markets. Stephen wants a loan to buy sugar and salt for sale.

loans.use: to buy sugar and salt for sale

loans.name: Flor De Chijini Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “FLOR DE CHIJINI” inicia su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por siete integrantes donde la señora María Magdalena es la presidenta.  Las actividades que desarrollan dentro del grupo son distintos, entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, venta de masitas, tejido de mantas, venta de joyas, tejido de mantas de alpaca. 
La señora María Magdalena cuenta que es la primera vez que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que para esto fue invitada por una promotora; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda en general, mismo que trabaja hace varios años.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de arroz, azúcar y aceites) los que comprarán de las ferias tradicionales de El Alto y posteriormente lo venderá en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que le gusta el área de salud y los ahorros.
En la fotografía podemos observar que acompaña al grupo la señora Mária la que esta vestida de chompa ploma quiso participar en la toma de la fotografía
texts.en:
The “Flor de Chijini" communal bank is beginning its first loan cycle through the Villa Adela regional office. It is made up of seven members, and María Magdalena is the chairperson. The livelihoods carried on by the group members are varied, and include: neighborhood store, selling masitas, weaving shawls, selling jewelry, and weaving alpaca shawls.  

María Magdalena tells us that this is the first time she has joined a communal bank within Pro Mujer, and that she was invited to do so by a field worker. Currently she has a general store business, work she has been doing for several years.

The loan she is getting now is to increase her working capital by buying rice, sugar and cooking oil, which she will buy at the traditional markets of El Alto, then later sell at her store. This form of work supports her family in moving foward in life, as she is single, and has four children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health clinic and the savings program.

In the photo we can see María accompanying the group. She is wearing a lead grey sweater, and wanted to participate in the taking of the photo.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a thirty-three-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of educating his children up to the university level since he did not have a chance to go to school. He has been in the transport business for four years and is facing hardships due to high fuel and transportation costs. However, he has a vision of expanding his business to new markets and owning at least three motorcycles. Vincent needs a loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: San

texts.en: San is 60 years old. She is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice for more than twenty years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $6 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, San is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for carrying vegetables to sell. This money will help her run an additional business and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for carrying vegetables to sell

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
San is 39 years old. He has two adult children. He raises cattle and sells it to the beef market. He earns from it 4,200,000 VND a month. He has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2011. The last cycle, he borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, he wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to enlarge his cattle farming business size and to buy more cattle breeds.
There are two other group members. Mr. Trang is 35 years old. He wants to borrow 6,944,000 VND to raise chickens and their eggs. 
Mrs. Hoc is 29 years old. She wants to borrow 6,944,000 VND to raise poultry.

loans.use: to enlarge his cattle farming business size and to buy more cattle breeds.

loans.name: Digna Emerita

texts.es:
Digna tiene 45 años de edad, vive en unión libre, tiene 2 hijos y vive en la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
Doña Digna es una señora muy trabajadora, ella inicio su propio negocio hace 2 años una pulpería y también elabora tortillas para la venta. En la pulpería vende productos de la canasta básica como arroz, harina maseca, huevos, azúcar, manteca, refrescos y abarrotes. Se motivo a dedicarse a su propio negocio en la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos ya que el salario de el no es suficiente para cubrir las necesidades diarias. 
Ella por cuatro veces consecutivas a tenido 4 prestamos son Odef, y actualmente a solicitado otro de 10,500 para compra de productos alimenticios como carne, queso, jugos,  granos, y productos de abarrotes, espera surtir y aumentar su inventario para que las ganancias sean buenas.
La meta que tiene Digna es que sus hijos continúen estudiando y en el futuro poder construir su casa de material de (bloque).
texts.en:
Digna, age 45, is in a common-law marriage and has two children.  She lives in the city of San Pedro Sula.  Digna is a very hard-working woman.  She started her own business, a grocery store, two years ago.  She also makes tortillas to sell.  In the grocery store she sells basic needs items like rice, flour, instant corn flour, eggs, sugar, lard, soft drinks, and other groceries.

The motive for working in her own business is the need to help her husband with the expenses.  His salary is not enough to cover the daily needs.

She has had four consecutive loans from ODEF.  She is currently requesting another for 10,500 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy food products like meat, cheese, juices, grains, and other grocery products.  She hopes to stock and increase her inventory so that her earnings will be good.

Digna’s goals are for her students to continue their education and to, in the future, be able to build her house from cement block.

loans.use: to buy food products like meat, cheese, juices, grains, and other grocery products in order to stock her store.

loans.name: Rwebijoka Muhumuza Group

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 42 year old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of educating his children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification. He has been in a food selling business for the last ten years. He is facing hardships of price fluctuations and inflation. However, he has a vision of diversifying his business to include home use products. 

Godfrey needs a loan to buy foodstuffs such as bananas and cabbages to sell. He is a member of the group in the photo above; each member guarantees the others in accessing a loan. Godfrey is the one holding a yellow envelope.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs such as bananas and cabbages for resale.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny is 51 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband runs a business of selling traditional Khmer medicines. He earns about $3 per day. Two of her children are employed. They earn about $8 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s prospects, Ny is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a tuk-tuk, a three-wheeled vehicle, for her husband to run a taxi service. This purchase will help her husband generate additional income to support the family. In the future, Ny would like to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a "tuk-tuk" for her husband to run a taxi service

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a 48-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of educating his children up to the university. He has been a farmer for the last 10 years and with the proceeds, he has been able to educate his children and build a house. His main hardship is inadequate capital to modernize his farming activities, and his vision is to diversify his business to include a retail shop. 

Elias needs a loan to  buy agro-chemicals for use in his gardens so as to increase his yields for this season.

loans.use: to buy agro-chemicals for use in his gardens.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Dilbar is a brainy and knowledgeable woman. She likes to work hard. For more than 20 years, she has been working as a businesswoman in the local market. Dilbar’s colleagues know her as a kind and smart person. She has a lot of experience in selling cloth. She sells different kinds of women's fabrics. Many women like to make dresses from cloth sold by Dilbar. 

Dilbar is married. Her husband is also a businessman. They have a son. He is 23 years old. Dilbar and her husband do their best for their son. Dilbar wants to develop her business. She is asking for a loan to buy goods for the new season. She awaits your help.

loans.use: To buy goods for the new season

loans.name: Davy

texts.en:
Davy is 30 years old. She is single and resides with two sisters and one brother in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than seven years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her sisters and brother are employed. They are a garment worker, a hair dresser and a teacher. Approximately, they earn $13 per day.

 In order to improve her family’s finances, Davy is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more equipment for her sister to expand her hair salon. This money will help her earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a clothing shop and rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment for her sister to expand her hair salon

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 36-year-old gentleman living in Kagadi, Uganda. He deals in metal fabrication, and he has been running the business for 7 years. He started by buying machines with capital he got from his father.  Now the business is at its boom stage. He says that inadequate capital and high transport costs are affecting the business. He would like to educate his children and expand his business to new markets. Moses wants a loan to buy metals for use in his fabrication work.

loans.use: to buy metals for use in his fabrication work.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika tiene 29 años, es una mujer emprendedora y  trabajadora. Su pareja es Antonio, el padre de sus dos hijos: Maryori de 11 y Estefany de 4 años, viven en una casa alquilada.
Ella es estilista, realiza servicio de manicure y pedicura, cortes y peinados de, oficio que aprendió en un centro de educación ocupacional. Lleva dedicándose a esta actividad un año y la realiza en un ambiente que acondicionó en su vivienda. Cuenta con la ayuda de dos personas, a quienes les paga diariamente.
