Considera a su actividad bastante rentable, por las buenas vagancias que le deja, siendo sus servicios muy solicitados por lo bien que lo hace y además, le gusta su actividad. Para el futuro, tiene planes de ampliar y abrir una tienda de pasamanería.

Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP y está contenta de saber que cuenta con un poyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Por tanto se compromete a ser responsable con el  pago de sus cuotas para tener un buen récord crediticio.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de materiales para el arreglo de su local; como espejos, máquinas para el corte de cabello y otros, de esa manera tendrá un ambiente más cómodo para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Erika, 29, is an enterprising, hardworking woman.  Her partner is Antonio, the father of her two children, Maryori, 11, and Estefany, 4.  They live in a rented house.

Erika is a hair stylist; she provides manicures, pedicures, haircuts and hair styling.  She learned the occupation in an occupational educational center.  She’s been in this line of work for a year and carries it out in a space set aside at home to do so.  She has two helpers who she pays daily.  She feels that her work is quite profitable because it produces good profits since here services are in high demand because of the good work she does.  In addition, she likes her work.  In the future she has expansion plans to open a notions shop.

This is her third loan from MFP and she’s happy to know that she can count on financial support to reach her goals.  She commits, therefore, to be responsible with the installment payments in order to establish a good credit history.

She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy supplies to fix up her salon like mirrors, hair clippers and others in order to have a more comfortable environment for her customers.

loans.use: to buy equipment and supplies for her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy dairy goats

loans.name: Damianus

texts.en: Damianus is a thirty-seven-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of building a permanent house for residence. He has been running a school for the last six years. His main hardship is inadequate capital to purchase all the necessary equipment for the school. Damianus has a vision of moving his business to a more permanent location. Damianus needs a loan to buy school equipment such as desks and chairs for the classrooms.

loans.use: to buy school equipment such as desks and chairs for the classrooms.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Mrs. Huong is 32 years old. She has three children who are little. They are studying at kindergarten and primary school. She raises cattle and sells them to the beef market. She earns 4,800,000 VND per month from the business. She has participated in the loan program of SEDA since 2010. Last cycle, she borrowed 6,944,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to enlarge her cattle farm and buy more cattle breeds. Then, she hopes her business will bring in enough money for her children’s education fees.

loans.use: to enlarge her cattle farm and buy more cattle breeds.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 61 años, es una mujer sencilla y con mucha paciencia. Vive sola en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Chilca.   
Desde hace 8 años trabaja en el cuidado de niños menores de 4 años, a los que con mucho amor mira crecer. Tiene una guardería, la cual a parte de ser su negocio recibe algo de apoyo del gobierno porque forma parte de uno de sus proyectos, pero Bertha no solo hace lo que le pide el proyecto, si no que cuida más tiempo a los niños y se preocupa de su bienestar mientras están a su cuidado. Pero como es una mujer muy trabajadora, y sobre todo creativa, también realiza tejidos y bordados a mano, como gorras, chalinas, guantes y medias. Los pobladores de su localidad ya la conocen y siempre le hacen pedidos. A pesar de no tener compañía, pues sus hijos ya crecieron y conformaron sus propias familias, ella ve en los niños que cuida a sus hijos. 

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y espera concretar sus planes con este apoyo financiero. Por otro lado, promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos. Y le agrada ser parte de su grupo porque todos los integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Bertha invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de pintura para pared, además de diversos juguetes para la estimulación de los niños, ya que remodelará su guardería.
texts.en:
Bertha is 61-year-old and is a patient and down-to-earth woman.  She lives alone in the house she owns which is located in the town of Chilca.

She has worked in child care for eight years with children up to four-years-old who she watches grow up with great love.  She has a daycare which, in addition to being her business, also receives some support from the government because it is part of one of its projects.  However, Bertha doesn’t just do what the project asks of her, but also cares for the children for more time and worrys about their well-being while they are in her care.  Because she is a hard-working, and above all else creative, woman, she also does knitting and embroidery like hats, scarves, gloves, and leggings.  The inhabitants of her area know her and always make orders.  In spite of not having company because her children are grown and have their own families, she sees them in the children she cares for.

This is her second loan with MFP and she hopes to finalize her plans with this financial support.  She promises to follow through with her payments as she did in previous loans and she is thankful to be part of her group because all of the members are responsible and committed to each other.

Bertha will invest the money she is requesting in paint for the walls as well as various toys to entertain and stimulate the children, as she is remodeling the daycare.

loans.use: to buy paint to repair her business location and toys for the children.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 37 años, es una mujer con mucha experiencia en los negocios, además de ser alegre y amable. Su pareja es Jair, quien es comerciante y padre de sus tres hijos: Clara de 18 años, Tarsis de 11 años y Winy de 10 años. Juntos viven en la casa que le prestó su tío, pues él está fuera del país.

Su actividad es la elaboración y venta de muebles de madera. Para eso alquila un taller para cortar la madera y armar los muebles, pero parte del acabado lo realiza en su casa, donde le da los toques finales como lijados y laqueados. Se inició con una máquina de corte de madera que compró con sus ahorros, y ya está en el negocio hace más de un año, contado con el apoyo de su pareja para la elaboración de muebles. Pero para aumentar sus ingresos, su pareja, en sus ratos libres, se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en motocarro. Considera que su negocio es bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja, con las cuales puede pagar los gastos del hogar, y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos. Antes de iniciar con este negocio le era difícil solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos. Sus planes a futuro son de ampliar su negocio e instalar su propio taller en casa.

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto cuenta con este financiamiento para cumplir con sus objetivos. Se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, para tener un buen record crediticio.
Con el monto solicitado, de 3000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de materiales para la elaboración y el acabado de sus muebles; como madera, thinner, laca y un cortador de madera manual valorizado en 380 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María, 37, is a woman with much business experience in addition to being cheerful and kind.  Her partner is Jair who is a merchant and the father of their three children: Clara, 18, Tarsis, 11 and Wini, 10.  They live together in a house their uncle lent them since he’s abroad.

Her activity is manufacturing and selling wood furniture.  To do so she leases a workshop to cut the lumber and assemble the furniture but she does some of the finishing touches like sanding and lacquering at home.  She started out with a wood cutting machine she bought with her savings and she’s been in business for over a year now with support from her partner who works providing passenger transportation services with a car.  She deems that her business is quite profitable because of the profits it produces that she can use to pay household expenses and to provide a good education for her children.  Before starting this business it was difficult to cover all household and educational expenses.  Her plan for the future is to expand the business and set up her own workshop at home.

This is her first loan with MFP so she now has support from this loan to reach her goals.  She commits to make her installment payments in order to establish a good credit history.

She will use the requested 3000 new soles to buy supplies needed to manufacture the furniture like lumber, lacquer and a handsaw valued at 380 new soles.

loans.use: to buy lumber to make furniture.

loans.name: Thanh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh is 25 years old. She is a carpenter. She earns  3,800,000 VND per month from her job. She has participated in the loan program of SEDA since 2010. Last cycle, she borrowed 6,944,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 7,840,000 VND to enlarge her carpentry studio.

 Mrs. Vinh is 52 years old. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to raise cattle.

 Mrs. Bac is 50 years old. She wants to borrow 7,840,000 VND to raise ducks.

loans.use: to enlarge her carpentry studio

loans.name: Guard

texts.en: Guard is a thirty-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of educating his children up to university level. He has been a teacher for the last seven years and is very proud of his profession. He has a vision of buying land to grow crops so as to supplement his salary. Guard wants the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en: Mrs. Dung is 58 years old. She has four children who are adults. She has a grocery store. She earns 4,100,000 VND per month from it. She has participated in the loan program of SEDA since 2010. Last cycle, she borrowed 7,840,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,736,000 VND to enlarge her grocery store and become a poultry supplier.

loans.use: to enlarge her grocery store and become a poultry supplier.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es: Maria tiene 50 años vive en el Guasmo con su familia. Su esposo es chofer profesional juntos tienen 4 hijos todos mayores de edad. En su casa Maria tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende principalmente agua, colas, jugos hace 3 años lo inicio con el afán de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Su esposo fue quien le dio el capital con el cual compro solo colas, le fue bien ya que ofreció variedad vendiendo en todas las presentaciones, poco a poco fue aumentando el inventario comprando más productos. Como su esposo realiza carreras el negocio lo atiende ella y como está ubicado en la parte frontal abre todos los días de lunes a domingo. En el caso de cerrar sus clientes llaman y vende por la ventana, lo importante es dar el servicio para mantener a sus clientes. Este es el segundo crédito de Maria y la empleara en la compra de colas, jugos, snacks y golosinas para incrementar sus ventas ya que sus perchas están vacías. Como ya tiene experiencia en créditos será puntual en los pagos porque en el futuro le gustaría comprar otro carro para dar servicio de taxi.
texts.en:
María, 50, lives in El Guasmo with her family.  Her husband is a professional driver and they have four children who are all adults.  

María has a small store at home where she mainly sells water, colas and juice.  She started it three years ago aiming to help her husband with household expenses.  Her husband gave her the capital she used to buy colas.  She did well since she offered a variety in all presentations.  Gradually she increased inventory buying more products.  

Because her husband goes on runs she tends to the store and since it’s located in the front part she opens every day from Monday through Sunday.  If she closes her customers call her and she sells from the window; what’s important is to provide the service in order to retain her customers.

This is María’s second loan and she will use it to buy colas, juice, snacks and sweets to increase sales because her shelves are empty.  Since she already has experience with loans she’ll be punctual with her payments because in future she’d like to purchase another car to provide taxi services.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Nancy Alexandra

texts.es: Nancy tiene una casa propia ubicada en el Fortín zona sur urbana de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento cuenta con el servicio de luz, en este sector es muy común la falta de agua potable por tuberías sus habitantes la compran por tanqueros. A pesar de todo esto Nancy tiene un pequeño atelier de costura el cual empezó hace 7 años con la ayuda de su esposo quien le compro su primera máquina de coser. En la actualidad cuenta con una maquina industrial la cual compro con un crédito anterior, una recubridora y mesa de corte. El trabajo lo realiza desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, a veces sola o contratando de manera casual a una persona. Sus principales confecciones son uniformes de colegios, de empresas, deportivos y vestidos, confecciona por cantidades altas entre 300 a 100 prendas, dependiendo del pedido. El mayor inconveniente de Nancy es que en su sector hay problemas de luz por lo que esta falla con frecuencia haciendo que pierda tiempo e incurriendo en posibles daños para sus artefactos. El préstamo lo empleara en la compra de telas, hilos para su atelier, también va a comprar bloques, cemento, arena para la ampliación de su casa ya que su esposo va a abrir una tienda de víveres. A futuro le gustaría terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en: Nancy owns her own home in El Fortín, an area in the southern urban zone of Guayaquil.  Her house is made of cement and has electricity.  In this area it is common to not have good drinking water from the tap so the inhabitants buy it from tanker trucks.  In spite of everything, Nancy has a small sewing workshop which she began with the help of her husband who bought Nancy her first sewing machine seven years ago.  Currently she has an industrial sewing machine that she bought with a previous loan, an upholstery machine, and a cutting table.  She works from eight in the morning to eight at night, sometimes by herself and sometimes informally hiring someone.  Her main orders are uniforms for schools, businesses, and sports as well as dresses.  She makes quantities between 300 and 100 garments, depending on the order.  Her biggest inconvenience is that in her area there are problems with the electricity and it goes out with some frequency, making her lose time and potentially damaging her equipment.  The loan will be used to buy fabrics and threads for her workshop and to buy concrete blocks, cement, and sand to expand her house so that her husband can open a grocery store.  In the future she would like to finish building her house.

loans.use: fabrics and threads for her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Epifanía Group

texts.es:
Este es el segundo crédito que solicita Keylin y su grupo Banco Mujer Epifanía, ella tiene 19 años, es estudiante, y este año finaliza la secundaria, ella tiene muchas ganas de superar y su meta a corto plazo es poder pagarse los estudios universitarios, por eso sigue trabajando con mucho empeño en su negocio que es la venta de ropa Y bisutería. Su meta más importante es convertirse en una profesional, y ayudar a su familia que le ha dado todo hasta ahora. 
El crédito fue muy importante para su negocio ya que le permitió invertir en capital de trabajo, contar con mas mercadería y así aumentar su cartera de clientes. 
En el grupo están 2 socias más que van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
This is the second loan that Keylin and her communal bank, Banco Mujer Epifanía, have requested.  She is a 19 year old student.  She will complete high school this year.  She has a great desire to excel, and her short term goal is to be able to pay for her university studies.

That is why she keeps working with great determination in her business, selling clothes and jewelry.  Her most important goal is to become a professional and to help her family, who has given her everything so far.

The loan was very important for her business.  It allowed her to invest work capital, to have more merchandise, and to increase her customer portfolio.

There are two more members in the group.  They are going to invest in farming activities.

loans.use: to buy clothes and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Fanny Yessenia

texts.es: Fanny vive en Quevedo desde que nació y se dedica a la venta de comida preparada. Empezó hace 5 años y el impulso se lo brindaron su propia familia, Fanny cuenta que sucedió una mañana cuando preparando el desayuno a su familia le dijeron que hacia unas tortillas muy ricas y debería vender, con esto un día compro los ingredientes necesarios y empezó a vender frente a su domicilio tomando en cuenta que si le iba bien continuaba con él. Para su sorpresa tuvo mucha acogida y con la ayuda de su familia compro una mesa mas varios utensilios empezando el negocio. Lo atiende sola ya que es quien cocina los productos, cobrando y atendiendo a los clientes, en su venta ofrece tortillas, muchines, corviches los cuales puede acompañar con cola y ají casero. Con el crédito Fanny comprara una mesa, sillas y un parasol que necesita para un mejor servicio. Su sueño es abrir un restaurant en un local porque desde que inicio la venta de comida ha podido darle un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Fanny has lived in Quevedo since she was born; she works selling prepared food.  She started five years ago having been motivated by her very family.  

Fanny relates that it all came about one morning when she was preparing breakfast and her family told her that she made delicious tortillas and should sell them.  So based on this one day she bought the necessary ingredients and started selling in front of her house keeping in mind that if she did well she’d continue doing it.  

Much to her surprise she was very well received and with help from her family she bought a table and several utensils to start the business.  She tends to it by herself since she’s the one that cooks, collects payment and takes care of customers.  She sells tortillas, ‘muchines’ [deep-fried, cheese-stuffed manioc balls] and ‘corviches’ [deep-fried, fish-stuffed plantain balls] that can be accompanied by a cola and home-made hot sauce.

Fanny will use her loan to buy a table, chairs and an umbrella she needs in order to provide better service.  Her dream is to open a restaurant in a locale because since she started to sell food she’s been able to give her family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a table, chairs and an umbrella.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 53-year-old married man with seven children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda.  He is in the business of buying and selling agricultural commodities and has used his profits to educate his children and buy land.

He faces problems like price fluctuations and inflation, and at times lacks adequate funds to purchase enough of a particular commodity when demand is very high. 

Richard's personal goal is to buy a vehicle to make transportation easier for himself, while his business goals are to expand his business into new market area and to diversify his business to include groundnuts and sorghum.  Richard plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy coffee that he will resell.

loans.use: to buy coffee to resell

loans.name: Martha Maria

texts.es: En la Coop 5 de junio sector de Duran vive Martha quien es manicurista. El negocio la emprendió observando a su papa quien es peluquero, siendo él quien le enseño el corte principalmente de caballeros. Cuando termino sus estudios secundarios tomo la decisión de aprender belleza teniendo el apoyo de sus padres, ahora s sus 32 años siendo madre soltera de 3 niños hizo de aprendizaje su forma de vida. Como no tiene los recursos para abrir un gabinete de belleza realiza el trabajo a familiares y amigos en su casa. Martha indica no tener horario trabajo porque acude cuando le solicitan. Como debe trasladarse su mayor preocupación es la delincuencia ya que se sector es un poco peligroso, pero con Dios a su cuidado espera no tener problemas. Con el crédito comprara esmaltes, acetonas, limas y cremas para el uso y venta. Martha indica que en 5 años se visualiza administrando un comedor ubicado en la calle principal de su domicilio ya que esa es su pasión.
texts.en:
Martha, who is a manicurist, lives in the Coop 5 de Junio sector in Duran.  She started the business observing her father who is a barber.  He taught her to cut hair, especially men’s.  When she finished secondary school she made the decision to learn beauty since she had her parents’ support.  Now, at the age of 32 and being a single mother of three children she turned her skills into her way of life.

Because she does not have the resources necessary to open a beauty salon she does work for family members or friends at home.  Martha indicates that she does not have a fixed work schedule because she works when it’s requested of her.  Because she must go from place to place, her greatest concern is crime because her sector is a bit dangerous but with God’s help she hopes to be problem-free.

She will use the loan to buy nail polish, acetone, emery boards and cream to use and to sell.  Martha indicates that she sees herself in five years running an eatery located in her town’s main street since this is her passion.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, acetone, emery boards and cream.

loans.name: Jessica Alexandra

texts.es: En Playas vive Jessica quien tiene una tienda de víveres. A sus 24 años siendo estando soltera por lo que vive con sus padres ya que tiene un hijo de 2 años que cuidar. La tienda que actualmente administra era de su madre pero se lo designo como una manera de ganar dinero para sus gastos. Abre las puertas de su negocio a las 8 de la mañana y cierra a las 6 de la tarde atendiendo mientras cuida  a su hijo. Ofrece los productos como vivieres, confitería, colas, snack, arroz, azúcar, aceite etc. Tiene fe y confianza que le ira tan bien como a su mama en el negocio ya que tiene la ventaja de la clientela para quienes ya es conocida. Con el crédito comprara productos para la venta esperando obtener las ganancias necesarias para cubrir las cuotas del crédito y empezar a arreglar su casa
texts.en:
Jessica who has a grocery store lives in Playas.  At the age of 24, she’s single and living with her parents but has a two-year-old son in her care.  The store she runs used to be her mother’s but she passed it down to her as a way for her to earn money for her expenses.  

She opens the store’s doors at 8am and closes at 6pm tending to it while watching her son.  She offers such products as groceries, sweets, soft-drinks, snacks, rice, sugar, oil, etc.  

She has faith and trusts that she’ll do as well as her mother did in the business since she has the advantage that she’s already known to her clientele.  She will use the loan to buy products to sell hoping to obtain the profits needed to make her installment payments and to start fixing up her house.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 30-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of building a permanent house for his family to live in. He has been a farmer for 6 years, and his main hardship is inadequate capital to purchase farming inputs. He has a vision of diversifying his business to include a retail shop.  Moses needs the loan to buy agricultural inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a twenty-seven-year-old married man with one child, living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

He is hoping to generate a secure, stable and sustainable income for his family.  For three years he has been in the motorcycle transport business and Edward also owns a retail shop.   

With the ambition of increasing his income sources, he wants to buy more stock such as sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Mikole Twimuke Group

texts.en:
Mary is 52 year old married woman with seven children, living in Kyegegwa, Kyenjojo.

She is a farmer for ten years.  Mary specifically growing Irish potatoes.  She started with a small garden and she adding kept on season after season.

Mary is faced with the problems of seasonal weather changes like drought which affects her output, inadequate capital to purchase farm inputs and above all...price fluctuations and inflation.

She has a personal goal of educating her children and building a permanent home residence.

Her business goals include buying land to grow crops and hiring employees to help expand the business.

Mary wants a loan to pay workers who are weeding her Irish potato garden.

She is a member of the group where each member guarantees the entire loan.

loans.use: to pay workers who are weeding her Irish potato garden.

loans.name: Maximiliano Floresmilo

texts.es: Maximiliano tiene 52 años y es mecánico graduado. Desde joven supo lo que quería ser en el futuro es por esto que sus padres lo apoyaron cuando decidió seguir mecánica, puso mucho empeño aprendiendo porque le gusta y ahora es su forma de vida. Vive en Playas y desde hace 20 años tiene su taller de mecánica automotriz ubicado en su domicilio, tiene gran cantidad de clientes sobre todo porque lo conocían de cuando ayudaba a su padre. Actualmente sus ayudantes son sus hijos a quienes le está enseñando el oficio, realiza la labor todos los días sin horario definido de tiempo ya que lo más importante para él es terminar con el trabajo. El préstamo lo está solicitando para la compra de herramientas de trabajo ya que le gustaría tener un ayudante para dar mejor servicio y tener más clientes.
texts.en:
Maximiliano, 52, graduated as a mechanic.  Since he was young he knew what he wanted to do in the future and this is why his parents supported him when he decided to study auto mechanics.  He put much dedication into learning because he likes it and now it’s his way of life.

He’s lived in Playas for 20 years and has his auto repair shop at home.  He has a large number of customers because everyone knows him from when he used to help his father.  His children who he’s teaching the occupation to are his main helpers at present.  

He works every day with no fixed schedule since what’s most important for him is to complete the job.  The loan he’s asking for is to buy work tools because he’d like to have helper to provide better service and have more customers.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Landy Graciela

texts.es: Landy es una madre trabajadora de 27 años quien tiene un puesto de venta de zapatos en el mercado de Libertad. Empezó este negocio hace 7 años cuando la venta la realizaba en la vía pública, con la regeneración de la ciudad se vio en la obligación de alquilar un puesto evitando de esta manera que le cierren el negocio. Landy se siente muy contenta ya que al ser sola a logrado sacar adelante a su hijo y su negocio, eso lo satisface porque la convierte en una mujer de negocios exitosa. Su mayor temor es enfermarse porque no tiene ayuda y necesitaría cerrar lo que la haría perder dinero. Con el préstamo que solicita comprar 200 sandalias de mujer, 200 zapatos de caballeros y 300 zapatos de niños.
texts.en:
Landy is a hardworking, 27-year-old mother.  She has a stand to sell shoes in the market in Libertad.  She started this business seven years ago selling in the public streets but with urban renewal she was required to lease a stand thus avoiding having her business shut down.

Landy feels happy because even though she’s alone she’s succeeded in moving her son and her business forward; this gives her satisfaction because it turns her into a successful businesswoman.  Her greatest fear is becoming ill because he has no help and she’d have to close which would lead to her losing money.

She will use the requested loan to buy 200 women’s sandals, 200 men’s shoes and 300 children’s shoes.

loans.use: to buy shoes for men and women.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alicia Luisa

texts.es: Alicia tiene 34 años vive en Guayaquil en la Coop. Vergeles ubicada en las Orquídeas, tiene una mini tienda donde vende cd y papelería.  Empezó el negocio hace 3 años luego de separarse de su esposo  ya que necesitaba tener un ingreso para los gastos de sus hijos. En la atención la ayudan sus hijos cuando no se encuentran en la escuela, esto le beneficia porque de esta manera los puede cuidar y atender con las tareas. El negocio lo abre desde las 6:30 hasta las 9 de la noche. Lo que más vende en es cuadernos, plumas, borradores, los útiles escolares por la época estudiantil. Este es el segundo crédito que solicita y espera le valla tan bien como en el otro con el que pudo empezar el negocio. Este crédito lo empleara en la compra de tarjetas, cuadernos, algunos víveres y cd´s. Como la casa donde vive Alicia es alquilada a futuro le gustaría comprar una casa para no pagar arriendo.
texts.en:
Alicia, age 34, live in Guayaquil in the Vergeles Cooperative in Orquídeas.  She has a mini-store where she sells CDs and stationery.  She started the business three years ago after separating from her husband.  She needed to have an income for her children’s expenses.

Her children help her in the business when they are not in school.  This helps her because she can take care of them and see about their homework.  The business is open from 6:30 a.m. until 9:00 p.m.  The things that sell the most are notebooks, pens, erasers, the school supplies during the school season.

This is the second loan that she has requested.  She hopes it goes as well for her as the other one with which she was able to start the business.  She will use the loan to buy cards, notebooks, some supplies, and CDs.  

As the house where Alicia lives is rented, she would like to buy a house in the future so that she does not have to pay rent.

loans.use: to buy cards, notebooks, some supplies, and CDs.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa is 40 years old. She has two adut children. She has sold fruit and construction material for 11 years. She earns from it 4,500,000 VND a month. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 6,944,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to buy construction material. Then, she hopes she can earn enough to buy a car for carrying material to sell.

loans.use: to buy construction material.

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.en:
Jurabek likes to work hard. He is reasoned, purposeful and intelligent and hard work helps him succeed.  

He has more than 36 years experience in the livestock businesss. Jurabek raises animals and than sells them to local people.  He says his animals are fat and clean.  

Jurabek's wife is a very kind woman and always tries to do her best for her family.  Their six children love them very much. 

Jurabek wants to develop his business and that’s why he is asking for a loan to buy livestock.  He awaits your help.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Landus

texts.en:
Landus is a twenty-six year old married man with two children, living in Kasese, Uganda.

He has been operating a retail shop for nine years.  Landus started with 200,000 shillings and now has 3,000,000 shillings as working capital.

His hardships are high taxes, inadequate capital to purchase enough stock, price fluctuation and inflation.

Landus' personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent house for his family. 

Business goals are buying land to grow crops and moving his business to a more permanent location. Landus wants money to buy sodas, sugar, salt, beer and paraffin to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas, sugar, salt, beers and paraffin to sell.

loans.name: Chinh

texts.en:
Chinh is 30 years old. She has three young children who are learning at a local kindergarten and primary school. 

Chinh is a carpenter and a rice milling worker.  She earns 3,900,000 VND per month.  

She has participated in SEDA crediting program since 2010.  During the last loan cycle, she borrowed 7,840,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. 

In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,736,000 VND to make furniture to sell. 

Chinh hopes her business will generate get enough money to pay her children’ education fees, enlarge her carpentry studio and build her house.

loans.use: to make furniture to sell.

loans.name: Badru

texts.en:
Badru is a 39-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of educating his children and building a permanent house for a residence. 

He has a transport business; with the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his children. He faces hardships of high fuel and transportation costs; however, he has a vision of buying land to grow crops and boosting his transport business by buying more taxis.

Badru needs a loan to  buy tires for the vehicle.

loans.use: o buy tires for the vehicle.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Mrs. Chinh is 26 years old. She has two children who are little. They are learning at kindergarten and primary school. 

She raises pigs and sells fruits in the market. She earns from her jobs 4,200,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) per month. She has participated in the crediting program of SEDA since 2010. The last loan cycle, she borrowed 6,944,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. 

In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to raise more pigs and buy more fruits to resell. Then, she hopes her business could get enough money for her children’ education fees.

loans.use: to raise more pigs and buy more fruits to resell. Then, she hopes her business could get enough money for her children’ education fees.

loans.name: Susana Elizabeth

texts.es: Susana tiene 3 años atendiendo su negocio de abarrotes, lo inicio cuando se separa de su esposo y deseaba aprender un negocio para poder sostener a su familia. Vive en las orquídeas sector norte de Guayaquil donde tiene su casa propia contando con los servicios básicos. Abre sus puertas a las 7 de la mañana y cierra a las 7 de la noche, la atención es personalizada es decir ella atiende y cobra. Ofrece varios productos como colas, productos personales, de limpieza, aceite y papelería. Con el crédito Susana comprara una puerta enrollable ya que va adecuar su negocio, una ventana de hierro y mercadería. Su sueño inmediato es terminar la construcción de su local haciendo más espacioso.
texts.en:
Susana has been running her grocery store for three years.  She started when she separated from her husband and wanted to learn a business to support her family.  She lives in the Las Orquídeas sector in north Guayaquil where she has her house that has basic utilities.

She opens the doors at 7am and closes at 7pm; attention is personalized, that is it is she who tends to customers and collects payment.  She stocks products like soft-drinks, personal products, cleaning supplies, oil and stationery supplies.

Susana will use the loan to buy a roll-up gate and a metal window because she’s going to remodel her store and to buy merchandise.  Her short-term goal is to finish building the locale making it more spacious.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a twenty-nine year old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda.

He has run a retail shop for one year.  Samuel started with 400,000 shillings and now has 1,200,000 shillings as working capital.  His hardships are customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to purchase stock.  Samuel wants money to buy sugar, salt and soap to sell.

Personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent house.  He also hopes to move his business to a more permanent location and own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Allens

texts.en:
Allens is a forty year old married man with six children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has run a retail shop for one year.  His hardships are inadequate capital to purchase enough stock, price fluctuations and inflation.

Allens' personal goals are to educate his children and building a permanent home.

His business goals are to diversify his business, buying land to grow crops and moving his business to more permanent location.

Allens wants money to buy sugar, salt, soap and paraffin to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, soap and paraffin to sell.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert is a twenty-six year old single man living in Kasese, Uganda.  He has been selling produce for three years.  He began with three bags of millet and now has fifty bags.  His hardships are seasonal weather, inadequate capital to purchase enough stock, price fluctuation and inflation.  Gilbert's personal goals are to buy a car and build a permanent home.  Gilbert wants money to buy millet grain to sell.

loans.use: to buy millet grain to sell.

loans.name: Bright

texts.en:
Bright is a 35 year old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda.  He has been in the produce business for two years.  He started with 300,000 shillings and now has 10,000,000 shillings as working capital.  

His hardships are seasonal weather, inadequate capital to purchase stock, price fluctuation and inflation.  Bright's personal goals to educate his children, buy a car and saving for a wedding. 

Bright's business goals include buying land to grow crops, moving his business to more permanent location and expanding his business into new markets.  Bright wants money to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.pt:
Solteira sem filhos, vive na casa própria e não tem dependentes a não ser os seus empregados que ajudam no seu negócio. 	
Tem um negócio próprio de criação e venda de frangos, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar pintos, ração, vitaminas, vacinas para aumentar a quantidade de frangos.
No futuro deseja desenvolver mais o seu negócio aumentando cada vez mais a sua criação, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo segundo o calendário para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a saturação do mercado e por vezes doenças que atacam as aves.
texts.en:
She's single and doesn't have any children. She lives in a house she owns and has no dependants except for the employees who help her in the business.
She runs her own business raising and selling chickens. With the current loan she intends to purchase chicks, feed, vitamins and vaccines in order to increase the quantity of chickens.
In the future she wishes to further develop her business by increasingly enlarge her breeding. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan according to the schedule, so that she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
Her challenge is market saturation and sometimes the diseases that affect the birds.

loans.use: to raise and sell broiler chickens.

loans.name: Vilma Hermencia

texts.es: En el Fortín sector norte de Guayaquil en una casa de caña y con solo el servicio de luz vive Vilma hace 5 años, a pesar de no contar con todos los servicios ya que el agua la compra en tanques, se siente feliz de tener una casa propia. A sus 35 años no a podido encontrar trabajo ya que siempre a sido ama de casa y no tiene ninguna experiencia laboral. Esto no fue impedimento para que ella buscara una forma de ganar dinero para ayudar en los gastos a su esposo Marcos quien es recaudador en una empresa privada. Una amiga fue quien la convenció y ayudo a incursionar en la venta de cosméticos por catálogos, de aquel entonces han pasado tres años en los cuales a ganado experiencia, confianza para la oferta y clientes. El trabajo lo realiza saliendo a recorrer los diferentes sectores del barrio sola o en compañía de sus hijos porque suele llevar productos de muestra. Sus hijos tienen 7, 15 y 17 años y asisten al colegio fiscal, el menor es quien la suele acompañar en sus visitas. Con el crédito comprara perfume, cremas, jabones, maquillaje para la mujer y hombres, espera dentro de 5 años tener un carro para la movilización y terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Vilma has lived in a house made from sugarcane stalks that only has electricity and is located in El Fortín in the north sector of Guayaquil for five years.  Despite its not having all utilities and having to buy water in tanks she feels happy to have a house of her own.  At the age of 35 she’s been unable to find a job because she’s always been a housewife and has no work experience.  However, this wasn’t an obstacle for her to find a way to earn money to help her husband, Marcos, who works as a debt collector for a private firm, cover household expenses.

A girlfriend of hers convinced her and helped her to start selling cosmetics via catalogue.  Since then three years have passed and she’s gained experience, confidence and customers.  The work she does is going throughout the neighborhood by herself or accompanied by her children because she tends to carry sample merchandise with her.  Her children are 7, 15 and 17 years of age and attend public school.  The youngest one is the one who usually accompanies her on her visits.

She will use the loan to buy perfume, cream, soap and make-up for women and men.  She expects in five years to have a car to get around in and to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Nasuuru

texts.en:
Nasuuru is a 28 year old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He has a personal goal of educating his children and building a permanent home.

He has been running a butcher for the last six years, and he used his savings to start the business.  He faces hardships of price fluctuation, inflation and seasonal weather.

Nasuuru's vision is to buy land to grow crops and owning a large food store.  He needs a loan to buy meat to sell in his butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell in his butcher shop.

loans.name: Milagre

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos que ainda frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
Trabalha como docente e possui um negócio próprio de venda de produtos diversos, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (arroz, açúcar, sabonetes, peixe, bebidas e outros) para aumentar a sua mercadoria e subir o seu rendimento mensal.
No futuro deseja crescer profissionalmente e melhorar as condições de vida, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo segundo o calendário para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a crise financeira e as condições económicas actuais.
texts.en:
He's married and has three children who are still in school. He lives in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.
He works as a teacher and also runs his own business selling various goods. With the current loan he intends to purchase goods (rice, sugar, soap, fish, beverages, etc.) in order to increase the quantity of his merchandise and improve his monthly income.
In the future he wishes to grow professionally and improve his living conditions. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan according to the schedule, so that he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
His challenge is the financial crisis and the current state of the economy.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (rice, sugar, soap, fish, beverages, etc.).

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 7 filhos dos quais 5 já maiores de idade, vive na casa própria e sustenta apenas os filhos ainda menores. 	
Tem um negócio próprio de venda de produtos diversos, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (amendoim, alho, arroz, açúcar, sabonetes, peixe, bebidas e outros) para aumentar a sua mercadoria e subir o seu rendimento mensal.
No futuro deseja fazer crescer o seu negócio e construir um estabelecimento comercial condigno, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo segundo o calendário para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a educação dos filhos ainda menores e a subida dos preços da mercadoria.
texts.en:
She's a widow and has seven children, five of which are already adults. She lives in a house she owns and only supports the children who are underage.
She runs her own business selling various goods. With the current loan she intends to purchase goods (peanuts, garlic, rice, sugar, soap, fish, beverages, etc.) in order to increase the quantity of her merchandise and improve her monthly income.
In the future she wishes to make her business grow and build a decent venue for her store. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan according to the schedule, so that she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
Her challenge is her underage children's schooling and the rise in prices of merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (peanuts, garlic, rice, sugar, soap, fish, beverages, etc.).

loans.name: Suzana

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 3 filhos, um ainda frequenta Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta seus netos que vivem com ela. 	
Trabalha como cozinheira num restaurante, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, pedra, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
No futuro deseja crescer profissionalmente e concluir a sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo devidamente para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de meios financeiros e subida de preços do material.
texts.en:
She's single and has three children, one of which still attends school. She lives in a house she owns and also supports her grandchildren who live with her.
She works as a cook for a restaurant. With the current loan she intends to purchase construction supplies (sand, cement, rocks, iron, etc.) in order to continue building her house.
In the future she wishes to grow professionally and to finish bulding her home. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so that she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
Her challenge is the lack of financial means and the rise in prices of materials.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (sand, cement, rocks, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Arapatkhan

texts.ru:
Арапатхан  58 лет, вдова, имеет 3 детей. Арапатхан с 1987 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы в 20,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Арапатхан,  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  15 овец, ежеквартальная прибыль  с продажи мясных продуктов составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Арапатхан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойных коров.  Доходы от кредита Арапатхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Arapatkhan is 58 years old, widowed, and has three children. Arapatkhan has been raising livestock since 1987; she started her business with 20,000 soms. Thanks to her hard work, Arapatkhan's business now has 15 sheep, and earns quarterly profits of about 20,000 soms (KGS) from the sale of meat products. To develop her business further, Arapatkhan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 80,000 soms (KGS) to buy some dairy cattle. Arapatkhan plans to invest the proceeds from the loans into further increasing her number of domestic livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 4 filhos 3 destes já maiores de idade, vive na casa própria e não sustenta ninguém para além dos seus filhos. 	
Faz trabalhos pessoais e criação de gado bovino para poder ganhar a vida, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (estribos, areia, cimento, pedra, ferro e mão de obra) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
No futuro deseja concluir a construção da sua casa e aumentar a sua criação de gado bovino, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo devidamente para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o alto custo de vida e subida de preços de material de construção.
texts.en:
He's married and has four children, four of which are already adults. He lives in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else other than his children.
He does personal chores and raises cattle so that he can make a living. With the current loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (brackets. sand, cement, rocks, iron and labor) in order to continue building his house.
In the future he wishes to finish building his home and increase his cattle breed. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
His challenge is the high cost of living and the rise in prices of construction supplies.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (brackets, sand, cement, rocks, iron and labor) in order to continue building his house.

loans.name: Qiyomiddin

texts.ru: Киёмиддин житель города Куляб. Он женат. Ему 39 лет. У него четверо детей. Его жена занимается шитьем. Сам Киймиддин предоставляет услугу на своем грузовом автомобиле. Этим видом деятельности он занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для покупки запчастей грузового автомобиля.
texts.en: Kiyomiddin lives in Kuliab. He is 39 years old, married, and has four children. His wife is a seamstress. Kiyomiddin provides trucking services using his own truck. He has been doing this type of work for ten years. He is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for his truck.

loans.use: to obtain an accumulator, wheels, and tires

loans.name: Jeanne Mahouton

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont deux sont encore à l'université, Jeanne Mahouton vend de la farine de manioc, des galettes, des savons et d'autres articles depuis des années. Jeanne Mahouton s'approvisionne dans les marchés de la place. Face à la forte demande de ses clients qui augmente sans cesse, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un concours auprès de Finadev en vue de répondre favorablement à la demande ses clients et de maximiser de profit. Le surplus généré lui permettra de contribuer à la formation professionnelle de ses enfants et de renforcer son stock.
texts.en:
Jeanne Mahouton is a married mother of five children, two of whom attend university. She has been selling cassava flour, galettes (flat cakes), soap and various other products for several years. She buys her merchandise at the local markets.

With customer demand steadily increasing, she is seeking a loan from Finadev to adequately meet the needs of her clientele and maximize her profits. 

Any surplus earned will allow her to support her children’s professional training and to replenish her stock.

loans.use: to buy one box of mobile phone recharge cards, five cartons of milk, five cartons of sardines and two boxes of sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (wood, sand, cement, rocks, iron, etc.) in order to begin building her house.

loans.name: Mugisa

texts.en: Mugisa, a 52-year-old gentleman living in Kagadi, Uganda, deals in a juice-processing business that he has run for a period of two years. He says that inadequate capital is the main factor affecting his business and so is requesting a loan to buy fruits and preservatives to process juice for sale. Mugisa would like to educate his children and buy land to grow crops.

loans.use: to buy fruits and preservatives to process juice for sale.

loans.name: Yrsalatkhan

texts.ru:
Ырсалатхан 51 год, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. Ырсалатхан с 1985 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы в 800 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Ырсалатхан,  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  скот, который в целях экономии средств на корм отогнан на горное пастбище, и 1,08 га земли, где она выращивает хлопок и кукурузу. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Ырсалатхан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку мелкого скота на откорм.  Доходы от кредита Ырсалатхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Yrsalatkhan is 51 years old, married, and is raising three children. Since 1985 Yrsalatkhan has been raising animals and growing field crops. She started this business with 800 soms (KGS). Thanks to Yrsalatkhan's hard work, her business now has livestock which, to save money, are sent off to a hilly pasture to feed, and 1.08 hectares of land on which she grows cotton and corn.

With a goal to further develop her business, Yrsalatkhan has come to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 soms (KGS) to buy small livestock for fattening. Yrsalatkhan plans to invest the income from the loan into increasing her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
Tarana is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. She is IDP (internally displaced person) and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Tarana has been breeding cattle and cows for the last 10 years. She is a housewife and her husband is on pension. 

Tarana usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then resells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 100 AZN and this business is only one source of financial income in her family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Tarana also keeps milk cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.  

She wants to expand her business and improve life conditions of her family. She applied for a 1500 AZN loan in order to purchase two cattle, one milk cow and fodder.  This will be her fourth loan and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy two cattle, one milk cow and fodder

loans.name: Eric Alain

texts.fr: Eric Alain est un homme de 34 ans,marié ,père de 03 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 02 et 06 ans. Deux de ses enfants vont déjà à l'école.il est commerçant dans une banlieue où il a un bar dans lequel il vend des boissons hygiéniques depuis un an.Sa qualité de bon gestionnaire et son expérience lui ont permis d'acquérir en peu de temps une clientèle considérable, mais qu'il a cependant du mal à la satisfaire du fait de la petitesse de son stock qui entraine de constantes ruptures.D'où le besoin de ce crédit qui lui permettra d'augmenter son stock de boissons et par conséquent ses ventes et lui permettra de satisfaire sa clientèle et accroître ses bénéfices.Une partie de ses bénéfices lui permettra de réinvestir dans son bar afin de l'agrandir et l'autre l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Eric Alain is a 34-year-old married father of three children whose ages range from 2 to 6. Two of his children are already attending school. He is a merchant in a suburb, where he has a bar in which he has been selling health drinks for a year. His management skills and experience have allowed him to rapidly acquire a considerable clientele, but he has trouble satisfying them thanks to the small size of his stock, which is constantly suffering from shortages. This need led him to seek this loan, which will allow him to increase his stock of drinks, thereby raising his sales, and to satisfy his customers and increase his profits. A portion of his profits will allow him to reinvest in his bar in order to expand it, and the remainder of his profits will help him provide for his children.

loans.use: To buy several cases of drinks

loans.name: Ndiaga

texts.fr: Monsieur Ndiaga réside au Sénégal. C’est un homme marié qui travaille dans le secteur du transport. Il a débuté cette activité en 1984. En effet, cela fait maintenant 28 ans qu’il est au service de sa population. Il est membre au guichet de l’U-IMCEC où il sollicite son second crédit d’un montant de 500.000 francs CFA. Ce financement  sera consacré entièrement à la réparation de son automobile en panne. La reprise de son activité lui permettra de reprendre la gestion des charges de son foyer en main( dépense quotidienne, scolarité des enfants) et aussi  d’épargner de l’argent. Son plus grand rêve est de devenir propriétaire d’une compagnie de transport afin de mieux satisfaire sa population.
texts.en: Mr. Ndiaga lives in Senegal. He is a married man who works in the transportation sector. He began this activity in 1984. Indeed, for 28 years now he has been serving his population. He is a member of the U-IMCEC branch, where he is seeking his second loan of 500,000 francs CFA. This loan will be dedicated entirely to repair his broken-down car. The resumption of his business will allow him to take charge once more of his household's needs (daily expenses, children's education) and also to save money. His biggest dream is to become the owner of a transportation company in order to better satisfy his population.

loans.use: To repair his broken-down vehicle

loans.name: Quy's Group

texts.en:
Quy is 59 years old. She has four adult children. She has raised chickens for a living for 18 years. She earns 2,600,000 VND a month from her business. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2011. The last cycle, she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 6,496,000 VND to raise more chickens. Then, she hopes her business will bring in enough money for her to upgrade her farm. 

 Ngoc is 18 years old. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to do her job as a carpenter. 

 Bac is 26 years old. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to raise pigs. 

 Huong is 22 years old. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to open her own carpentry studio.

loans.use: to raise more chickens and upgrade her farm

loans.name: Heydar

texts.en:
Heydar, 57 years old, lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and five children. He is farmer who has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 30 years. During those years Heydar gained enough skills and experience to run this business, profitable because fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand.

People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of vegetables including pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are on every table in the average Azerbaijan family, and Heydar usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 130 AZN.

Because of this high demand, Heydar wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables. He is therefore requesting a loan of 1500 AZN to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. Enjoying a good client history, this will be his fifth loan.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ruth Olouwatogni

texts.fr: Ruth Olouwatogni est mariée et mère d'1 enfant âgé de 05 ans scolarisé. Elle a 01 personne à charge et est couturière de profession depuis 10 ans. Ruth Olouwatogn s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de la place. Ses clients sont des hommes et des femmes. Ruth Olouwatogn veut s'acheter une machine et des tissus. Ruth Olouwatogn avec ses économies veut participer à la scolarisation de son enfant et subvenir à ses besoins élémentaires
texts.en: Ruth Olouwatogni is a married mother of one child, who is 5 years old and attends school. She has one person in her care and has been a dressmaker by profession for ten years. She gets her supplies at one of the markets in the area. Her customers are men and women. Ruth Olouwatogni wants to buy herself a sewing/overcasting machine and fabric. With her savings, she wants to help provide for her child's education and basic needs.

loans.use: To buy one overcasting machine, 20 metres of nylon fabric, and 50 metres of cotton fabric.

loans.name: Qarash

texts.en:
Qarash is a 33-year-old man, married, with two children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives with his family in an IDP settlement. He has a small drugstore where he has sold medicine for the past 10 years. Qarash is experienced and skilled in this field.  His brother helps him a lot to run the business.  Qarash sells only certified drugs, and his monthly income is 280 AZN.   

Qarash needs additional capital to invest in his business. This will allow him to improve quality of his products and increase monthly sales.  For this purpose he has applied for 1,500 AZN. This will be his sixth loan, and he has a very good client history.

loans.use: to buy more medicines to sell

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en: The most fashionable and tasteful woman between local people is Umeda. She is a beautiful woman and a perfect business lady. She always tries to do the best for her children. Her 3 children value their mother highly. They know that she is a very careful mother. They love her and they are proud of her. Umeda has sold clothes for women for more than 10 years. Her business has developed year by year. Nowadays Umeda wants to be more successful in business. She is asking for a loan to buy goods to widen her assortment.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Afiavi Jeanne

texts.fr: Agée de 62 ans, Afiavi Jeanne est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont un étudiant. Elle a une baraque où elle vend des fournitures scolaires depuis des années et s'approvisionne dans les marchés du Bénin. Ses clients sont composés des parents d'élève et des étudiants du quartier. Expérimentée dans le commerce, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit auprès de Fiandev en vue d'augmenter son capital et de satisfaire la demande de ses clientèle. Le gain dégagé lui permettra de contribuer à la formation professionnelle de son enfants et d'épargner.
texts.en: Afiavi Jeanne is a 62-year-old married mother of four children, of whom one is attending school. She has a stall where she has sold school supplies for several years, and gets her products at the markets in Benin. Her customers comprise students and parents of students in the area. An experienced businesswoman, she has sought and obtained a microloan with Fiandev with the goal of increasing her capital and satisfying the demands of her customers. The earnings from the business will allow her to contribute to her children's professional training and to save money.

loans.use: To buy 12 school books of different types, 1 box of 100-page notebooks, 1 box of 200-page notebooks, 1 box of bic pens of different colours, and 1 box of chalk.

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.es:
Obdulia tiene 39 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre. Está separada del padre de sus dos hijos; Larry de 17 años y Edison de 13 años. Vive en compañía de sus hijos en la casa que le quedó de la separación.
Su actividad es la venta de abarrotes en general, para lo cual abrió una tienda su vivienda, ya que su necesidad económica era fuerte, pues con la pensión o apoyo económico del padre sus hijos no les alcanzaba. Decidió iniciar este negocio hace más de 3 años, tiempo que le valió para lograr crecer llegando a tener muchos clientes, en su mayoría, sus vecinos. Hasta el momento cuenta  con la compañía y ayuda de sus hijos para la atención. Le gusta su actividad porque puede socializar, está en la tranquilidad de su casa y se siente una mujer productiva. Además con las ganancias cubre los gastos de su hogar. Por cuanto desea continuar y ampliar su negocio de abarrotes.

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP, le gusta el trabajo que viene realizando y el apoyo que recibe, y desea poder seguir contando con esa oportunidad, por lo que comenta, será puntual con los pagos de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para surtir su bodega. También arreglará su local, moviendo algunas paredes para ampliar el espacio y así brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Obdulia is 39 years old and is a very hard working and happy woman. She is separated from the father of her two children: Larry is 17 years old and Edison is 13 years old. She lives with her children in the house that he left her after the separation. 

Her work is in the sale of general groceries, for which she opened up a store in her house because her economic need was strong since the pension or economic support from the father was not enough for them. She decided to begin this business more than three years ago, time that has allowed her grow to have many customers--mainly her neighbors. Up to this moment she counts on her sons' company and help to attend to the store. She likes her work because she can socialize, she is in the tranquility of her house and feels like a productive woman. Additionally, with her earnings she covers the household expenses. As such, she hopes to continues and widen her grocery business.

This is her first loan with the MFP institution. She like the work being done and the support that she receives and hopes to continue counting on this opportunity. According to her words, she will be punctual with her payments. With the requested amount of 1500 nuevo soles, she will invest in the purchase of groceries to stock up her grocery store. She will also fix up her locale, moving some walls to expand the space and provide more comfort for her customers.

loans.use: to fix up her store.

loans.name: Ghorob

texts.en:
Ghorob is a 21-year-old young woman. She is married to Mahmoud and has no children yet. Her husband works in agriculture, but his income is not enough to cover the family's needs. 

Ghorob and her husband have also been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover the costs. She is requesting a 1,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing more sheep and expanding the family's project. This will increase sales and improve the family's income positively.

Ghorob and her husband Mahmoud are photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more sheep and benefit from its products to improve the family's income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric for resale.

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir is a 42-year-old man, married, with three children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.   He breeds cattle and sells milk and milk products as well as cattle for meat to local butchers. Tahir has more than 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father, who taught him the best ways to look after cattle. He receives 80 AZN a month in financial support from government, but that is too little to cover his family's needs.

Tahir usually buys young cattle, raises and fattens them for 5 or 6 months, and resells them for a profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.  Milk and yogurt, he sells to his neighbors. The milk and meat sales bring 160 AZN income a month. Milk and yogurt, as well as meat, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes like pilau and dolma, and they always use yogurt.   Milk products are considered very healthy, and they are also present in everyday life.   

This is his family's only income, and it is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Tahir applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase two cattle and one milk cow.

loans.use: to buy two cattle and one milk cow

loans.name: Carmen Santos

texts.es: Carmen una viuda de 60 años es enfermera titulada. Vive en Miagros en donde tiene una pequeña despensa hace 10 años. Como es enfermera a trabajado la mayor parte de su vida en una clínica de la ciudad. Al fallecer su esposo se encontró en la necesidad de tener otros ingresos y por ese motivo abrió la despensa. El negocio lo atiende con la ayuda de una hija ya que en la tarde está realizando sus labores en la clínica. Au despensa la abre desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde, vende en su mayoría lácteos, colas, snack , arroz, azúcar, artículos de bazar etc. ahora que vive sola se siente satisfecha de no considerarse carga para sus hijos y seguir manteniendo su independencia. Con el crédito comprar productos para surtir su tienda la cual espera agrandar para tener mayores ganancias y así poder dejar de trabajar como enfermera.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 60-year-old widow and a registered nurse. She lives in Milagros where she has managed a small store for 10 years. Being a nurse, Carmen has worked most of her life at a clinic in the city. When her husband died, she needed additional income so she decided to open her store. Carmen manages this business with the help of her daughter, who works in the afternoons while Carmen is at her job at the clinic. Her store is open from 8am to 2pm. The merchandise she sells consists mostly of dairy products, colas, snacks, rice, sugar, bazaar products, and other items. Now that she lives alone, Carmen is happy that she no longer has to support her children and is able to maintain her independence.

With this loan, she will buy products to restock her store. She hopes to expand in order to generate more revenue, which will allow her to quit her job as a nurse.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, colas, snacks, rice, sugar, bazaar products, and other items.

loans.name: Ancelma

texts.es: Ancelma tiene 39 años viviendo en Milagros, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con agua y luz, en ella vive junto a sus 2 hijos quienes están estudiando la escuela fiscal. Varios años atrás decidió abrir su tienda de víveres en ella vende productos como arroz, azúcar, enlatados, colas etc., abre todos los días desde muy temprano en la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Ancelma comenta que el sector donde vive es muy tranquilo y por ende no ha tenido problemas con la delincuencia y espera no tener ningún sobresalto en días futuros. Con el crédito comprara productos  para surtir su tienda esperando incrementar el negocio y mejorar su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Ancelma is 39 years old living in Milagros. Her house is made of cement and can count on water and electricity. She lives with her two children who are studying in the public school. 

She decided several years back to open a general store in which she sells products such as rice, sugar, canned goods, colas, etc. She is open every day from very early in the morning until 8 at night. Ancelma states that the area where she lives is very peaceful and as such has not had problems with delinquency and hopes to not have scares in future days. With the loan she will buy products to stock up her store, hoping to expand the business and improve her family life.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, canned goods and colas.

loans.name: Mahpurat

texts.en: Mahpurat is a very wonderful and hard-working woman. She started her business alone with her daughter when her husband died. She is raising her daughter alone. She is busy producing and selling bakery products. She has great experience in this business. She bakes bread with love and with a special recipe. That’s why she has many customers. Now she wants to expand her business. She applied for a loan to buy sugar, flour, oil and other necessary products to make biscuits. Mahrupat is waiting your help.

loans.use: To buy necessary products to make biscuits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new laptop

loans.name: Carlos Julian

texts.es: Carlos tiene 43 años y siempre se a dedicado a la cosecha de productos de ciclo corto, este trabajo lo realiza desde que era niño ayudando en la finca de sus padres. También sabe la perforación de pozos y su limpieza ya que en el campo es de esta manera como se abastecen de agua. Se dedica a la plantación de pepinos y choclos los cuales vende la plaza de Milagros. Empieza su día a las 5 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, ya que en el campo se debe aprovechar al máximo la luz solar. Cuando se va a cosechar primero se debe preparar la tierra, como vemos en la foto la tierra esta arada, el arado se hace con animales o maquinas. Luego de preparar la tierra se tira la semilla para que empiece la siembra y posterior a esto la cosecha. Su mayor dificultad es los cambios climáticos sobre todo la temporada invernal por las inundaciones. Su esposa y sus hijos le ayudan cuando no están en la escuela. El préstamo que Carlos está solicitando es para la compra de semillas,  fertilizante y una bomba para la fumigación. Espera que la siguiente cosecha le permita cubrir las cuotas y dejarle dinero para arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Carlos is 43 years old and has always made a living harvesting products with a short cycle. He has done this work since he was a child helping at his parents' farm. He also knows how to drill and clean wells since this is how water is provided in the countryside. 

He makes a living planting cucumber and corn which he sells in the Milagros plaza. He begins his day at 5 in the morning and works until 5 in the evening because he must take advantage of the sunlight the best he can in the countryside. When he reaps a harvest he must first prepare the land. As we see in the photo, the land is plowed. The plowing is done with animals or machines. After preparing the land he plants the seeds so they begin to grow and after that is the harvest. His greatest difficulty is climatic change, above all the winter season because of the floods. 

His wife and children help him when they are not in school. The loan that Carlos requests is to buy seeds, fertilizer and a spray pump. He hopes that the next harvest will allow him to make his loan payments and leave him money to fix up his house.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and a spray pump.

loans.name: Flore Ayaba

texts.fr: Flore Ayaba est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 19 ans et le moins âgé a 09 ans.Tous vont à l'école . Elle vend des divers depuis 08 ans. Flore Ayaba s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de la place. Ses clients sont des femmes et des hommes. Flore Ayaba veut s'acheter des sacs de riz, des cartons de cannette et de biscuit. Flore Ayaba avec ses économies veut participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Flore Ayaba is married and the mother of four children.  The oldest is 19 and the youngest is 9.  All of them attend school.   She has been selling grocery products for 8 years.  Flore Ayaba gets her supplies in one of the local markets.  Her customers are women and men.  Flore Ayaba wants to buy some sacks of rice, canned drinks, and cookies.  With her savings, Flore Ayaba would like to contribute to the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of rice, 17 cases of different types of canned drinks, and 8 boxes of cookies.

loans.name: 2012 Group

texts.es: Sonia tiene 22 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario 2012, esta casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo trabaja de motorista, ellos residen en el Barrio Subirama, de la ciudad de Bonito Oriental, Colon. Ella es una persona muy responsable y honesta, inicio su negocio desde hace tres años y se dedica a la venta de cremas y lociones, ella sale a trabajar donde sus vecinos y amigos todas las tardes y lo hace de forma ambulante. Sonia esta solicitando el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de cremas y lociones para poder surtir su negocio. Con la ayuda de este préstamo su negocio crecería y le beneficiaria ya que podrá vender a sus clientes todo lo que necesiten. Uno de los inconvenientes es que no tiene un local propio para vender sus productos a sus clientes. Sus sueños es que su negocio pueda crecer y que le provea más ganancias para poder sacar a sus hijos adelante y ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, también le gustaría tener su propio local para ya no andar vendiendo de forma ambulante. Sonia es el segundo préstamo que solicita en FAMA y  hasta en la actualidad no ha tenido problemas con sus pagos.
texts.en: Sonia is 22 years old. She is a member of the "Grupo Solidario 2012" ["2012 Solidarity Group"]. She is married and has two children. Her husband works as a driver. They live in the neighborhood of Subirama, in the city of Bonito Oriental, Colon. Sonia is a very responsible and honest person. She started her business three years ago, and she works selling creams and lotions. She goes out to work every evening, going to the places where her neighbors and friends are, and selling as a mobile vendor. Sonia is requesting this loan to invest in buying creams and lotions so she can stock her business. With the help of this loan, her business will grow, and it will benefit her because she will be able to sell her customers everything they need. One of the inconveniences for her is that she does not have a shop where she can sell her products to her customers. Her dreams are that her business will grow and provide her with more earnings, so that she can help her children get ahead and help her husband with the household expenses. She would also like to have her own store so that she does not have to walk around selling as a mobile vendor. This is the second loan that Sonia is requesting with FAMA, and up to now she has not had any problems with her payments.

loans.use: to buy creams and lotions to sell.

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en:
Mubariz is a 37-year-old man on a pension.  He is an internally displaced person (IDP) who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and two daughters. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruit and vegetables for the last 12 years. He chose this business because it is profitable and because fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy.  Many national dishes made of vegetable, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruit is served every table in Azerbaijan families and it is also used to make fresh punch.

Mubariz sells his crop in the Bilasuvar central bazaar. His monthly income is 140 AZN. His wife actively helps him to raise crops.

As these products are in high demand, Mubariz wants to expand his business and produce more fruit and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1500 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizer. This will be his fourth loan and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en:
Nabi is a 46-year-old man and internally displaced person (IDP) who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and three children. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruit and vegetables for the past 15 years. During these years, Nabi gained enough skills and experience  to run the business. He chose this crop business because it  is profitable and because fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. 

People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy.  Many national dishes are made of vegetables, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruit is served at every table in Azerbaijan family and it is also used make fresh punch. He usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 140 AZN.

As these products are in high demand, Nabi wants to expand his business and produce more fruit and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 800 AZN.
