He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizer. This will be Nabi's third loan and he has a positive credit history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rafiqa

texts.en:
Rafiqa is a 48-year-old woman, married with four children.  She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives with her family in an IDP Settlement. She is a market vendor and sells different kinds of food products.  She has about 10 years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced and skilled person in this field. 

Rafiqa  usually sells sugar, candies, grains and beverages. Her assortment of merchandise is not big, but the things she sells are very popular.  Her monthly income is 200 AZN. Her husband is on a pension and not working, hence her income is the main financial source in her family. 

Rafiqa needs additional capital to invest to her shop to diversify and increase the number of products. This will allow her to improve the quality of products she stocks and to increase monthly turnover.  For this purpose she applied for a loan of 1500 AZN. This will be her second loan and she has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy and diversify food products

loans.name: Los Angeles Leales Group

texts.es: La Sra. Isidora, tiene 4 hijos  es conviviente  y lleva trabajando con Edaprospo desde hace 1 año, Isidora  es integrante del grupo “Los Angeles Leales”, grupo conformado por 10 socios que dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Isidora  trabaja en la venta de carnes y vegetales en un puesto en le mercado este trabajo surge con la idea de obtener mejores ingresos y ayudar a sus hijos, con el tiempo ya cuenta con clientes fidelizados, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a  logrado mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos, brindándoles educación  y con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos carne y vegetales. Isidora  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Isidora has 4 children, is in a common-law marriage, and has worked with Edaprospo for 1 year.  She is a member of the “Los Angeles Leales” [“the Loyal Angels”] group.  The group is made up of 10 members who make a living from different commercial activities.  Isidora works selling meat and vegetables at a stall in the market.  She took up this work so she could earn more income and help her children, and over time she has developed a loyal customer base.  Thanks to her effort and dedication she has managed to give her children a better quality of life, and has provided them with an education.  She wants her business to continue to grow, and so she has asked for a new loan to purchase meat and vegetables.  Isadora will achieve her goals with much work and effort, and with help from Edaprospo’s loans.

loans.use: to purchase meat and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda tiene 36 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa, además de amable y cordial. Está separada del padre de sus tres hijos, actualmente vive en compañía de dos de ellos; Mayra de 17 años, Naomi de 12, quienes son su motivo para salir adelante. La casa donde viven es la de su hermana; con ella, sus padres y un sobrino.

Su negocio es la venta de comida regional; como juanes (a base de arroz y pollo), pescado asado, tamales y otros. Lo realiza de lunes a viernes por las noches, instalándose en la esquina de su casa con una mesa y algunas sillas. Además cuenta con una refrigeradora que usa para helar las bebidas que pone a la venta. Realiza este negocio desde hace 15 años, contando con la ayuda de su madre y sus hijas, quienes atienden con mucha amabilidad. Considera rentable a su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja, pues logra vender todo lo que prepara a diario. Le gusta cocinar, aprendió de su madre los secretos para una buena sazón, lo que resulta difícil es levantarse muy de temprano para realizar los preparativos del día, pero eso no la desanima y continúa en su negocio.

Este es su préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, además está muy cómoda con su banco comunal, pues considera a sus compañeros personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1200 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de víveres, bebidas, mesas, sillas y utensilios de cocina para renovar sus enseres.
texts.en:
Florinda is 36 years old. She is a hardworking, enterprising, cordial and friendly woman. She is separated from her husband and has three children. She lives with two of the children, Mayra, age 17 and Naomi, age 12. They are the reason she wants to progress. She lives in her sister’s house, with her, her parents and her nephew.
She sells regional food such as juanes (based on rice and chicken), roasted fish, tamales and other items. She works in the evenings from Monday until Friday at the corner in front of her house where she sets up tables and chairs. She has a refrigerator where she keeps cold drinks that she sells. She has been doing this business for the past fifteen years with the friendly assistance of her mother and her daughters. Her business is profitable, with good earnings, as she sells all that she prepares each day. She likes to cook. She learned from her mother the secrets of good seasoning. It is hard to get up very early in order to begin preparing her food, but this doesn’t discourage her from doing her business.
This is her fifth loan with MFP. She is very comfortable with the community bank as she considers her fellow members to be very responsible. She is asking for 1200 new soles, which she will use to buy goods, drinks, tables, chairs, and utensils for the kitchen in order to renovate her business.

loans.use: to buy food items, tables, chairs and utensils for her business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dukorane Group

texts.fr:
Michel fait partie du groupe Dukorane et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 40 ans et est marié à Georgette, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont  6 enfants, âgés de 1 an  à 12 ans, dont 3 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge un ami qui étudie.

Il fait le commerce de poissons (ndagala) depuis 15ans. 

Il  est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de poissons (ndagala) à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter des voitures et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Michel belongs to the Dukorane group and lives in Gitega. He is 40 years old and married to Georgette, a farmer. Together they have six children, whose ages range from 1 to 12, and three of whom are students.
He also has in his care a friend who is studying.
He has run a business selling fish (ndagala) for 15 years.
He is on his third loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan he obtains, he is going to increase his capital and buy lots of fish (ndagala) for resale in order to earn more.
In the coming years, he would like to buy cars and see that his children get an education.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy lots of fish (ndagala) for resale in order to earn more.

loans.name: Kundayehova Group

texts.fr:
Françoise fait partie du groupe Kunda Yehova et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle  a  43 ans et est mariée à Pascal, commerçant de sacs en plastique. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants, âgés de 14  à 20 ans.
Elle prend  soins de sa belle mère et ses 3 beaux frères.

Elle fait le commerce de sacs en plastique depuis  6ans. 

Elle est à son douzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de sacs en plastique à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  augmenter son capital pour avoir une grande  quantité de sacs en plastique.
texts.en:
Françoise belongs to the Kunda Yehova group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 43 years old and married to Pascal, a merchant who sells plastic baggies.
Together they have three children, whose ages range from 14 to 20.
Françoise takes care of her mother-in-law and her three brothers-in-law.
She has run a business selling plastic baggies for 6 years.
She is on her twelfth loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan she obtains, she is going to increase her capital and buy lots of plastic baggies for resale, in order to earn more.
In the coming years, she would like to increase her capital in order to have a large quantity of plastic baggies.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy lots of plastic baggies for resale, in order to earn more.

loans.name: Magnifique Group

texts.fr:
Rose fait partie du groupe  Magnifique et  habite à Bujumbura. C’est un célibataire   de 34 ans.
Elle prend soin de 2 enfants  qui étudient.

Elle  fait le commerce des habits  depuis  8 ans.

Elle est à son septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d' habits à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  construire une maison et voir  les enfants sous sa charge continuer leurs études.
texts.en:
Rose belongs to the Magnifique group and lives in Bujumbura. She is unmarried and 34 years old.
She takes care of two children, both of whom are in school.
She has run a business selling clothes for 8 years.
She is on her seventh loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan she obtains, she is going to increase her capital and buy lots of clothing for resale in order to earn more.
In the coming years, she would like to build a house and see the children in her care continue their education.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy lots of clothing for resale in order to earn more.

loans.name: Maftuna

texts.en:
Maftuna is a 29-year-old woman, an internally displaced person (IDP) who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with her husband and two children. She is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruit and vegetables for the last 8 years. She chose this business because it is profitable and because fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them health.  Many national dishes are made of vegetables, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruit is served at every table in Azerbaijan families and is also used to make fresh punch.

Maftuna sells her crop in the central bazaar. Her monthly income is 110 AZN. Her husband  is a builder, buy doesn’t have a permanent job.  He actively helps her to raise crops.

As these products are in high demand, Maftuna wants to expand her business and produce more fruit and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose she applied for a loan of 1000 AZN. She will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizer. This will be her second loan and she has a good client  history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Délali

texts.fr:
Délali est une femme de 37 ans sans enfants mariée à un ouvrier. Revendeuse de profession, elle exerce dans le domaine de l’alimentation générale. Opérant depuis deux ans avec WAGES, elle sollicite un prêt dans le but de s’approvisionner en produits et denrées destinés à son commerce.
Délali espère pouvoir à l’avenir ouvrir sa boutique et mieux prendre soin de sa famille. Son activité se déroule à domicile.
texts.en:
Délali is a 37-year-old woman without children and is married to a worker. A retailer by profession, she is involved in the selling of general food items. Having worked for two years with WAGES, she is seeking a loan with the goal of supplying herself with products and foodstuffs for her business.
In the future, Délali hopes to be able to open her store and take better care of her family. She currently runs her business at home.

loans.use: To buy general food products.

loans.name: Marie - Anne's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Marie-Anne, la responsable, est âgée de 46 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants scolarisés. Elle vend de la nourriture et de divers depuis des années. Marie-Anne s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. En vue de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle et de satisfaire les besoins de ses enfants, Marie-Anne a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Marie-Anne se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en: This group comprises two people with a financial solidarity guarantee. Marie-Anne, the leader, is 46 years old. She is married and has four children in school. She has sold food and various items for many years. Marie-Anne gets her supplies at one of the markets in Benin. With the goal of responding to the demands of her clientele and providing for her children, Marie-Anne has sought and obtained a microloan with Finadev. Marie-Anne is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 1 case of milk, 1 case of sardines, 1 bag of rice, and 1 bag of maize

loans.name: Amil

texts.en:
Amil is a 26-year-old man who sells men's clothes in the central bazaar. He is married and has two children.  He finished university and was not able to find a job, that is why he decided to join his brother who already had experience in this field. Five years ago he started his business. His monthly income is 220 AZN. His brother still helps him in choosing good-quality clothes. 

He applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase more clothes for sale. This will help him to improve his income and gain more customers. This will be his second loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the upcoming season

loans.name: Kareka  E.

texts.en:
Kareka E. has been running a shop in Buchanan where he sells shoes. He started this business with help from his parent, and learned this way of selling from his friends. 

Presently the problem he is facing is less income, since he cannot meet his customers’ range. He is requesting a loan to buy more used shoes and sneakers for his business. 

He enjoys his business because it keeps him busy and makes him popular. Kareka is a high school graduate, 29 years old, and married with two children, ages 4 and 10. They are in school and live at home (Buchanan). 

His dreams are to expand his business even more, send his children to school and build a house for them.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes and sneakers for his business.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Luchadoras lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Elsa quien se dedica al comercio de trastes desde hace 4 años negocio que inicio con la venta de dulces. El crédito lo invertirá en picheles, pailas, vajillas…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Miury quien tiene una mini pulpería desde hace un años y Martha quien vende platanitos.
texts.en:
The group “Mujeres Luchadoras” (Striving Women) consists of three hardworking individuals. One of them is Elsa, who has been selling utensils for four years. She started her business by selling candy. Her loan will be invested pitchers, frying pans, dishes, and other items.

The other members are as follows: • Miury has managed a mini-grocery store for a few years. • Martha sells plantain chips.

loans.use: to buy pitchers, frying pans, dishes, and other items.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva tiene 47 años, es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, además de alegre y sociable. Está  casada con Segundo, quien cuenta con un trabajo como empleado y es el padre de sus dos hijas: Royser 29 y Leydi de 25 años. 

La actividad que ella realiza es la costura y arreglo de ropa, labor que aprendió en un colegio de monjas. Se inició hace 12 años en un pequeño local que ambientó en su vivienda con sus dos primeras maquinas de coser, y fue creciendo debido a la calidad de su trabajo. Le gusta su actividad por el ingreso económico que le genera, además de poder apoyar a su familia con algunos gastos y tener tiempo libre para otras actividades. También realiza la venta de bebidas, con lo que tiene un ingreso extra, producto que tiene bastante demanda por lo caluroso de la zona. Por eso tiene planes de hacer crecer su negocio e implementa un local para una fuente de soda.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, donde se siente contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para poder avanzar con su negocio. Por eso se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Y se siente cómoda con su banco comunal,  pues sus compañeros son personas responsables y comprometidas con sus obligaciones.

Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevo soles, invertirá en la compra de materiales de costura como telas, elásticos, hilos y otros. Y también incrementará la cantidad de bebidas que vende.
texts.en:
Elva is 47 years old. She is a hardworking, dynamic, friendly and sociable woman. She is married to Segundo who is a domestic worker and the father of two daughters, Royser, 29, and Leydi, 25 years. 
She is a seamstress and she fixes clothes. She learned this skill at Catholic High School.  She started this business 12 years ago in a small place situated in her home, with her two sewing machines. Her business grew because of the quality of her work. She likes the work because of the earnings that it generates. It allows her to help with family expenses and gives her free time to do other activities. She also sells cold drinks, which is why she needs extra money. She lives in a warm climate with a large demand for cold drinks. She has plans to grow her business and start a soda fountain. This is her second loan with MFP. She is content with this organization and thankful for the opportunity to have a line of credit to use to grow her business. She promises to pay her payments on time. She is comfortable with the community bank as the members are responsible and they meet their obligations.
With the loan that she is requesting, for 1000 new soles, she will buy materials for sewing such as fabric, elastic, thread and other items. She will also increase the quantity of cold drinks that she sells.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials and more cold drinks to sell.

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: Pedro de 35 años de edad es casado, tiene 2 niños en edad escolar.  Esta solicitando su 3er credito para compra de equipos de trabajo que tiene en mal estado, pues se dedica a la pezca artesanal y ademas a la compra y venta de platanos, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa que sale a vender lo que pezca y platanos, obteniendo ingresos familiares que le permiten el sosten familiar.
texts.en: Peter is 35 years old, married with two school-aged children. He is asking for this third loan in order to buy equipment for his work, as his old equipment is in a bad state. He is a fisherman and he also buys and sells plantains. With the help of his wife he goes out and sells fish and plantains. This job gives him earnings that allow him to support his family.

loans.use: to replace aging machinery.

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is a 29-year-old man, an internally displaced person (IDP) who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and three children. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruit and vegetables for the last 10 years. He chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand.  People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy.  Many national dishes are made of vegetable, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruit is served at every table in Azerbaijan families and is also used to make fresh punch.

Zaur sells his crop in the Bilasuvar central bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN. His father actively helps him to raise crops.

As these products are in high demand, Zaur wants to expand his business and produce more fruit and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizer. This will be his second loan and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 41-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from seven years to sixteen years. She describes herself to be a social and humble woman. She operates a retail business where she sells ropes. She has been involved in this business for three years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more ropes to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more ropes to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 8 years. She describes herself to be social, diligent, and hardworking. 

She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a densely populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes for resale. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future she would run a big boutique.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Compound #3. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children between 5 to 20 years old who are in school and live at home. She stopped her education in the 6th grade. Her husband is a businessman.

Since 2005, she has been running a shop where she sells drinks, rice by the bag, oil, mattresses, and other items. Ruth says that some of the problem she faces is that most of the demands from her customers are not available in stock. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more drinks, rice, oil, mattresses, and other items for her business. In the near future, she wants to send her children to college, build a house, and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks, rice, oil, mattresses, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Anorbi

texts.ru: Анорби жительница города Куляб. Ей 51 год. Она вдова. У нее двое детей. Анорби вместе с сыновьями  занимается торговлей стройматериалов. Она четыре года занимается торговлей. До этого она 15 лет проработала преподавателем. Кредит берет для покупки красок, щеток и необходимых инструментов.
texts.en: Anorbi lives in the town of Kulob. She is 51 years old. She is a widow, with two children. Together with her sons, Anorbi sells construction materials. She has been working as a vendor for four years. Before that she has worked for 15 years as a school teacher. She is taking out a loan to buy paint, brushes and  tools needed [for construction work].

loans.use: to buy paint, brushes and construction tools.

loans.name: Intisar

texts.en: Intisar is a 50-year-old woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan, who supports three members of her family. She is requesting a loan of 800JD to improve a space so that she can open a small neighborhood shop. * Since Intisar is a conservative woman she prefers not to display her photo on the internet, thus the photo above is of her son.

loans.use: to pay for improvements to a space that will become her shop

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha, a 20-year-old woman from Al Nassar, Amman, Jordan, is requesting a loan of 400 JD to buy clothes and accessories which she will then sell for a profit. Maha is under 30, so her loan is considered a youth loan. She hopes that this income will help improve her family's economic situation. 

* Since Maha is a conservative woman, she prefers not to display her photo on the internet, so the above photo is of her husband.

loans.use: to pay for clothes and accessories that she will sell.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en: Ibtisam, a 48-year-old woman from Hay Nazal, Jordan who supports five family members, is requesting a loan of 800 JD to buy clothes so that she can establish a shop. Her dream is to buy a house that her whole family can live in.

loans.use: to pay for clothes to sell.

loans.name: Constence

texts.en: Constence is a 41-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be a social and respectful woman. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes such as shirts, skirts, blouses, etc. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving her business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. Her business goal is to venture into a retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a big retail shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Odilkhon

texts.ru: Одилхон житель города Куляб. Ему 39 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он вместе с семьей занимается торговлей продуктов и кондитерских изделий. Этим видом деятельности занимается год. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Odilkhon lives in the town of Kulob. He is 39 years old. He is married, with four children. Together with his family, he sells groceries and candy. He has been in this business for one year. He is taking out a loan in order to increase his sales volume.

loans.use: to buy nuts, candy, pistachios and chocolates.

loans.name: Rajabali

texts.ru: Рачабали житель города Куляб. Ему 55 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Рачабали более одиннадцати лет занимается животноводством. Он разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа двух коров.
texts.en: Rajabali lives in the town of Kulob. He is 55 years old. He is married, with five children. He has received secondary education. For over 11 years, Rajabali has been raising livestock. He raises cattle by his home. He is taking out a loan in order to buy two cows.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 30 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, además alegre y carismática. Su pareja es Marco Antonio, quien es transportista, y fruto de esa unión tienen dos hijos; Cristian de 13 y Cristel de 7 años.

Su negocio es la venta de comida rápida, como salchipapas, pollo brosther y otros, lo  que realiza de lunes a viernes por las noches, instalándose en el frontis de la casa de su hermana (lugar muy transitado) con un carrito de salchipapa, una mesa y algunas sillas. Realiza este negocio hace más de 3 años,  iniciándose con un capital propio y hasta el momento viene atendiendo ella sola. Aprendió de su madre los secretos para una buena sazón, con lo que ahora puede pagar sus cuentas y gastos de su hogar. Lo que no le gusta es el cansancio físico porque tienen que levantarse muy de temprano por las mañanas para realizar los preparativos del día, pero eso no la desanima y continúa en su negocio.

Este es su préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida con el crédito recibido para continuar con su negocio y desea seguir contando con esta oportunidad más adelante. Por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues considera a sus miembros personas comprometidas con sus obligaciones y solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de otro carrito salchipapero (móvil para hacer frituras) valorizado en 600 nuevos soles, con el saldo comprará víveres e ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 30-years-old and a very hard-working and entrepreneurial woman with a joyful and charismatic personality.  Her partner is Marco Antonio, and together they have two children: Cristian who is 13 and Cristel who is seven.  

Her business is selling fast food like fried potatoes and chicken, among other items.  She does this from Monday to Friday at night, setting up in front of her brother’s house (a well-traveled spot) with her cart of fried potatoes, a table, and some chairs.  She has been in this business for more than three years and started with her own money and has managed it by herself.  She learned the secrets for good flavor from her mother and uses her profits to pay bills and household expenses.  What she doesn’t like is the physical exhaustion, because she has to get up very early in the morning to prepare for the day, but this doesn’t discourage her and she will continue with her business.

This is her fourth loan with MFP and she feels thankful for the help she has received to continue with her business and she hopes to continue to have this opportunity in the future.  Because of this, she commits to be punctual with her payments.  In addition to feeling comfortable with her communal bank, she considers the other members to be people who are very committed to their obligations and to each other.

With the amount she is requesting of 1000 nuevos soles, she will invest in another fried potato cart (a mobile one for frying), which is valued at 600 nuevos soles and with the remaining money she will buy supplies and ingredients for her food preparation needs.

loans.use: to buy a food cart and ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 44-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan who lives with three family members. Aisha prefers that her photo is not on the Internet. Thus the photo above is of her husband.

She is requesting a loan of 300 JOD to help pay for home improvements. She is planning on making repairs to her home. She hopes that this will make her home a better, more comfortable space for her family to live in.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 47-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 7 years to 18 years. He describes himself to be an aggressive man. 

He operates a retail stall where he sells clothes such as jackets. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located at a busy area and his primary customers are employees of institutions. He describes his biggest business challenge to be frequent disruptions by city council asking for payment. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy twenty jackets for selling. His business goal is to build a permanent business premises within five years. He hopes that in the future he will have expanded his business.

loans.use: to buy twenty jackets for resale.

loans.name: Nasrallah Talal

texts.en: Talal is a 27-year-old married man from Hay Nazal, Jordan who supports two members of his family. He is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to buy materials to build an additional room to his house. The education of his children is what drives him in life.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements and the building of a new room

loans.name: Om-Ekram Group

texts.en: The members of the "Om-Ekram" group are three women (Sali, Anisa, Amany) and one man (Wahid). They all live in Aden, Yemen. They know each other through friendship and neighborhood ties. They requested a loan of 230,000 YER. Amany is the leader of the group and is 33 years old. She is the woman holding a handbag in the photo. She's been selling ladies' perfumes and clothes for two years. She says that she does very well with the business. She applied for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB. She hopes that she'll do better and will use the loan to buy fabrics, incense and perfumes etc. She is happy and hopes to get a lot out of the loan. She hopes the business will continue growing like it's done to date. She is grateful for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, incense and perfumes for her business

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a 48-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 6 years to 23 years. He describes himself to be honest. 

He operates a retail store where he provides dressmaking services and sells clothes he makes. He has been involved in this business for twelve years. His business is located within a town and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for business expansion. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy fabric. His business goal is to run a successful tailoring shop within five years. He hopes that in the future he will have opened some other tailoring shops.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Al-Dhia Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-dhia and consists of four members: Zainb, Nbat, Tehany, and Ahlam who live in Taiz, Yemen. They took out a loan of 200,000 YER.

Zainb is 43 years old and she has seven children. She is a member of this group. (She is the woman who is seated in the photo)

She has been sewing clothes for over four years. She started by offering her sewing services, that is to work in her house, etc. Little by little she started making clothes that her clientele required. This is how she became financially solvent and able to cover her essential expenses. 

She will use the received loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy sewing materials like thread, needles, zippers, etc.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials like thread, needles, zippers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is a 42-year-old married man. He describes himself to be a business-minded man. He operates a butcher shop where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for 13 years. His business is located within a viable business area and his primary customers are hotels, restaurants and local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 45,000 loan to buy more meat for resale. He had taken an earlier loan of KES 50,000, which he managed to repay with ease. His business goal is to run a progressive butcher shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a supplier of meat and run another butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 37-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 6 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be social and loyal. 

She operates a retail store where she sells sodas. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shilling (KES) loan to purchase more sodas for resale. Her business goal is to run a big retail shop within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have had expanded her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sodas for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has a daughter who is 27 years old. She describes herself to be social and respectful. 

She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits such as tomatoes, mangoes, kale, onions, etc. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located at a residential area, and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy more vegetables and fruits for improving the business. Her business goal is to expand the grocery business within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a big retail shop.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van is 52 years old. She is married and lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in weaving cloth for more than four years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals. He earns approximately $2 per day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Van is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business to earn more income for the family and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman. She has two children who are 20 years and 25 years old. She describes herself to be honest and humble. 

She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located at a competitive area, and her primary customers are repeat customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shilling (Kes) loan to buy more fish for resale. Her business goal is to start a new business of running a retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have expanded her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish for selling.

loans.name: Mach

texts.en: Mach is 41 years old. She is married and blessed with three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating cassava for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a mechanic who earns about $7 per day. Two of her children are employed. They earn about $7 per day. Due to lack of funds, Mach is requesting a loan of $1000 to pay for the expenses of tilling her farmland. This money will be used for purchasing fertilizer to cultivate cassava as well. This money will help her cultivate her cassava well and get a higher yield. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store to earn additional income to support the family.

loans.use: to pay for the expense of tilling her farmland

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Phalla is 27 years old. She is married and blessed with three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is employed as a chef who earns about $5 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Phalla is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase piglets to breed in order to sell when they gain weight. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to breed in order to sell when they gain weight

loans.name: Por

texts.en: Por is 42 years old. She is married and resides with eight children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been working in the APSARA preservation sector for more than a year, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $2 per day. Three of her children are employed. They earn about $17 per day. Due to the difficulty with her family’s transportation, Por is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a souvenir shop and help her children earn Bachelor’s degrees. In addition, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Molina

texts.en:
Molina is married to Aurelio. They are blessed with two children who have both settled into marriage live separately from their parents.

Molina raises rice crops within her local community. She has been doing this kind of business for eight years. Molina has three hectares of farmland.The couple both work hard in order to earn their living. Molina doesn't want to become dependent on her children. So, at her age of 56, she still performs some farming activities to economize her expenses. 

Due to the increase in the price of fertilizers, her capital is no longer enough. For this reason, she asks for additional working capital amounting to PHP 27,000. She hopes that she can make her farming business grow to be able to keep producing healthy crops. This will allow her to obtain more income and improve their way of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for hired laborers.

loans.name: Zevaroy

texts.en:
Zevaroy is a brave person with good behavior. She doesn’t like awkward people and always teaches her children to be careful in all work that they do. Her husband is a worker and Zevaroy is the main feed keeper for the family. Her business is keeping live-stock. 

Zevaroy has as big so small live-stocks. Zevaroy cares of livestock very well and this is one of the aspects of developing her business. She wants to be more successful in business. Zevaroy is asking for a loan to buy livestock for developing her business. She waits your help.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Yait

texts.en: Yait is 44 years old. He is married and resides with four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He is a doctor who earns about $30 per day. His wife runs the business of breeding pigs. She earns about $4 per day. In order to improve his career, Yait is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase medicine to use for treating villagers. By doing so, he would earn more income to support the family. In the future, he would like to expand his business and help his children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, he hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase medicine to use for treating villagers

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap is 33 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been making flat baskets to sell for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sopheap is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Ruziboy

texts.en:
Ruziboy is a man who likes to work very hard. He is a kind and clever man. During the past 4 years, he has been busy with driving. He likes to help to his citizens. Ruziboy works with pleasure because his work is very interesting.  

Ruziboy is married and he has 2 children. He loves his family very much. His wife doesn’t work that’s why he is only feed keeper in the family. Some time ago, his car had broken and he needs to repair it. He is asking for a loan to repair his car. He awaits your help.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Sam Orn

texts.en:
Sam Orn is 27 years old. She is married, blessed with one child and she lives in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband runs the taxi service (motor taxi). He earns about $15 per day. Because the present motorbike is old, Sam Orn is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run the taxi service. This purchase will help her husband attract new customers and earn more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to run an additional business to generate more income and help her child earn a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and provide convenient living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run the taxi service.

loans.name: Kley

texts.en: Kley is 21 years old. He is single and resides with his mother in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He is a tailor who earns about $8 per day. His mother makes creel to sell. She earns about $3 per day. In order to improve his business, Kley is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase a sewing machine to use in his shop. This money will help him expand his business and earn more income to support the family. In the future, he would like to expand his shop and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to use in his shop

loans.name: Safa

texts.en:
Safa, who appears in the picture, is a 28-year-old young woman. She is married and a mother to two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a worker and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For more than six years, Safa and her husband have also been working in agriculture, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover the costs.

Safa is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing seedlings and fertilizer to prepare well for the summer crop. This will enable Safa and the family to get a better crop in summer season, which will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seedlings to prepare for a new crop

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en:
Fatema is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Khalil appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Fatema is a 50-year-old woman, she is married to Khalil and a mother to two sons and one daughter. Her husband and her elder son are employed and get low salaries, which are not enough to cover the family's expenses.

For the past one year, Fatema, with help of her husband, has been operating an Internet Cafe, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover its costs.

Fatema is requesting a 2,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing more computers. She would like to expand the size of her work and improve the cafe's condition by changing the tiles and installing new ones. This will attract more customers and improve the family's income to live in better conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more computers and improve the cafe's condition.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a thirty five year old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has personal goals of educating his children and building a permanent house for his residence. 

Yusuf has been operating a retail shop for the past five years. His main hardships are inadequate capital to buy enough stock and customers not paying on time. He has a vision of having a wholesale shop. Yusuf needs the loan facility to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchadise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a forty nine year old married man living in Kasese,Uganda with his four children. He has been in agriculture for ten years and the sector has been very lucrative because it has enabled him to pay school fees for all of his children. His hardship is price fluctuation and inflation. 

Benard's personal goal is to educate his children and his business goal is to hire employees to help expand the business. Benard wants money buy fertilizers for his banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Nickson is a thirty one year old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has personal goals of educating his children and building a permanent house for residence. 

Nickson has been in the transport business for the last nine years. His main hardship is high fuel and transportation costs. However, he has a vision of expanding his business to new areas. Nickson needs a loan to buy a motorcycle for the transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: Magret

texts.en:
Margret is a thirty eight year old married woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a personal goal of educating her children up to the university level. 

Margret has been operating a retail shop for the last thirteen years, after saving the wages she earned as a housekeeper. She is facing hardships of her customers not paying on time. However, she has a vision of expanding her business to new areas. Margret needs a loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchadise such as sugar and salt to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a thirty six year old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling beers and sodas for three months. He started with 500,000 shillings and now has 2,900,000 shillings as working capital. His hardships are inadequate capital to purchase enough stock, price fluctuation and inflation. Godfrey's personal goal is to educate his children and his business goal is to buy land to grow crops. Godfrey wants money to buy beers and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy beers and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is a forty eight year old hardworking woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a personal goal of educating her children to attain degrees as minimum qualifications. She has been running a food business for the last ten years and her main hardships are: seasonal weather and inadequate capital to buy enough stock. She has a vision of expanding her business to new markets. Stella needs a loan to buy beers for resale.

loans.use: to buy beers for resale.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a forty three year old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in second hand clothes for ten years. He started with 500,000 shillings and now has 5,000,000 shillings as working capital. 

Moses' hardship is price fluctuation and inflation. His personal goal is to educate his children and his business goal is to expand his business into new markets. Moses wants money to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Everest

texts.en:
Everest is a twenty eight year old hardworking man living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in a video library and charging of phones business for four years. He started with 800,000 shillings and now has 3,500,000 shillings as working capital. His hardships are seasonal weather, inadequate capital to purchase stock, price fluctuations and inflation.

Everest's personal goal is to build a permanent home and his business goals are to expand his business into new markets, to hire employees to help expand the business and to diversify his business. Everest wants money to buy DVDs to sell.

loans.use: to buy DVDs for sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 28 años, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, además de jovial y muy sociable. Su pareja es Sara, con quien tiene una hija, Carmen de 4 años, a quien quieren mucho. Viven en su casa propia, la que lograron construir con mucho esfuerzo.

Su actividad es la venta de abarrotes, para eso cuenta con un bodega instalada en su vivienda, desde donde atiende, muy amablemente, a sus clientes, que en su mayoría son sus vecinos. Se inició hace un año y medio con un capital propio y viendo la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional. Hasta el momento, cuenta con la ayuda de su pareja para la atención. Adicionalmente tiene plantaciones de palmas aceiteras en un terreno de su propiedad. Le gusta su tienda, pues le permite estar en la comodidad de su casa y cuidar a su hija, con tiempo libre para emplearlo en otras actividades. Por otro lado, no le gusta que algunos de sus clientes le solicitan crédito por sus compras, pues ya tuvo malas experiencias, por eso todas sus ventas son al contando, así puede ver más rápido sus ganancia. Para el futuro, tienen planes de implementar y ampliar su negocio y de esa manera seguir creciendo.

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP, por lo que espera concretar sus planes. Se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas para tener un buen record crediticio y acceso a créditos futuros.
Con el monto solicitado, de 4000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de comestibles variados en mayor cantidad, al por mayor, para así tener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Juan is 28, and a hard-working, determined man, who is also good-humored and very sociable. His partner is Sara, with whom he has a 4-year-old daughter, Carmen, whom they love very much. They live in their own house, that they managed to build with a great deal of effort.

His business is selling groceries, and for this he has a small store set up in his home. Here he serves his customers, who are mostly his neighbors, in a very friendly way.

He started out a year and a half ago with his own working capital, and because he saw the need to have an additional source of income.  Up to this time,  he has had his partner's help in serving customers. In addition, he has oil palm plantations on a piece of land that he owns. 

He likes his store, as it allows him to be in the comfort of his house and look after his daughter, with free time to use in other activities. On the other hand, he doesn't like it that a few of his customers ask him for credit for their purchases, as he has already had bad experiences. That is why all his sales are for cash. In this way he can see his earnings more quickly. For the future, he plans to build up and expand his business, and that way keep growing.

This is his first loan with the MFP institution, so he hopes to make his plans a reality. He promises to make his installment payments, in order to have a good credit record and access to future loans.

With the amount requested of 4000 nuevos soles, he will invest in the purchase of a variety of foodstuffs in greater quantity and at wholesale, in order to  have greater profit margins.

loans.use: To add to his store's merchandise.

loans.name: Miranda

texts.en: Miranda is a mother who is involved in buying and selling of feeds, corn, nails and oils in their community. This is her way of helping her husband in generating income for their family. They have been gifted with four children and two of them are still studying at the college level. Due to the high cost of school fees and commodities, she needs to increase her income to support the education of her children. For this reason, she wants to ask for an additional capital of PHP 40,000 to buy additional stock of feeds, corn, fertilizers, nails and oils to sell in their community. She mentioned that this loan will enable her to improve the business and hopes that she will be successful in managing the business to give her family a bright future.

loans.use: to buy feed, corn, fertilizers, nails and oils to sell.

loans.name: Wa Johnes

texts.en:
Wa Johnes is a 45-year-old married man with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been dealing produce for 15 years. He started by growing crops on a small scale and after a good harvest, he decided to trade in produce since it was very lucrative. He faces problems of seasonal weather changes, price fluctuations and inflation.

He has personal goals of educating his children and building a permanent home. His business goal is to expand his business into new market areas. Wa Johnes wants a loan to buy produce such as beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce such as beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Duo Santisima Trinidad Group

texts.es: Santisima Trinidad.Doña Zoila Lily es una persona muy responsable que se dedica al comercio, ella en si se dedica a la elavoracion y venta de manteles para mesa,y servilletas de toda clase y desiño,ella tiene un local en el mercado, tambien en sus tiempos libres ella vende cosmeticos de manera ambulante,de esa manera a podido sacar adelante a sus hijos,ahora ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de manteles y servilletas por mayo, ya que si ella compra por mayor le cuestan mas varatos, espera que kiva le pueda ayudar en sus negocio.
texts.en:
Zoila Lily belongs to the "Duo Santisima Trinidad" group. She is a very responsible person who has a small business. She makes and sells tablecloths and serving cloths of all kinds and designs. She has a stand in the market, and in her free time also sells cosmetics door-to-door. In that way, she has been able to provide for her children. 

Now she is applying for this loan to buy tablecloths and serving cloths at wholesale, as if she buys at wholesale they cost her less. She hopes that Kiva can help her in her business.

loans.use: To buy tablecloths, and serving cloths to sell.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is a 26-year-old married woman with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling cassava flour for four years and with the proceeds, she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent home. Her business goals are expanding the business into new markets and moving her business to a more permanent location. Sylvia wants money to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 59-year-old married man with 8 children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. For ten years he has been operating a retail shop and the business has been profitable despite challenges in price fluctuations and inflation.

He has a personal goal of educating his children and a business goal of expanding his business into new market areas.

Paul wants a loan to buy a motorcycle for a transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcyle for a transport business.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en: Alona runs a small variety store in her village to generate income. She is 38 years old and has three school-age children. Despite the hardship of life, she aims to continue sending their children to school so that they will earn a degree and find a good job someday. In this regard, Alona aims to improve her variety store to increase her income and support the education of her children. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional PHP 7,000 to buy soft drinks, junk foods, breads, canned good, noodles and soap to sell. She believes that this loan will help her to make an improvement in her business and hopes that she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, junk foods, breads, canned goods, noodles and soaps to sell

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en: Peninah is a 40-year-old married woman with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling cassava for seven years and with the loan facility, she has been able to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children. Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent home while her business goals are expanding the business into new markets and moving her business to a more permanent location. Peninah wants money to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam is a 36-year-old married man with three children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. For seven years now, he has been growing tea and the business is profitable since it has assured markets in the tea factories. He faces a problem of seasonal weather changes, which affects the tea plantations leading to low yields. His personal goal is educating his children and his business goal is to diversify his business to include other economic activities such as cattle rearing. Sam intends to use the loan to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Joram

texts.en: Joram is a 32-year-old married man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He operates a stationery shop and has been in the business for four years. He started this business from savings from his salary as a teacher. He has the challenge of inadequate capital to increase his stock, price fluctuations and inflation. He has his personal goal of building a permanent home and his business goal of expanding his business into new market areas. Joram wants a loan to purchase reams of papers for resale.

loans.use: to buy reams of paper for resale

loans.name: Gilsom

texts.en: Gilsom is a 32-year-old married man with two children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. For four years now, he has been selling local brew. With the earnings, he has been able to build a residential house. He faces the challenges of customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to maximize the big customer base. He has personal goals of educating his children and building a permanent house and a business goal of expanding his business into new market areas Gilsom wants a loan to purchase local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: St Jane Francis Women Group

texts.en:
Michaeline is a 70-year-old married woman with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been operating a supermarket for two years. Her hardships are inadequate capital to purchase enough stock, price fluctuations and inflation. Her personal goals are building a permanent home and supporting her grandchildren. Her business goal is buying land to grow crops.

Michaeline wants money to buy cassava flour to sell. She is a member of the above-mentioned group in which each member guarantees each other to access a loan.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en: Jovia is a 26-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling cassava flour for two years. Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent home. Her business goal is expanding her business into new markets. Jovia wants money to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 35-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling cassava flour for 15 years. Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent house for a residence. Her business goals are expanding her business into new markets and moving her business to a more permanent location. Agnes wants money to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María 
700000
Alajuela

	María tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos y su esposo,  en este año nace su tercer hijo, viven en una zona de Alajuela que ha sido apoyada por instituciones como el Instituto Mixto de Ayuda Social, para mejorar la calidad de vida de las personas. Hace 9 años y por iniciativa propia, comenzó en el comercio vendiendo ropa y otros artículos, con el lapso de los años y gracias al esfuerzo de ella han crecido, atendiendo otras necesidades de sus clientes, incursionando en la compra de electrodomésticos traídos desde el puerto libre de Golfito. 

Su principal prioridad es apoyar a sus hijos en el estudio; al mismo tiempo ella está llevando los cursos para obtener su título de  la secundaria a distancia. Esto le ha ayudado a mejorar en su negocio y espera en el corto plazo obtener el bachillerato. Este es su segundo crédito y llegó a  Fundación Mujer por referencia de una amiga que escuchó la información  en un programa de radio.

Ella recibió el apoyo en el año 2010 con un préstamo por C 600.000 colones dado por fundación mujer con el apoyo de los inversores de KIVA. Con este adquirió  electrodomésticos. Le ha ido dando vuelta al capital y diversificando su oferta de productos a sus clientes, los cuales vende a pagos.

La clienta tiene un pequeño local en su casa en donde mantiene un pequeño inventario de productos y atiende por las mañanas, después de haber enviado a sus hijos a la escuela, por las tardes realiza exhibiciones en localidades cercanas lo que le ha ayudado a aumentar su clientela, brinda facilidades de pago. Es una actividad que apoya los ingresos del hogar que se complementan con el trabajo de su esposo. Por las noches se dedica a estudiar.
texts.en:
Maria, 30, lives with her husband and three children. Her youngest was born this year. They live in an area of Alajuela that has been supported by institutions, like the Mixed Institute of Social Aid, to improve the the quality of life for inhabitants. Nine years ago, of her own initiative, she started a business selling clothing and other items. Over the years, thanks to her hard work, the business has grown and she meets other needs of her clients, getting into the sale of home appliances brought from the port of Golfito. 

Her main priority is supporting her kids in their education. At the same time, she is taking classes to get her high school degree through a distance learning program. This has helped her improve her business and she hopes in the short-term future to get her diploma. This is her second loan; she came to the Women's Foundation through a reference from a friend who heard about it on the radio.

She received support in 2010 with a loan for 600.000 colones from the Fundacion Mujer with the help of the Kiva lenders. She used this to buy household appliances. She has been turning around her capital and diversifying the products that she offers her customers, which she sells on credit. 

She has a small store in her home where she keeps an inventory of her products and works in the morning, after sending her kids to school. In the afternoon she displays her product in nearby towns which has helped increase her clientele. She also makes payment easy. Her business supports their household expenses, along with her husband's work. She dedicates her nights to her studies.

loans.use: to bring orders of household appliances from Golfito semi-annually.

loans.name: Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cayetano lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Mayra quien tiene una pulpería negocio que abre todos los días y en el que invertirá el crédito con la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, gaseosa y queso.
Las otras integrantes son Pabla quien vende tortillas desde hace 7 años e Isabel quien tiene una pulpería desde hace un año pero ella inicio con la venta de tortillas.
texts.en:
The group Cayetano is made up of three hardworking and enterprising people. One of them is Mayra who has a small convenience store that she opens every day. She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, soda, and cheese. 

The other members of the group are Pabla who has sold tortillas for seven years and Isabel who has had a small convenience store for a year, but she started by selling tortillas.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, chicken, meat, soap…etc.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Being a responsible mother, Rosita owns and manages a small variety store in their community to help her husband in gaining income. She has been operating this business for more than 10 years and usually earns a profits of 8,000 Philippines pesos (P) a month that she utilizes for their food, clothing and allowances of her children. 

She plans to increase her product offerings to satisfy the needs of her customers. She is asking for additional capital of P7,000 to buy additional stock of grocery items like soft drinks, beverages, soaps, breads, canned goods and vegetables for sale. She believes that her loan will help her to improve the business as she continues to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beverages, soaps, breads, canned goods and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Carlos José

texts.es: El señor Carlos es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor quien se dedica al comercio de plantas y vende ropa desde hace 10 años. El crédito lo invertirá en el vivero en la producción de rosas.
texts.en: Carlos is a hardworking and enterprising man.  He has made his living as a plant merchant and by selling clothing for 10 years now.  He will use the loan to invest in the nursery for the production of roses.

loans.use: invest in the production of roses.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a 35-year-old married woman with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. She is a banker and has been in service for one year. Her personal goals are educating her children and going back to school to upgrade her studies. Judith wants money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: DON ALBERTO TIENE 40  AÑOS DE EDAD ES UNIDO Y TIENE 5 HIJOS TODOS ESTUDIAN DOS DE ELLOS LE AYUDAN POR LAS MAÑANAS EN EL NEGOCIO Y POR LA TARDE VAN A ESTUDIAR. DON ALBERTO TIENE 16 AÑOS DE TENER SU NEGOCIO EL EMPEZO A VENDER MERCERIA COMO JABON. PEINES, CEPILLOS, ESPEJOS ETC. Y CON LA AYUDA QUE FAPE Y KIVA LE BRINDARON EL EMPEZO A VENDER ROPA COMO PANTALON DE CABALLEROS, CAMISAS, PLAYERAS, CAMISETAS PARA DAMA, CALCETINES.GRACIAS A LA AYUDA AHORA EL ESTA SOLICITANDO UN NUEVO CREDITO PARA COMPRAR MERCADERIA NUEVA PARA(PANTALONES BLUSAS CALSETINES ETC)Y SOBRE TODO COMPRAR ROPA NUEVA Y MODERNA  PARA PODER AUMENTAR SU NEGOCIO Y ASI PODER SEGUIR AYUDANDO A SUS HIJOS PARA QUE PUEDAN TERMINAR SUS ESTUDIOS.
texts.en:
Alberto, 40, is married and has five children who are all in school.  Two of his children help him in his business in the mornings and then in the afternoon they go to school. 

Alberto has had his business for 16 years.  He began by selling merchandise such as soap, combs, brushes, mirrors, etc. and with help he received from FAPE and Kiva, he began to sell clothing such as men’s pants, shirts, T-shirts, women’s shirts, and socks.  

He is requesting another loan to buy new merchandise (pants, blouses, socks, etc) and especially to buy new and modern clothing to be able to grow his business and in this way continue to help his children so that they can finish school.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elías tiene 30 años, es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor, además de amable y cordial. Su pareja es Luz, quien es comerciante y la madre de sus dos hijos: Kevin de 2 años y Atzel de 5 meses. Todos juntos viven en su casa propia, donde también vive su cuñada.

Si negocio es la venta y distribución de abarrotes, para lo cual acondicionó un espacio en su vivienda donde almacena los productos. Las reparte a las bodegas de los asentamientos humanos y zonas alejadas. Esta actividad la aprendió trabajando como vendedor en una empresa, de la que salió por la baja remuneración que le daban. Decidió iniciar su negocio propio hace más de un año, tiempo que le valió para lograr crecer y tener muchos clientes, contando con el apoyo de su pareja en la atención de la pequeña tienda que también tienen en casa. Le gusta su trabajo porque socializa con muchas personas, además de tener un oficio donde se siente un próspero empresario.

Este es su préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, por lo que está contento y agradecido de saber que cuenta con una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio, por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en los créditos anteriores.
Con el monto solicitado, de 3000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes de toda variedad, al por mayor, buscando los precios bajos por su compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Elias, 30, is a hardworking and enterprising man in addition to being friendly and cordial. His partner is Luz who is a merchant and mother of his two children: Kevin, 2 years old, and Atzel, 5 months. They all live together in his own home along with his sister-in-law. 

His business is the selling and distributing of groceries.  For this business, he conditioned a space in his home where he stores his products.  He distributes them to the grocery stores in remote communities and zones.  He learned this skill by working as a salesman in a company, but he left because of the low pay they gave him. He decided to start his own business over a year ago.  During this time he was able to grow and have many customers with the support of his partner who looked after the small store they also had in the house.  He likes his job because he socializes with many people and also because he has a job where he feels like a successful businessman. 

This is his fourth loan with MFP.  He is very happy and grateful that he can count on this loan to move his business forward.  Therefore, he agrees to comply with the payments just as he did for the previous loans. With the amount requested, 3000 PEN, he will buy a variety of wholesale groceries looking for low prices by buying in volume.

loans.use: to buy a variety of groceries in large quantities.

loans.name: Sosthène Jacqueline A.

texts.fr: Sosthène Jacqueline est mariée et mère de quatre enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgé a 17 ans et le moins âgé a 05 ans. Spécialisée dans la vente des sacs de riz de 5 kilo, des boîtes de conserve et d'autres articles depuis des années, Sosthène Jacqueline s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de la sous région. Soucieuse d'accroitre sa capacité d'approvisionnement et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement à Finadev. Sosthène Jacqueline avec ses économies veut participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Sosthène Jacqueline is married and the mother of four children in school. The eldest is 17 years old and the youngest is five years old. Having specialized in the sale of 5kg sacks of rice, canned food, and other goods for years, Sosthène Jacqueline gets her supplies in one of the markets of the sub-region. Concerned with increasing her supply capacity and meeting customer demand, she has sought and obtained a loan from Finadev.

With her savings, Sosthène Jacqueline wants to contribute to her children's education fees and to provide for her needs.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sacks of rice, seven cartons of milk, and five boxes of sugar.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Aminata from Kulanda, in Bo, a southern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 10 months and 10 years. She is still breastfeeding the baby. The other two children are in primary school. Her husband is out of a job. She alone takes care of her children. She is taking this loan to have a source of income and so her children will not continue to suffer.  

Aminata runs a local store, where she sells palm oil, rice, salt and wood. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Her business is the only source of income she has.  Her major problem is insufficient capital to invest to grow the business.

Aminata has requested a loan to buy more items, such as palm oil, rice, salt and wood. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and educate her children. In the future, she plans to become an international business woman. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: To buy more items, such as palm oil, rice, salt and wood for resale.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is 50 years old, widowed and blessed with 7 children between the ages of 23 and 32. She runs a cloth and plastic/rubber business in Kandeh town, in the southern area of Bo, Sierra Leone.

Aminata has been in this business for 10 years and sells cloth and plastic/rubber in the market area. She also receives income from her elder son. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to improve the business and transportation costs.

Aminata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more clothing items like clothing, slippers and jeans. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to expand her business to the shop level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing items like clothing, slippers and jeans.

loans.name: Princess

texts.en:
This is forty-year-old Princess from Kandeh town in the southern area of Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with two children, ages two and twenty-one years. She started this business, because she has to take care of her home and family members.

Princess runs a women's dress shop, selling slippers, clothes and bags. She has been running this business for ten years. She works at her business every day expect on holidays. Princess also earns income from small-scale farming in the village. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation  and that sales are slow during the rainy season.

Princess has requested a loan in order to buy more items like slippers, bags and women's wear. The extra income from this loan will allow her to expand her business and start a savings account. In the future, she hopes that her business will grow to the shop level. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more items like slippers, bags and women's wear.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 26-year-old Isata from Kulanda town in the southern area of Sierra Leone. She is married with two children, ages five and seven years. One of her children attends school. Isata began her business, because she did not go to school, so her parents taught her about business. 

Isata runs a local food stand in a busy market area. She sells Maggie cubes, onions, tomato paste and oil. She has been running this business for ten years. She works at the business from 7:00 am until 7:30 pm, seven days per week. Her business is the only source of income she has. At present, she faces two challenges during the rainy season: low purchasing power and the business becoming wet and spoilt.

Isata has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking seasonings such as Maggie cubes, onions, tomato paste and oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to renovate the roof of her house. In the future, she wants to expand her business with a huge amount of product so that she would be able to take care of her family. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking seasonings such as Maggie cubes, onions, tomato paste and oil.

loans.name: Bintu

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Bintu from Kandeh town, southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with 2 children ages 6 years and 10 years. She has four children that are currently attending school; two are relatives of hers. In 2002, Bintu established her table business that sells palm oil, fish, Maggi and rice. She began her business because at 17 years she left school and got married. Her husband is a driver but his income is not enough to support her. She started to run a small-scale trading business to increase the income in the home. She wakes up at 5:30 am to go to the next village to buy goods and sell them on her table. She will not rest until 7:30 pm. She says that the main challenge to her business is there is no vehicle to enter the village where she usually buys goods.

Bintu requires a loan in order to buy more food commodities like palm oil, fish, Maggi and rice. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and expand her business. In the future, Bintu plans to establish her business in Bo town. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more food commodities like palm oil, fish, Maggi and rice.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Fatmata from Kandeh town in the southern area Bo, Sierra Leone. She is widowed with five children between the ages of 13 and 25 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. Her husband was the shop owner of the business; after the death of her husband she took over the business in order to take care of the home.  

Fatmata runs a general merchandise shop; she sells biscuits, sugar, bread, milk, toothpaste, soap, and vaccines. She has been running this business for eight years. She sleeps in her shop; her shop will open every day, seven days per week. Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that the main challenges to her business are shop competition and transportation cost.
