Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy items such as bread, milk, toothpaste, soap, and vaccines. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and educate her children. In the future, she plans to expand her business and renovate her shop because the shop is her dwelling place. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: To buy similar items such as bread, milk, toothpaste, soap, and vaccines.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Fatmata from Kandeh town in Bo southern area, Sierra Leone. She is married with two children between the ages of 12 and 18 years. Her children attend school. 

Fatmata runs a clothing and textiles shop; she sells zippers, thread, needles, buttons, and scissors. She has been running this business for 12 years. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. Her other source of income comes from her elder brother. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy more textiles such as zippers, thread, needles, buttons, and scissors. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and educate her children. In the future, she plans to build a house on her own. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy more textiles such as zippers, thread, needles, buttons, and scissors.

loans.name: Manneth

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Manneth from Kandeh town southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is widowed with 3 children between the ages of 11 years and 19 years. Her children are currently attending school. In 2000, Manneth established her general merchandise business. She began her business because she did not go to school and started up her business so she will have a source of income to support her family. She works at the business 10 hours a day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the scarcity of soft drinks to operate her business.   

 Manneth requires a loan in order to buy more food containers, suitcases, freezers, soft drinks and dishes. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, Manneth plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more food containers, suitcases, freezers, soft drinks and dishes

loans.name: Celestin

texts.fr: Célestin est un homme de 31 ans,célibataire et père d'un enfant agé de 4ans qui va déjà à l'école.Il a également sous sa charge deux de ses cousins .Il gére un centre d'appels téléphoniques dans un  quartier de la capitale depuis 08 ans déjà où il vend des crédits de communication.Grâce à son expérience et à la bonne maitrise de cette activité,il a acquéri une clientèle considérable au fil des années.Cependant, cette clientèle étant de plus en plus grandissante,le maximum de crédit qu'il est en mesure de se procurer auprès des opérateurs téléphoniques avec son capital ne lui permet guère de satisfaire la demande de celle-ci.il sollicite donc ce crédit afin de pouvoir s'approvisionner convenablement ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire aux mieux sa clientèle et augmentera ses bénéfices. Bénéfices qui lui permettront d'une part de réinvestir dans son activité afin d'étendre ses points de vente et d'autre part de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Célestin is a single 31-year-old man and the father of a four-year-old who already attends school. He is also responsible for the care of two of his cousins.

He has managed a call center in a neighborhood of the capital for eight years already, where he sells phone credit. Thanks to his experience and good command of this business, he has acquired a considerable customer base over the years. However, as his customer base becomes larger and larger, the maximum credit he is able to purchase from the telephone operators with his capital hardly allows him to meet customer demand. So, he is seeking this loan in order to be able to stock up accordingly, which will allow him to better satisfy his customers and increase his profits. These profits will allow him to reinvest in his business in order to expand it, as well as to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: To purchase phone credit.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: To earn a living, Mona engages in buying and selling gold in her community, since mining is the major source of income in their community. She has been in this business for almost three years and usually earns a profit of PHP 10,000 a month that she uses for their daily consumption and allowances for her children in school. She aimed to buy more grams of gold to sell but she has inadequate capital. Therefore, she is requesting an additional PHP 7,000 to buy more grams of gold to sell. She mentioned that this loan will be a great help for her to improve her business and she is hoping that she will increase her income to help her husband to satisfy the family's needs and support their children's education.

loans.use: to buy more grams of gold to sell

loans.name: Cimi

texts.es:
Cimi tiene 47 años, es una mujer muy alegre y con deseos de superación. Está casada con Alipio, quien es fotógrafo y el padre de sus dos hijos: Sara y Jireh de 17 y 13 años respectivamente. Juntos viven en su casa propia, la cual construyeron a base de mucho esfuerzo.

Su actividad es la costura, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, luego compró una máquina de coser con sus ahorros y fue invirtiendo más con los préstamos de MFP. Actualmente cuenta con cuatro máquinas de coser, las cuales instaló en su vivienda, donde también atiende a sus clientes, logrando ganarse la preferencia y recomendación de muchas personas. Se inició hace más de 10 años en este negocio y hasta el momento lo viene realizando sola. Le gusta lo que hace porque puede apoyar a su pareja a solventar los gastos de su hogar; pero lo difícil es estar sentada en una misma postura todo el tiempo, lo que le ocasiona dolores de espalda, pero eso no la desanima y continua trabajando y esforzándose.

Este es el  préstamo número16 que tiene con la institución MFP, se siente contenta de poder contar con un capital de trabajo y así poder entregar los pedidos que tiene pendiente. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal porque es un grupo unido y colaborador.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en arreglar la máquina con la que estampa broches y botones. Y también comprará materiales (telas, hilos, etc.)
texts.en:
Cimi, 47, is a very happy woman with the desire to excel.  She is married to Alipio who is a photographer and is the father of her two children: Sara and Jireh who are 17 and 13 years old, respectively. They live together in her own home which they built with a lot of effort. 

Her activity is sewing, a trade she learned by studying at a vocational education center.  She then bought a sewing machine with her savings and she began investing more with the loans from MFP.  She currently has four sewing machines which she has in her home where she also attends to her customers.  She has succeeded in being preferred by and recommended by many people.  She began her business over 10 years ago and so far has been doing it on her own.  She likes what she does because she can help her partner in covering the household expenses.  But the difficult part is sitting in the same position all the time which causes back pain.  But that does not discourage her and she continues working and striving. 

This is her 16th loan with MFP.  She feels happy to be able to have working capital so that she can deliver on the orders she has pending; in addition to being comfortable with her communal bank because it is a united and collaborative group. 

With the amount requested, 1500 PEN, she will fix the machine that she uses to stamp brooches and buttons and also buy materials (fabric, thread, etc.).

loans.use: to fix her sewing machine and buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for provisions and cooking condiments.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Ibrahim.  He is married and has two children, ages 3 and 4 years old. He has two additional dependents who are his nieces to be assisted for their schooling.  In 1989, Ibrahim established his provision and bar business. He began his business because he had to earn a living. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business. 

Ibrahim would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Ibrahim has already received and successfully repaid a loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy one dip freezer for cooling of his soft drinks @  le 4,000,000 and the remaining 1,000,000 will be used to buy additional soft drinks for his bar. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 1,000,000. In the future, Ibrahim plans to expand his business by opening another bar so that he can deploy one of his brothers. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy one dip freezer for cooling of his soft drinks @  le 4,000,000 and the remaining 1,000,000 will be used to buy additional soft drinks for his bar.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a thirty-two-year-old married woman with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been a teacher for six years and with her salary she has been able to buy a plot and pay school fees for her children. She has challenges of low salary to meet the basics. Her personal goal is educating her children and her business goal is to start a poultry project. Agnes wants money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Pamelia

texts.en:
Pamelia is 20 years old and lives in the Airport community. She is engaged and has a seven-year-old child who is currently in school and lives at home. 

For the past seven years she has been running a booth where she sells scratch cards (for prepaid mobile phone minutes) and charges phones in her community. She likes the flow of people into her business. She learned it from her fiancee.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more scratch cards for mobile phones and phone chargers for her business.

Her plan is to buy land and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more scratch cards (prepaid minutes for mobile phones) and phone chargers for her business.

loans.name: Lois M.

texts.en: Lois is 21 years old. She lives in the Airport community. She did not go to school. Lois is single, and for the past 3 years she has been selling rice, oil, pepper and many other items to help support her brothers, since their parents are not alive. Lois received money from friends to start her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil, pepper, and other items for her business. Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, pepper, and other items for her business

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en: Yvonne is 49 years old and lives in the airport community. She is married and her husband works at Firestone. They have five children between the ages of 20 to 32 years old. For the past 16 years she has been selling oil, rice, pepper, and onions in the local market. Yvonne learned this trade from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, and onions for her business. Her plans are to build her house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, and onions for her business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn lives in Buchanan. She is 44 years old and married with a child aged 20, who is in school and live at home, For the past 10 years, she has been selling slippers in the local market. She established the business with small loans from friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers to expand her business. In the future she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers to expand her business

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Due to inadequate income, Marilou aims to improve her variety store to increase her income. She is 26 years old, married and has one infant-aged child. With her husband, they plan to improve their source of income to be able to satisfy their needs and save some for their future. To improve the business, Marilou is asking for additional capital of PHP 7,000 to buy additional stock of canned goods, bread, junk food, eggs, noodles, beverages and soft drinks to sell in her store. Despite competitors in the area, she has the determination to continue and improve the business. She hopes that her loan will help her to work out her plan and hopes that she will become successful in carrying it out.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of canned goods, bread, junk food, eggs, noodles, beverages and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a 30-year-old man with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been operating a hardware shop for four years. He started by farming and then accumulated capital for his current business. He has a challenge of inadequate capital to purchase enough stock and hyperinflation. He has a personal goal of educating his children and a business goal of hiring employees to help expand his business. Vincent wants a loan to purchase cement for resale.

loans.use: to buy cement for resale

loans.name: Shahd

texts.en:
Shahd, who appears in the picture holding the laptop she purchased, is a 25-year-old single young woman.

Shahd's father is a taxi driver and her brother is employed. Also she is employed, but gets a low salary which is not enough to cover her needs.

Shahd wants to improve her status at work by speeding the process of doing her work; also she wants to enhance her skills in using computers, so she is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Shahd to enhance her position at work and ensure her a better future.

loans.use: To buy a new laptop

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est mariée et âgée de 42 ans. Mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. Le plus jeune a 10ans et l'ainé 20ans.Elle est l’épouse d’un soudeur-auto et gagne sa vie quotidiennement en faisant du commerce. Elle achète et revend du riz, de l’huile, du maïs et divers. Afi est à son troisième crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des produits alimentaires dont elle a besoin. Son activité se fait à domicile et elle a démarré en 2000. Elle veut dans l'avenir devenir grossiste et prendre soin de ses enfants sur le plan scolaire.
texts.en:
Afi is 42 years old and married.  She is the mother of four children who all go to school.  Her youngest child is 10 years old and the oldest is 20.  

Her husband works as an auto-welder and she makes a daily living being involved in retail business.  She buys and sells rice, oil, maize and other products.

Afi is requesting her third loan from WAGES for the purchase of the food supplies that she needs.  She became involved in this activity in 2000, and she works from home.

In the future, she would like to become a wholesaler and take care of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy general food products

loans.name: Esseza

texts.en: Esseza is a 32-year-old married woman with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been a teacher for six years and she is very proud of her profession. Her hardship is the low salary that makes it hard for her to promptly provide basics to her family and her dream is to start up an income-generating activity to supplement her salary. Esseza wants money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace's group is comprised of 4 hard-working women. Grace is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort portal region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Grace has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells fresh food like matooke. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food like matooke for resale, and will help Grace to generate greater profits and take care of herself. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house.

Grace is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Grace's future prospects by helping her to improved her business.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food like matooke for resale.

loans.name: Teddy's Group

texts.en:
Teddy's group is comprised of 2 hardworking women. Teddy is 21 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past year, Teddy has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells fresh food like sweet potatoes. 

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh foods like sweet potatoes for resale, and will help Teddy to generate greater profits and pay for her medical expenses. Teddy hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build on it. 

Teddy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Teddy's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: to buy more fresh foods like sweet potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence's group consists of two hard-working women. Florence is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past three years, Florence has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells fresh fish. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fish for resale, and will help Florence to generate greater profits and pay for her medical expenses. Florence hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a car and build a house for herself. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Florence's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save her money.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is 44 years old, married, with four children. He makes furniture to earn a living.  He has been in the business for five years.  He also rents out voice projectors to earn extra income. He had previously acquired loan from Faulu Kenya that helped him grow his business. He hopes to expand his business and have a stable family in future. He needs a loan of 30,000 KES to buy wood.

loans.use: To buy wood for furniture making

loans.name: Afiwavi

texts.fr: Afiwavi 28 ans, est une jeune dame mariée et mère de 2 enfants âgés de 6 et 10 ans. Elle est l’épouse d’un peintre auto et exerce elle-même un petit commerce. Concrètement elle est vendeuse de bouillie et de beignets. Afiwavi fait confiance à WAGES depuis cette année et elle sollicite un crédit destiné à l’achat des éléments entrant dans la préparation de la bouillie. Elle souhaite améliorer son activité et proposer d’autres variantes à la clientèle. Elle espère agrandir son activité,  mieux nourrir ses enfants et leur assurer une bonne éducation. Notons qu'elle a démarré en 2008, s'approvisionne généralement à Lomé et est aidée par 01 personne.
texts.en:
Afiwavi is 28 years old; she is married, and the mother of two children, ages 6 and 10.  Her husband is an auto painter and she is involved in small retail business.  Specifically, she sells porridge and fritters.

For the past year, she has relied on WAGES and she is currently requesting a loan for the purchase of ingredients to make porridge. 

She would like to improve her activity and to offer a wider selection of dishes to her customers.  She hopes to increase her business, improve her children's diet, and take care of their educational needs.

It should be noted that Afiwavi started her business in 2008, that she usually buys her supplies in Lomé and that another person helps her with her business.

loans.use: to buy beans, oil and sugar to make porridge.

loans.name: Alice Martin

texts.en:
Alice Martin  is a 38-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has six children between the ages of 5 and 15 years old. One of the children goes to school. 

Alice runs a food items and has been in business for four years. She has one employee. She heard about Finance Sudan through the loan officers promotion. She is taking a loan of 1500 SDG to purchase more goods.  

In five years, she wants to build a permanent house and open a new branch of her shop

Her major challenges include transportation of goods.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, beans, onions, etc

loans.name: Everest

texts.en: Everest is a 45-year-old married father of 10 children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. A teacher for over 20 years, Everest says teaching has been his  passion since childhood. His personal goal is the education of all his children, and his business dream is to farm so as to supplement his meager salary. Everest intends to use the loan to buy land for growing crops.

loans.use: to buy land for growing crops.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María
Comercio
500000
	Ana María  tiene 42 años de edad, vive en la comunidad de Puntarenas, en la costa del Océano Pacífico de Costa Rica llamado Fray Casiano, es una comunidad con pobreza y problemas sociales, en el cual doña Ana vive con su esposo tiene  4 hijos de ellos solo 1 es menor y los otros trabajan en la zona de Puntarenas. Ella se dedica a actividades de comercio vendiendo perfumes, ropa y zapatos, que distribuye en su bicicleta, además los fines de semana preparan  comidas que vende a sus vecinos.
	Con este préstamo se pretende adquirir mercadería para la temporada del día de la madre y vacaciones de medio año, aprovechando esta época para obtener mayores ganancias y pasar así junto a su familia una mejor situación.  Ella se comunica con sus clientes que son amigos y vecinos ofreciendo sus productos los cuales da a pagos, los visita semanalmente para cobrar y así recuperar su dinero, pagar sus obligaciones y comprar más mercadería o productos para preparar sus comidas.
	Tiene como meta seguir trabajando y apoyando a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y tratar de superarse en una zona donde esto es muy difícil. Tuvo que superar problemas de salud causados por la diabetes, ya que estuvo internada en el hospital, en este tiempo el apoyo de su familia fue muy importante para mantener activa su microempresa.
Su amplia trayectoria (cerca de 15 años), le ha permitido tener una clientela excelente, su producto es comercializado en muy buenas condiciones de pago, permitiendo una recuperación semanal. La comida que vende es muy buena, según comentarios de los vecinos. Comercializa ropa, zapatos perfumes y otros artículos de marca. Ella realiza las entregas y el cobro en su bicicleta y los fines de semana se dedica a elaborar y vender comidas. Este es el segundo préstamo que solicita demostrando una excelente conducta de pago.
texts.en:
Ana María Comercio 500000

Ana María, 42, lives in the community of Puntarenas on the Pacific Ocean coast of Costa Rica, called Fray Casiano.  It is a poor community with social hardship, and it is where Ana lives with her husband and four children, one of whom is a minor and the rest work in Puntarenas.  She sells perfumes, clothing and shoes as a street vendor on a bicycle.  On the weekends she also sells food to her neighbors.

With this loan she wants to buy merchandise for Mother's Day and mid-term vacation, taking advantage of the season to earn more and give her family better living conditions.  She sells on credit to her friends and customers and visits them weekly to collect payment so she can pay her debts and buy more goods and ingredients for her meals.
	
Her goal is to continue working and helping her husband with the household expenses, trying to get ahead in a an area where it is difficult to do so.  She had to overcome health problems related to diabetes and spent time in the hospital.  During that time, the support from her family was very important as far as maintaining her small business.
	
Her vast experience (nearly 15 years) has allowed her to have an excellent customer base.  Her product is sold under very good payment conditions, meaning she collects payment weekley.  The food she sells is very good according to her neighbors.  She sells clothing, shoes, perfumes and other brand items.  She makes delivery and collects, using her bicycle, and on weekends she makes and sells food.  This is her second loan and she has an excellent credit record.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, clothes, shoes and perfume.

loans.name: Angelina Mawa

texts.en:
Angelina is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Nimule. She is married and has three children between the ages of 4 and 12, one of whom goes to school. 

Angelina runs a general store and has been in business for five years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients  and she is taking a loan of 1,300 SDG to purchase more goods.

In five years, she wants to open a big shop. Her major challenges include inflation in the market. 

She is happy to get loans from Finance Sudan.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, oil, beans, etc

loans.name: Duo Dannys Group

texts.es:
DUO DONNYS
Integrada por  la señora Lucia de 51 años de edad,doña Lucia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas en su domicilio, desde hace 10 años, doña Lucia líder de este dúo necesita capital para seguir invirtiendo en la  compra de maíz en cantidades mayores, debido al tiempo de invierno ella sabe que es difícil encontrar maíz seco para elaborar sus tortilla, también entre sus planes es aprovechar la feria Titular de su localidad en la cual mucha gente visita el parque de diversiones y los comerciantes que se instalan temporalmente son clientes de todos los años para venderles tortillas, y los  tres tiempos de comida, incluyendo refacciones.
texts.en: DUO DONNYS is a group that is lead by Lucia, 51, who has been making and selling tortillas from her home for ten years.  She is need of a loan to continue buying corn in greater quantities.  She knows that in winter it is difficult to find the corn she needs for her tortillas, and she also wants to take advantage of the Titular fair in her town, when many people visit the amusement park and merchants set up their temporary stalls.  The same customers come every year to buy tortillas, eat three meals a day, and also buy snacks.

loans.use: To buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Dania Regina

texts.es: La señora Dania es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene un cyber-café desde hace un año además ella vende productos escolares en el negocio. El crédito lo invertirá en productos escolares (cuadernos, lápices, borradores, correctores…etc.)
texts.en: Danis is a hard-working, enterprising woman who runs a cyber-cafe and has been in business for a year.  She also sells school supplies and will use the loan to buy notebooks, pencils, erasers, correction tape, etc.

loans.use: To buy school supplies (notebooks, pencils, erasers, correction tape, etc.)

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with eight children, four of whom are going to school. She is taking care of her father. 

Milly is a tailor. She has operated her retail business from her home for six years, working seven days per week. She does not have any other source of income. She has applied for a loan of UGX500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her purchase more varieties of rolls of cloth. Her major business challenges include seasonality and high prices. She joined MCDT because of its trustworthy and caring staff.  She aspires to grow her business into a family enterprise. She rents a house with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To buy more varieties of rolls of cloth

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, and all of them are attending school. She is taking care of her sister. 

Margaret has been selling vegetables in the market for four years, working seven days per week. She does not have any other source of income. She has applied for a loan of UGX400,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her purchase more boxes of tomatoes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She joined MCDT to get more capital for her business. She would like to expand her business and begin selling wholesale. She lives in her husband`s house, which has access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.es:
Rogelia tiene 28 años, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de superación. Su pareja es Guzmar, quien se dedica a la construcción civil y es el padre de sus dos hijos: Susana de 7 años y Carlos de 5 meses. 	

Su actividad es la preparación y venta de especerías y condimentos, lo que aprendió de su madre. Elabora deliciosos preparados para guisos y demás comidas. Todo lo preparan en casa y los vende en un puesto del mercado de su localidad. Comenzó hace 4 años con un préstamo particular, vendiendo en pequeñas cantidades, y en la actualidad ve que su negocio ha logrado crecer, por lo que lo considera rentable. Le agrada su trabajo, pues le permite tener un ingreso económico para apoyar a su pareja a solventar los gastos de sus hijos menores, además de tener una ocupación, ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de terminar sus estudios.

Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP y se siente agradecida por la oportunidad brindada de tener una línea de crédito para alcanzar sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a la mayoría de sus miembros y los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de sus especerías, como condimentos y verduras. También adquirirá algunos abarrotes para surtir su puesto.
texts.en:
Rogelia, 28, is a hard-working woman who is determined to get ahead.  Her husband, Guzmar, works in civil construction and is the father of her two children, Susana, 7, and Carlos, 5 months.

She prepares and sells spices and condiments, a trade she learned from her mother.  She makes delicious prepared items for stews and other meals.  She makes it all at home and sells it at a stall in her local market.  She started four years ago with a personal loan, and sold in small quantities.  Now she has been able to grow her business into something she believes is profitable.  She enjoys her work since she can earn her own income and help her husband cover their minor children's expenses.  It allows her to stay busy, since she was unable to finish her education.

This is her third loan through the MFP institution and she is grateful for the opportunity to have this line of credit to reach her goals.  She is happy in her communal bank because she knows most of the members and considers them to be responsible and supportive.

She plans to use the 1,000 PEN loan to buy ingredients for her spice business, such as condiments and vegetables.  She will also buy groceries for her stand.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food and condiments.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard  is a 38-year-old single man. He describes himself to be a principled man. He operates a retail store where he sells gas cylinders. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy business area and his primary customers are the general public.

Benard describes his biggest business challenge to be the high prices of gas. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more gas cylinders and pay for refilling them with gas. His business goal is to run a big shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a bigger shop.

loans.use: to buy more gas cylinders and pay for refilling the cylinders with gas.

loans.name: Msanide

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Msanide. He is married and has a 7-year-old son who is in grade one. Msanide has just completed a training with Mobile Transactions to start running his own mobile money transfers shop.

Msanide is excited to start running his own business because he sees this as a way for him and his family to be empowered. He says the profits he will be getting from his business will help him provide for his family.

When he gets the loan, Msanide will be able to start his business by paying rent for his shop, buying two phones to use for transactions, and procuring some T-shirts and stationery.

He is hopeful that once he gets the Kiva loan, he will be able to start to save up enough money to see his son through college.

In the Video, a representative from Mobile Transactions interviews Msanide.

loans.use: To pay rent for his shop, buy two phones, some T-shirts, and stationery.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Freddy tiene 19 años, es un hombre amable y emprendedor con ganas de superación. Es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de su tía en compañía de sus tres primos.
Su actividad es la venta de carne de res, compra la carne en el camal municipal a los ganaderos y la vende en un puesto del mercado. Se inicio hace más de 4 años por idea de su tía, quien le enseño todo sobre el negocio, comprando en pequeñas cantidades que luego fue aumentando viendo la demanda. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja, logrando tener una buena acogida y siendo muy conocido en el mercado. Antes de empezar tuvo dificultades económicas, ya que los gastos que tiene debe solventarlos solo y debe pagar sus estudios universitarios.

Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP y se siente agradecido con por la oportunidad de continuar con su negocio, además desea seguir contando con más créditos. Por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. 
Con el monto solicitado, de 2500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de tres cabezas de ganado, cada uno valorizado en 900 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Freddy, 19, is a kind, enterprising man who is determined to get ahead.  He is single and has no children, and lives with three cousins in his aunt's home.

He sells beef which he buys at the municipal abbatoir from farmers, then sells at his stand in the market.  He started the business four years ago, encouraged by his aunt who taught him everything he knows.  At first he sold small quantities and then increased according to demand.  He believes business is considerably profitable, based on his earnings, and he has been able to establish himself in the market where he is well-known.  Before starting the business he had economic difficulties because he pays his own expenses and must pay for his university education.

This is his third loan through the MFP institution and he is grateful for the opportunity to continue his business.  He also wants to be able to request more loans, and is committed to paying them back on time.  He plans to use the 2,500 PEN loan to buy three heads of cattle, each worth 900 PEN.

loans.use: To buy three cows to sell beef.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Goldenia

texts.en:
Goldenia is a responsible housewife who takes good care of her three children while her husband manages their farm land. While doing the household chores she is also able to manage her variety store. She aims to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demands. 

Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional loan of PHP 7,000 to buy balot (eggs), soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, soaps and beverages to sell in her store. She believes that her loan will enable her to improve her store and hopes that she will be able to generate sufficient income to satisfy their necessities and save some money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy balot (eggs), soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, soaps and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Begum Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Begum is a milk seller. She and her husband work very hard to put three meals on the table for her family. Her husband is also involved in selling animals such as goats and sheep. Begum has given birth to a son and three daughters. Three of them are studying while her youngest daughter is only two years old.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further expansion of her husband’s animal-selling business. With the loan investment he will buy goats and sheep of young age. He will keep them until they grow and then will sell them to butchers for a profit. He has been operating his business for the past many years and Bushra is confident about his business success after investing the loan. 

Note: in the photo, the lady holding a book called Asasah Passbook is Begum.

loans.use: To buy animals for an animal-sale business.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is a 27-year-old hardworking man with one child living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been baking bread and cakes. He got start-up capital after selling land given to him by his father. He faces problems of inadequate capital to purchase raw materials, price fluctuation and inflation.

He has a personal goal of buying a motorcycle for easy transportation of his goods to market. His business goal is to expand his business into new market areas. 

Frank wants a loan to buy baking ingredients such as wheat and yeast.

loans.use: to buy baking ingredients such as wheat and yeast.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a fridge.

loans.name: Al-Mnal Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Mnal and it consists of 5 members: Aisha, Loul, Mriam, Mnal and Mriam, who are all ladies.  They work hard to offer a good life for their families. They took a loan of 170000 YER from AMB.  Aisha is 51 years old, married and has four children and lives in Hadramout, Yemen. (She is the shortest woman and is located in the center.)  She has been involved in construction and she has a house. She has insufficient money so she needs 30000 YER from AMB to purchase necessary tools like cement to improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase necessary tools like cement to improve her house

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is 27 years old. She is married and blessed with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than five years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is an arc welder who earns about $5 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation expenses, Mom is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Almona Group

texts.en:
This group is called Almona which comprised of five members: Hawa, Muna, Fatima, Khadigh and Farha, all of whom have different businesses. They live in Hadramout, Yemen. They took a loan of 210,000 YER. 

Hawa is the coordinator of the group and she is 39 years old, married and has 4 children (she is the second from the right in the photo). She oversees the issues and responsibilities of each member from a financial aspect. She runs a Koshk store out of her house and is requesting a loan of 50000 YER from AMB to buy newspapers, books and magazines among other things.

loans.use: to buy newspapers, books and magazines among other things for her business.

loans.name: Almoaid Group

texts.en:
This group is called Almoaid which made up of 4 members Safa, Rawiah, Fawziah and Hana who are ladies from Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200000 YER.

Fawziah is 52 years and a very active lady. She is the leader of this group (she is the woman seated in the photo).

She operates a general store business that sells grocery items at very reasonable rates. She has applied for a loan of 40000 YER from AMB for the further expansion of her business. With the loan funds she will buy canned food and soft drinks which will allow her fill her client's orders on time and increase her income. She is confident about her business success

loans.use: to buy canned food and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Qamr Group

texts.en:
This group is called Qamr. This group consists of 4 members: Soad, Samiha, Sawod and Khadigh who live in Aden, Yemen. Sawod is its president. The members have developed business activities and applied for a loan of 190000 YER. 

Sawod is a 52-years-old married woman and has 5 children. She currently has a business selling ladies clothes. She learned the trade and has been in this line work for many years. The loan of 40000 YER from AMB she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying ladies clothes. These items will eventually be sold from her retail space. Working in this manner allows her to help her family move forward.

loans.use: to increase her capital for buying ladies clothes.

loans.name: Happy Friends Development Group

texts.en:
Charles, a member of the group, is predominantly an agriculturalist who does retail farming in the Wakiso district. He is married with five children.

He decided to go into farming because there is market from the town dwellers who depend on market food. He also had no formal education to help him find a job, nor did he have capital to begin business.

He apparently hires the land on which he does the farming and his dream is to buy his own piece of land to maximize profits. He believs he will be able to purchase the land from the profits and the loan.

His major challenge is the unpredictable weather conditions which affect the crops in case of heavy rains or severe sun shine in addition to fluctuating market prices. 

Charles is a very hard working and shrewd man.

loans.use: to buy seeds and hire labour.

loans.name: Tnwir Group

texts.en:
This group is called Tnwir. It consists of four members Nama, Asia, Sadiah and Eyman; they live in Sana`a, Yemen. They took out a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB. 

Asia is 43 years old and has two children. The family live in Sana`a, Yemen. Asia is the lady with the black headscarf whose face is visible in the photo. 

She has a house and she works hard so that she can have a good life with her family. She wants to buy furniture for her house because she lives in it with her family. Hence, she is applying for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her house.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Tha is 41 years old. She is married and resides with her four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been making creel to sell for more than six years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $4 per day. Her children are also construction workers. They earn about $4 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Tha is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase piglets and fodder to use for breeding. By doing so, she would generate additional income to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and much stronger to provide better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and fodder to use for breeding.

loans.name: Leab

texts.en:
Leab is 28 years old. She is married and resides with her mother in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been making trunks (boxes made of palm leaves to use as a tobacco or an areca container) to sell for more than six years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a painter who earns about $10 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Leab is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase paintings to resell. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a painting shop and rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase paintings to resell.

loans.name: Duo Las Marias Group

texts.es: Duo Las Marias. este duo esta integrado por la señora Marisol de 20 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de refacciones em una escuela publica por la mañana, tambien aparte de eso ella se dedica a la elavoracion de tejidos tipicos a mano ella se dedica a estas actividades ya que nececita apoyar a sus padres y tambien por otra parte terminar sus estudios ya que gracias a Dios y a sus esfuerzoz ha podido salir adelante,agradese a kiva por el apoyo que le han brindado ya que gracias a esa ayuda a podido producir barios tejidos tipicos,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima y para la compra de mercaderia para la elavoracion de refacciones, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitados.
texts.en: Marisol, 20 years old, is a member of Duo Las Marias. She sells snacks in a state-run school in the morning; other than that, she also makes typical handwoven cloth. She does both because she needs to help support her parents as well as finish her studies, since thanks to God and her own efforts she has been able to stay afloat. She thanks Kiva for the support it brings, since thanks to Kiva's help she was able to produce several typical handwoven fabrics. She asks for this loan to buy raw materials for weaving as well as supplies to make snacks. She hopes for your help in obtaining this loan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for weaving as well as supplies to make snacks.

loans.name: Lindis

texts.es:
Lindis tiene 38 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y decidida, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está casada con Misael, quien es comerciante y el padre de sus cuatro hijos. Viven en al casa que compraron con el fruto de sus ahorros de varios años.  

Su actividad es la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno, pero ocasionalmente también compra ganado para revenderlo. Tiene un terreno de 55 hectáreas donde tiene a sus animales y tiene el apoyo de una persona que le ayuda con el cuidado. Se inició hace más de 18 años con un capital propio, comprando pocas cantidades, luego fue aumentando. Antes de empezar con este negocio tuvo dificultades económicas, ya que los gastos aumentaron con la llegada de sus hijos,  y ella tiene el deseo de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida, además de apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados que sigue teniendo desea aumentar el número de su ganando.

Este es su préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP y se siente contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para poder avanzar con su negocio, por eso se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en créditos anteriores.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará de un torito bebé valorizado en 500 nuevos soles, con el resto invertirá en el pasto para la alimentación de sus animales.
texts.en:
Lindis is 38 years old.  She is a very hard-working and determined woman who has a great desire to do well in life.  She is married to Misael who works in commerce and is the father of her four children.  They live in a house that they bought with the fruit of their savings which they had accumulated over a number of years.

Lindis' business is raising and selling cattle.  However, she also occasionally buys livestock to re-sell.  She has a 55-hectare plot of land where she keeps her animals and has the support of one person who helps to care for them.  She started this business more than 18 years ago with her own capital, buying in small quantities and then increasing.  Before starting this business she had financial problems because her expenses rose with the arrival of her children.  She wanted to provide her children with a better quality of life and support her partner with the household expenses.  Given the good results she continues to see in her business, she would like to increase the size of her herd.

This is Lindis' 10th loan from MFP and she feels happy and grateful for the opportunity to have a line of credit so that she can make progress in her business.  For this reason, she pledges to make her repayments on time as she did with her previous loans.

Lindis will use the 1,000 soles she has requested to buy a baby bull, valued at 500 soles.   She will invest the rest in buying fodder to feed her animals.

loans.use: to buy a baby bull and feed for her herd

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 41 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy emprendedora. Su pareja es Homero, quien es comerciante, fruto de esa unión tienen tres hijos; Andrea, Homero y Karina de 20, 11 y 15 años respectivamente. Viven en la casa que lograron comprar a base de mucho esfuerzo.

Su actividad es la venta de carne de res en un pequeño puesto que tiene en el mercado de su localidad. Empezó hace más de 12  años, viendo que este producto tiene mucha demanda y hasta ahora le ha ido bien. Esta actividad la realiza con la ayuda de su sobrina para la atención a los clientes. Julia está contenta, pues su negocio le ha permitido tener ingresos económicos sustanciales con los cuales puede pagar los gastos de su hogar y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Tiene planes de crecer y de incursionar en la crianza de ganado, ya que tiene un terreno de 30 hectáreas con los pastos adecuados para ello.

Este es su préstamo número 17 con la institución MFP, además de estar cómoda con su grupo, pues considera a sus miembros personas responsables.
Con el préstamo solicitado, de 3000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más carne de res. También adquirirá alambre para el cerco de su fundo, donde tiene planeado criar su ganado, buscando que estén en un lugar seguro.
texts.en:
Julia is 41 years old.  She is a hard-working and very entrepreneurial woman.  Her partner is Homero, who is a trader.  The couple have three children: Andrea, Homero and Karina, who are 20, 11 and 15 years old respectively.  They live in a house that they worked hard to buy.

Julia's business is selling beef from a small stall in the town market.  She started this business more than 12 years ago, seeing that this product was in high demand.  Up to now her business has done well.  She carries out her work alongside her niece who helps serve the customers.  Julia is happy because her business has allowed her to make substantial income which, in turn, has enabled her to cover her household expenses and offer her children a better quality of life.  She has plans to grow her business and to start raising cattle because she has a 30-hectare plot of land with adequate pasture for this activity.

This is Julia's 17th loan from MFP.  She is very comfortable with her group as she considers the members to be responsible people.  She will invest the loan for 3,000 soles in buying more beef.  She will also buy wire so that she can fence in the land where she plans to raise her cattle so that she can keep them safe.

loans.use: to buy more meat for her stall and to buy wire to fence off the plot of land where she will raise her cattle

loans.name: Aura Marina

texts.es: La señora Aura Marina es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 14 años. El crédito lo invertirá en arroz, azúcar, queso, leche y gaseosa.
texts.en: Aura Marina is a hard-working, entrepreneurial woman who has owned a grocery store for 14 years.  She will invest her loan in buying rice, sugar, cheese, milk and soda.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cheese, milk and soda

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana tiene 28 años, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su pareja es Pedro, quien es comerciante y el padre de su hija Maria de 2 años de edad. Viven en la casa de sus padres, con ellos y sus dos hermanos.

Su actividad es la venta de carne de res, para eso cuenta con un puesto instalado en el mercado de su localidad, donde atiende, muy amablemente, a sus clientes hace más de 12 años. Esta actividad la realiza con la ayuda de su hermana y ocasionalmente de su pareja. Le gusta su negocio, pues le permite contar con un oficio y sentirse una persona productiva, además los ingresos económicos que le genera solventan los gastos de su hogar. Por otro lado, no le gusta que algunos de sus clientes le soliciten crédito, a lo que ella se niega, pues ya tuvo malas experiencias. Tienen planes de incrementar su negocio para seguir creciendo y generar más ingresos económicos.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con la institución MFP y se siente contenta de contar con un capital de trabajo para poder entregar los pedidos que tiene pendiente. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal por considerarlo un grupo unido y colaborador.
Con el préstamo solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de carne de res en mayor volumen.
texts.en:
Diana is 28 years old.  She is a hard-working, determined woman who has a great desire to make progress in life.  Her partner is Pedro, who is a trader and the father of her 2-year-old daughter Maria.  They live in her parents' home with her parents and two siblings. 

Diana's business is selling beef and she has a stall in the town market where she serves her customers in a very friendly manner.  She has been doing this for more than 12 years.  She works together with her sister and occasionally her partner.  Diana enjoys her business as it gives her a job and makes her feel productive.  In addition, the income that she makes covers her household expenses.  What she does not like is when some of her customers ask to buy on credit and she says 'no' because she has had bad experiences in the past.  Diana has plans to increase her business so that she can continue growing it and making more income.

This is Diana's fourth loan from MFP and she feels happy to have working capital so that she can deliver the orders that she has pending.  In addition, she feels very happy with her community bank because she considers it to be a united and cooperative group.

Diana will invest her 1,000 soles loan in buying beef in bulk.

loans.use: to buy meat for her stall

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 42 years old, married and has five children. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for years. 

Nancy would like to improve her hog-raising business to be able to provide for the needs of her children and send them to higher levels of education. Nancy would like to make her dreams come true by asking for additional working capital amounting to PHP 12,000. This amount would really help her to attain her dream in life. She will be using her requested loan to buy feed for her piglets. She hopes that her raised piglets will sell for a higher price so that she can cover her family's daily needs and pay their monthly electric bills.

loans.use: to buy feed for her piglets.

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Vy is 39 years old. She is married and resides with seven children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. 

She has been selling coconut and cake for more than five years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is involved in raising pigs and grinding rice to sell. In addition, he has a horse cart delivery service. Approximately, he earns $8 per day. All of her children are still in her care and in school. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Vy is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase piglets to raise in order to resell when they gain weight. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise in order to resell when they gain weight.

loans.name: Duo Verdad Y Vida Group

texts.es: DUO VERDAD Y VIDA,Es conformada por las señoras María de 46 años de edad, una mujer casada y comerciante desde hace 17 años, doña Maria se dedica a la venta de  comida en su domicilio, hace dos años tomo la iniciativa de incluir dentro de su negocio la venta de tortillas pero debido al tiempo que  la elaboración de las  tortillas conlleva no se daba abasto en atender la  elaboración y venta de comida invito a la señora Dora a quien conoció desde hace varios  años a apoyarla en la tortillería, este nuevo proceso ha sido bastante satisfactorio para su clientela de  todos los días, ahora ambas tienen la idea de  mejorar las instalaciones del local que comparten de sus negocios, quieren incluir mesas para los clientes que desean consumir sus alimentos en ese lugar, al tener esto también desean vender refacciones como, panes con jamo, panes con chile relleno, hamburguesas licuados frutas etc. Es por ello que ambas solicitan de apoyo económico para lograr sus objetivos  como socias o aliadas de  negocios.
texts.en:
DUO VERDAD Y VIDA.
46-year-old Maria is married and has been selling food from home for 17 years.  Two years ago she started selling tortillas as part of her business but, owing to the time it took to make the tortillas, she wasn't able to both make the tortillas and sell her food.  As a result, she invited Dora, who she had known for a number of years, to support her in the tortilla business.  This has worked out pretty well for her everyday customers.  The two women currently plan to improve the premises that they share for their businesses.  They would like to include tables for the customers who want to eat their food on the premises.  They would also like to start selling snacks such as ham sandwiches, 'stuffed chili' sandwiches, hamburgers, smoothies, fruit, etc.  They are both requesting financial support so that they can achieve their goals as business partners.

loans.use: to buy materials for doing some refurbishment work

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria Cristina de 43 años de edad,ella se dedica desde hace 5 años a la crianza de animales(pollos)tambien a parte de eso ella se dedica a la venta de atoles y tostadas,en el mercado municipal,lamentable mente doña Cristina se quedo viuda desde hace 9 años,y ella se quedo responsable de sus 5 hijos y gracias a Dios a podido sacar adelante a sus hijos,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas animales para la crianza(pollos)ya que su anelo es agrandar un poco mas su negocio.
texts.en: Maria Cristina is 43 years old. She has been raising animals (chickens) for five years. In addition to this, she also sells 'atoles' (a traditional hot drink) and 'tostadas' in the town market. Unfortunately, Cristina was widowed nine years ago. She is responsible for her five children and, thanks to God, she has managed to get them ahead in life. She is requesting this loan to buy more animals (chickens) to raise because her wish is to expand her business a little further.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise (chickens)

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 19 years old. At her age, Cristina has become involved in the hog-raising business. She has been in this business for two years and usually receives a net profit of PHP 7,500 every time she disposes of them. 

Right now, Cristina is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000 to purchase feed and vitamins for her hogs. She believes that through her loan, she will be able to continuously meet their family household needs.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov is 52 years old. She is married and resides with nine children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than 20 years, earning approximately $6 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Four of her children are construction workers who earn about $20 per day. 

In order to improve her business, Pov is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a cow to breed in order to produce calves to sell. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed in order to produce calves to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet believes that through patience and hard work, her family will survive poverty. She is a hard-working mother who is engaged in buying and selling vegetables to help her husband in financing their family's needs. Because of the high costs of basic commodities, Juliet aims to improve her small business to meet her child's basic necessities.

Juliet is asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy string beans, squash, potatoes and eggplants to sell in the village of Carabatan Chica. She says that this loan will help to make the business grow as she continues to work and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy string beans, squash, potatoes and eggplants to sell.

loans.name: Vart

texts.en:
Vart is 40 years old. He is married and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

He has been running the taxi service (tuk tuk taxi) for more than five years, earning approximately $5 per day. His wife is employed in a garment factory. She earns about $3 per day. 

Because the tuk tuk is old, Vart is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a new tuk tuk to run the taxi service. This purchase will help him attract more customers and earn more income to support the family. In the future, he would like to build a new house and help his children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a new tuk tuk taxi to run the taxi service.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is from the village of Carabatan Chica. She is 31 years old and has two children. 

She has been engaged in the piggery business for one year. She says it is not easy work to take on this occupation. Her business serves as a source of income for the family that helps provide for their daily needs. 

Now she is requesting a loan of 15,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase feed and vaccines to sustain her hog-raising business. In the future, Margarita hopes that her business will expand to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccines to sustain her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 33, married and has three children. 

She owns and manages a variety store in their village to supplement her husband's income. Despite the hardships and difficulties in life, they aim to uplift their status of living and give their children a better future. She aims to strengthen her variety store to earn a higher income and provide their necessities. 

To improve the business, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy soft drinks, snack foods, breads, noodles and seasonings to sell. She hopes that this loan will help to improve her variety store. She hopes that in the future, she will make the business grow and be profitable.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, snack foods, breads, noodles and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley, a 26-year-old married mother of three, resides in Cauayan City where she has been engaged in a hog-raising business for almost four years. With her strong determination in life, she is able to make her business grow so that she can sustain the needs of her family.

In order to make her enterprise more productive and earn more profits, Shirley is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase hogs to raise and feed for them. Shirley hopes that she will be granted this loan amount to improve her business and uplift the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase hogs to raise and feed for them.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en: Sergio, aged 46, focuses on his farming business in order to achieve his hope of a comfortable living. Now requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides, Sergio is hoping that these inputs will be a great help in developing his farming business. If that happens, their poor living conditions will improve, which will make him a very happy father and husband.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Maria Sofia

texts.es: Maria Sofia,de 44 años de edad ella se dedica desde hace 4 años a la crianza de animales(cerdos y vacas)actual mente tiene 3 cerdos embras,y todas estan en gestacion, es asi como ella lucha dia a dia para seguir con su negocio ya que de esta actividad ella sostiene economicamente a su familia, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas animales(cerdos y vacas) ya que quiere agrandar mas su negocio, espera que Kiva le pueda ayudar con el credito solicitado y asi de esa forma ayudarla con su negocio de crianza y venta de animales.
texts.en: 44-year-old Maria Sofia has been raising animals (pigs and cows) for four years.  She currently has three sows who are all pregnant.  She works hard every day in her business as this is how she provides for her family financially.  She is requesting this loan to buy more animals (pigs and cows) as she would like to further expand her business.  She hopes that Kiva can help her with the loan she is requesting and thereby help her with her business raising and selling animals.

loans.use: to buy and sell animals (pigs and cows)

loans.name: Nally

texts.en:
Nally's primary source of income comes from raising hogs to breed and fatten for future sale. She has been raising hogs for years. She usually earns an income of PHP 7,000 for each hog she is able to sell. Nally sells her hogs to the butchers who come into her village. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy hog feed, medicines, and vaccines to ensure proper growth and nutrition. She wants to improve her hog-selling business. In the future, Nally would like to enhance her business in order to earn enough money for the college education of her four children.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, medicines, and vaccines to ensure proper growth and nutrition.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is from the village of Carabatan Chica. She is 54 years old and is married to Abello. 

Myrna raises pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. 

Myrna is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase pigs, feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is a 50-year-old, divorced woman. To support herself, Hanan started doing a sewing business. She has applied for this loan to buy more threads in hopes that in the future she would open her own tailoring and sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy more threads

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en:
Aysha is a 46-year-old married woman. Her husband has two jobs. Both of them are still caring for two of their children as the rest are married and independent. 

As help from Aysha, she started using the sewing machine that she has to do some small tailoring business for the neighbors, but now she wants to turn it into a more official business. For that, she has applied for this loan to buy a new sewing machine and more fabric and threads to make more clothes.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and more fabric and threads

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif is a 35-year-old man who lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and two daughters. He is farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years. He chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in the Azerbaijan family and also make fresh punch.

Asif sells his crop in the BIlasuvar central bazaar. His monthly income is 200 AZN. His wife actively helps him to raise crops.

As his products are in high demand, Asif wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for 1,000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en:
Fadwa is a 55-year-old married woman. Her husband works as a guard for a governmental entity at night. Fadwa works as a trainer in a physical treatment center during the daytime.

Fadwa and her husband opened a small convenience store where both of them work by shifts; her husband in the daytime, and Fadwa works in the evening. Now she has applied for this loan to bring in more food products to the store.

loans.use: to bring in more food products to the store.

loans.name: Kouami

texts.fr: Dodji est un homme de 35 ans et père de 2 enfants tous scolarisés. Il est revendeur de profession et s’est spécialisé dans la commercialisation de ferrailles et de plastiques d’usage. Confronté au manque d’argent, il lui arrive de ne pas s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante à même de pouvoir couvrir sa demande. Dodji opère depuis 2010 dans cette activité et sollicite de WAGES un prêt pour se réapprovisionner en marchandises. Il espère un jour disposer d’un lieu de stockage et plus tard d’un grand magasin. Il souhaiterait multiplier ses points de service et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Dodji is a 35-year old man and the father of two children, both in school. He is a vendor by trade, specializing in selling scrap metal and used plastic. Facing a cash shortage, he does not always manage to have sufficient stock in order to even meet existing demand. Dodji has been working in this field for 2010. He is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to replenish his stock. He hopes to have a storage facility one day, and later on a big store. He would like to increase his sale points and be able to pay for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal and used plastic.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 40-year-old, single woman. She is IDP (internally displaced people) and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Zahida has bred sheep for more than 10 years. She receives 50 AZN monthly financial support from the government, but this is too low to cover family needs.

Zahida usually buys lambs, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then resells for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her brother helps her to look after the cattle and sell them in the bazaar. Her monthly income is 100 AZN and this business is the main source of financial income in her family. 

Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Zahida wants to expand her business and improve her life conditions. She applied for 900 AZN loan to purchase one baby calf and one milk cow.

loans.use: to buy one baby calf and one milk cow

loans.name: Rafael Jose

texts.es: El señor Rafael es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor quien tiene una mueblería desde hace 8 años principalmente realiza juego de sillas y comedores. El crédito lo invertirá en madera, cellador, pintura, clavos, tornillos, mano de obra, junco, marco, pega…etc. para realizar sillas, comedores y mesas.
texts.en: Rafael is a hard-working and enterprising man.  He has had a furniture shop for eight years.  He primarily makes dining room table and chair sets.  He will use the loan to buy wood, sealant, paint, nails, screws, reeds, frames, varnish, etc.  He will also pay for labor.  He will do this in order to make chairs, dining room tables, and tables.

loans.use: to buy wood, sealant, paint, nails, screws, reeds, frames, varnish, etc.  He will also pay for labor.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is a 32-year-old married lady caring for two children. Her husband works two jobs to improve their living conditions. Iman helps her husband to provide their kids with the best life they can afford. She has an embroidery business and works from home. She gets blank pieces of cloth or scarves and embroiders them based on what the client asks for, or on traditional embroidery designs. She has applied for this loan to get more thread and more clothing items to increase her productivity.

loans.use: to get more thread and more clothing items

loans.name: Fayza

texts.en: Fayza, a 22-year-old single lady, is the oldest of six siblings. Fayza attends university to study finance and banking, as she is passionate about this field. She has applied for this loan to pay her upcoming semester fees to be able to register.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 58-year-old widow who is raising four children alone. She is an IDP and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She receives a pension, but it is too low to cover the needs of her beloved children. Sakina has been breeding cattle for the last 20 years. 

Sakina usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then resells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 180 Azerbaijani manats (AZN), and this is the only source of financial income in her family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Sakina also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors. Her older son helps her to raise the livestock and look after them. 

She wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She applied for a 1,500-AZN loan in order to purchase two calves, one milking cow, and fodder. This will be her second loan, and she has good credit history.

loans.use: to buy two calves, one milking cow, and fodder

loans.name: Marie Christelle

texts.fr: Marie Christelle une  femme agée de 49 ans mariée, mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 9  et 24 ans . elle   exerce son activité à savoir un centre d'appel téléphonique et de transfert de crédit et aussi la vente des fruits au meme comptoir dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 2 ans déjà pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa petite famille. Actuellement, elle achète et vend les unités pour appels téléphoniques en détail et sa marge bénéficiaire n'est pas élévée. Elle souhaiterai acheter ses unités en gros pour vendre non seulement en détail, mais aussi en gros ce qui lui donnera plus de benéfices. Elle veut aussi augmenter le stock des fruits qu'elle vend sur le même comptoir (mangues et mandarines, oranges) en fonction des saisons.Le Benefice tiré de ce crédit, lui permettra d'augmenter à nouveau son fonds de commerce(réinvestir dans son activité en augmentant le montant du crédit de communication) et d'aider en partie son époux à subvenir aux  besoins quotidiens de leur petite famille.
texts.en:
Marie Christelle is a 49-year-old married mother of four children aged 9 to 24. She runs a phone use and credit center where she also sells fruits. She has been conducting her business for two years in a district of the capital to help support her family.

She currently buys and sells phone credit units at retail, and her profit margin is rather low. She would like to buy them wholesale, and sell at retail and wholesale to increase her profits. She also wants to increase her stock of fruits (mangoes, mandarins, oranges) depending on the season. 

With the profits earned through this loan, she plans to bolster her working capital (reinvesting in her activity by raising the phone communication credit fee) and to help her husband to provide for the family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fruits and phone credit units.

loans.name: Los Altos Iv Group

texts.es:
La señora Romana está casada, tiene 56 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica a la atención atienda en general, inicio este negocio vendiendo artículos y verduras, y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo que lo utilizara para la compra de más productos: aguas gaseosa, jugos, fideos, azúcar, sal, golosinas, etc. Espera en el futuro tener más capital y un mejor negocio. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio a la compra  y venta de distintos artículos.
texts.en:
Romana is 56 years old, she is married and she could not go to school. She runs a general store, an activity she started by selling vegetables and general items, and today she can count on 10 years of experience. Her husband is a farmer and she can count in his support.

She has organized a group to request a loan that she will use to buy more products such as sodas, juices, noodles, sugar, salt and sweets. In the future she hopes to have more working capital and to run a better activity. The other members of the group are retailers buying and selling different products.

loans.use: To buy  sodas, juices, noodles, sugar, salt and sweets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: sell by catalog and also distribute products from her home.

loans.name: Abdulkareem

texts.en:
Abdulkareem is 34 years old and married with two children.

Abdulkareem has two jobs. He works as a teacher in a school for boys and also has his own business, which is a computer and cell-phone maintenance shop.

Now Abdulkareem has applied for this loan to buy more spare parts for computers and cell phones. This will enable him to expand his maintenance business and increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for computers and cell phones.

loans.name: Vafa

texts.en:
Vafa is 36 years old and married with four sons. She is an internally displayed person who lives in Bilasuvar, an IDP settlement. Vafa has bred cattle and cows for the last 13 years. Her husband is a builder and his job is not permanent. 

Vafa usually buys small calves, which she raises and fattens for five to six months and then resells for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 180 AZN. This business is only one source of financial income in her family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Zeynab also keeps milk cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.  

Vafa wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She has applied for a 1700 AZN loan to purchase three cattle, one milk cow and fodder.  This will be her second loan and she has good credit history.
