That she lives in an area of extreme heat plays in her favor as her clients already come to her to buy the refreshing drinks that they need.  She converted a small area of her mother's house to carry out her work.  Her mother sells food and this became a perfect opportunity to implement the sale of drinks.  She has had this business for 3 years and it has permitted her to provide for everything necessary for the care of her children and their studies.  At first it was complicated for her because she didn’t have a place to keep her drinks cold but fortunately she was able to buy her own freezer and overcome this hitch.  Now everything is going well and her plans to grow continue.

This is her first loan with MFP, therefore she is very grateful to those who are making it possible.  On the other hand, she is very committed to complying with the punctual payment of her installments very responsably.  She is very pleased to belong to her communal bank, since all of the members are very good, kind and supportive of each other.  With the amount requested (S/. 700) she will buy more drinks to continue to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks to continue to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
Monica tiene 27 años, es una mujer emprendedora, luchadora y muy trabajadora. Tiene una relación desde hace 7 años con Jesús, con quien tiene un hijo de 6 años, a quien ama con todo su corazón. Actualmente vive junto a su familia en la casa de sus padres y juntos hacen todo el esfuerzo para salir adelante.

Su trabajo es la elaboración de cigarros artesanales comúnmente llamados “mapachos”. Estos cigarros son fabricados usando como materia prima el tabaco que también es obtenido de manera tradicional en especie de barras macizas o fajas compactas. Este insumo lo obtiene comprando en algunos almacenes de la ciudad o a personas que solo lo venden por algunas temporadas, es por eso que cuando encuentra el material tiene que comprar en cantidades altas para poder estar abastecida. Para elaborar los cigarros corta manualmente el tabaco en pequeñas hileras y luego las coloca en papeles, finalmente los enrolla, los agrupa de diez en diez, y luego los vende en pequeños paquetes, al por mayor. Trabaja en este negocio todos los días, desde hace 3 años y desde que empezó  ha tenido siempre el apoyo y la colaboración de su madre. Le gusta mucho su actividad porque le genera los ingresos necesarios para poder sobrellevar los gastos de su familia; sin embargo, reconoce que al principio no le fue nada fácil porque no tenía clientes, pero gracias a la recomendación de sus amigos logró conseguir personas que le compren y ahora le va muy bien.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
El monto solicitado (S/. 500) lo invertirá en la compra de tabaco para mantenerse abastecida de su materia prima.
texts.en:
Monica is 27 years old and is a fighter, an entrepreneurial woman and very hard working. She has been in a relationship with Jesús for the past seven years. With him she has a 6 year old child whom she loves with all of her heart. She currently lives with her family in her parents house and together they make the effort to get ahead. 

Her work is making artisan cigars which are commonly called "mapachos". These cigars are made using the raw material of tobacco which is obtained from a traditional method in solid bars or compact bands. She purchases this material from stores in the city or from people who sell it during certain seasons. For this reason when she finds the material she has to buy it in large quantities to be supplied. To make the cigars she manually cuts the tobacco into small strands and then places them in papers, she finally rolls them and groups them in tens. She then sells them wholesale in small packets. She has worked in this business everyday for the past three years when she began to have the support and collaboration of her mother. She likes this work a lot because it generates the necessary revenue in order to handle the family expenses. However, she recognizes that in the beginning it was not easy for her because she did not have clients. Thanks to her friends' recommendations she was able to acquire customers who buy from her and now it is going very well for her. 

This is her first loan with MFP and she is very content to know that she has financial support because with it she will feel more sure of advancing with her work. Also, she is committed to complying with on time payments of her loan. She is also very happy to belong to a communal bank because all of the members are very responsible and supportive. 

The amount requested (500 soles) will be invested in the purchase of tobacco in order to maintain a supply of this raw material. 
El monto solicitado (S/. 500) lo invertirá en la compra de tabaco para mantenerse abastecida de su materia prima.

loans.use: to buy tobacco to make the cigars that she sells.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
This is Eric. He previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories for, and pay for the maintenance of, his tricycle. His earnings assisted with the education of his children and their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of his tricycle and also to buy some equipment to use in his repair shop. His profits from his business will help him to sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Eric hopes to buy another tricycle and support his children's schooling up to college level. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from his studies of the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
This is Marina. She previously accessed a 21,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy spare parts and accessories for the maintenance of the tricycle unit she and her husband own. Her earnings were a big help toward the education of her children and the family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

Marina is applying for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy more spare parts for the maintenance of the tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will help her to sustain her family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marina dreams to be able to give her children a good and high-quality education through her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their Tricycle unit.

loans.name: Lia

texts.es:
Lia tiene 52 años, es una mujer que ha trabajado siempre para salir adelante. Hace muchos años que está separada de quien fue su pareja por mucho tiempo. Tiene seis hijos mayores con quienes vive, junto a sus nietos. Su casa la construyeron en un asentamiento humano y su vida no ha sido fácil, pero ella siempre le pone una gota de optimismo a todo lo que hace.

Su trabajo es la venta de golosinas y abarrotes en general, implementó una pequeña bodega en su casa, donde ofrece todo tipo de productos. Atiende todos los días, su pequeña tienda siempre es muy concurrida por ser la único de su barrio en ofrece variedad. Ella es muy conocida por su buen humor y carisma y esa actitud ha hecho que sus vecinos le tengan mucho cariño y sus ventas aumenten. La necesidad de ser independiente y los gastos familiares que a diario tenía que cubrir fueron los motivos principales que le llevaron a desarrollar este trabajo. Lleva ya 5 años en esta actividad, lo hace sola, y al principio sentía que nunca iba a poder tener un negocio en su casa, porque vendía las golosinas de manera ambulatoria por las calles, pero no conseguía vender mucho y se sentía frustrada. Esa situación cambió y ahora se siente más tranquila vendiendo en la bodega que instaló en su casa y que pudo conseguir con muchísimo esfuerzo. Lo que más le gusta es conversar con sus clientes y hacerlos reír, considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse muy temprano para atender. Sin embargo, sabe que eso le traerá buenos resultados económicos al final del día. Le encantaría tener, algún día, una tienda distribuidora de golosinas para vender todos sus productos al por mayor.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes lo hacen posible para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometida en cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios entre sí.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 700) comprará mayor cantidad de golosinas y abarrotes para surtir su negocio y seguir vendiendo con fluidez.
texts.en:
Lia, 52, is a woman who has always worked to get ahead.  She’s been separated from her spouse for many years.  She has six adult children that live with her and her grandchildren.  She built her house in a human settlement and her life hasn’t been easy but she always puts a drop of optimism into everything she does.

Her work consists in selling snacks and groceries in general.  She set up a small store at home where she offers all types of products.  She’s open every day and her small store is always busy because it’s the only one in her neighborhood that offers variety.  She’s very well-known for her good humor and charisma and that attitude has led to her neighbors holding her in high esteem and her sales increase as a result.

The need to be independent and to cover daily household expenses were the main reasons that led her to this work.  She’s been in business for five years.  She works by herself and at the beginning felt that she’d never be able to have a business at home because she used to sell snacks as a street vendor from place to place.  She’d get frustrated because she didn’t sell very much that way.

That situation changed and now she feels more tranquil selling in the store she installed at home and was able to get with very much effort.  What she likes best is chatting with her customers and making them laugh.  She feels that the most difficult thing is having to get up very early to start tending to customers.   However, she knows that this will produce good economic results at the end of the day.  She’d love someday to have a snack distributorship to sell all her products at wholesale.

This is her first MFP loan so she thanks those who make it possible for her to continue towards her objectives.  She is very committed to make her payments punctually and responsibly.  She’s very happy to belong to her communal bank because all the members are good, kind and mutually supportive.

She will use the requested 700 soles to buy larger amounts of snacks and groceries to stock her store and to continue selling smoothly.

loans.use: to buy snacks and sweets to stock her store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lors

texts.en:
Lors is a 56-year-old married man and a father of six children who resides in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province. He and his wife work in the same type of business, cultivating crops (such as bananas, beans, and sesame) on their farmland. Lors has a lot of work to do on his farm every day, so he works tirelessly at the field from morning until evening to ensure good growth of his crops. From this business, Lors can generate approximately USD 4.00 per day for household use.

Now he would like to take out a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to use on his crops and to pay for labor costs. He believes that through this loan, he will be able to improve his business and make it more viable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to use on his crops and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Doep

texts.en:
Doep, age 37, operates a hog-raising business as the main source of her family’s income. She raises and sells her mature pigs to a local butcher for slaughter. From this business, she can earn a good income to meet the needs of her family and provide a daily allowance to her school-aged child. She is a widowed woman who has two children, one of whom is already married and lives away from the family while the other one is living with her in a home in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province.

In order to sustain her hog-raising business, Doep is requesting a loan of KHR 1,000,000 to purchase feed for fattening her pigs. Providing enough food and taking care of her pigs carefully will make them become healthy and mature early. She hopes that she can earn a better income from this investment. She will reinvest her generated income in the business to double the return in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed for fattening her pigs.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 26 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora. Tiene un hijo de 4 años que es su principal motor de vida. Vive junto a otros miembros de su familia en la casa propia que obtuvo como herencia de su abuelita y a pesar de algunas carencias siempre tiene una sonrisa para enfrentar la vida. 

Su actividad consiste en la venta de gaseosas y cervezas heladas desde hace más de 2 años. También brinda servicio doméstico en algunas viviendas que requieran su mano de obra en cocina, lavado de prendas o limpieza del hogar. Está muy contenta con ambos trabajos porque puede estar en contacto constante con sus amigos, vecinos y algunos clientes con lo que a formado una buena relación de negocio. Si bien es cierto que su negocio le produce buenos ingresos económicos, siente que aún es poco para alcanzar cubrir sus principales gastos en su hogar y es por ello que más adelante desea establecer una tienda de abarrotes en el que pueda vender muchos artículos y sus ganancias se multipliquen. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes lo hacen posible para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometida a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios entre sí.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 500) comprará mayor cantidad de cervezas y gaseosas para continuar vendiendo y obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Sandra is 26 years old and is a very happy and hard working woman. She has a four year old child who is the driving force of her life. She lives with other members of her family in her own house that she inherited from her grandmother and despite some needs, she always has a smile to face life.

Her work has consisted of the sale of sodas and cold beers for over two years. She also provides domestic work in some households that require her help in the kitchen, washing garments or cleaning the house. She is very happy with both jobs because she can be in constant contact with her friends, neighbors and some customers with whom she has formed a good business relationship. It is true that her business provides a good income for her. She feels that although it is still not much to cover her main household expenses and it is because of this that she wishes to establish her own grocery store in the future where she would be able to sell more items and her earnings would multiply. 

This is her first loan with MFP and she thanks those who make it possible for her to continue with her goals. On the other hand, she is very committed to making punctual loan payment with a lot of responsibility. She is also very happy to belong to her communal bank because all of the members are very good, friendly and supportive of each other.

With the amount requested (500 PEN), she will buy a greater quantity of beers and sodas to continue selling and obtain greater earnings.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beers to continue selling.

loans.name: Ean

texts.en:
Ean is 39 years old and married, living with her family in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is a responsible mother of two children who currently are attending school. She and her husband work together to manage their rice-farming business, harvesting twice a year. Aside from this, Ean is busy with taking care of her pigs at home in order to add more income to the family. She raises piglets for slaughter. 

Due to inadequate capital, Ean would like to borrow from Kiva lenders, through HKL, to pay for the operating expenses of cultivating her family's rice crops and to purchase feed for fattening her piglets. She believes that she can increase her yields and income in the following months.

loans.use: to pay for operating expenses of cultivating her rice crops and purchase feeds for fattening her piglets.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is 32 years old and lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is married and blessed with two children. 

She has been making creel (baskets) to sell for more than four years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a soldier who earns about $5 per day. 

Sokha is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase timbers to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn Bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase timbers to build a new house.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
This is Sofia. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase hogs and feed needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional hogs and feed needed for her business. The profits from her business will help to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Sofia hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to support her children's schooling up to college level. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs and feed.

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
This is Maria Theresa, 52, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Marciano, a carpenter, and a mother to her children.She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Maria Theresa operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, and dahlias, and also varieties of hanging plants and others. She also grows local banana and pineapple for extra income in her small farm. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the community.  She earns a minimum of Php400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and garden inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Maria Theresa hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening materials and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Acyprian

texts.en: Acyprian is a thirty-seven-year-old hardworking man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the agriculture sector for seven years. His hardships include unpredictable weather changes. His personal goals are educating his children, building a permanent home for residence and self-education. His business goals are buying land to grow crops and expanding his business into new markets. Acyprian wants money to buy building materials for construction of his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials for construction of his house.

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Sophan is 35 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture above) is a construction worker. In addition, he is a rice farmer. Approximately, he earns about $5 per day.  One of her children is employed as garment worker who earns about $2 per day.

 In order to improve her family’s living conditions, Sophan is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland and carrying her crops. This purchase will help her reduce the expenses of her farming. In the future, she would like to run an additional business to generate extra income to support the family and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland and carrying her crops

loans.name: Tri Yuli

texts.en:
Ibu (Mrs.) Tri is a recent Ruma’s entrepreneur who focuses on becoming one of Loket Ruma agent. Loket Ruma is the new product line that helps our micro entrepreneur become a payment point. She calls herself a true entrepreneur who provides payment services. However, she currently doesn’t own a shop or store. So, customers come directly to her to pay their bill. Ibu Tri is married and has two children, 15 years old and 4 years old.

This EDC machine  will help her to increase her payment business. She hopes people will come to her to actually buy airtime prepaid minutes and also to pay their electricity bill, buy an electricity voucher, and pay their house installment. She believes that this business will eventually add up to more income for her.

loans.use: To pay for a deposit on an electronic data capture (EDC) machine for her bill payment business

loans.name: Paskari

texts.en: Paskari is a forty-three-year-old married man with eight children, living in Kasese, Uganda. His hardships are customers not paying on time, inadequate capital to meet the different tastes and preferences of customers, price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent home. His business goals are expanding into new markets and moving his business to a more permanent location. Paskari wants money to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en: Scovia is a 30-year-old married woman with two children, living in Kasese, Uganda.  She has been farming for seven years.  She started with one acre, and now she has four. Her hardships are seasonal weather changes, price fluctuation, and inflation. Her personal goal is educating her children, and her business goal is buying land to grow more crops.  Scovia is asking for a loan for money to buy fertilizers for her banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her banana plantation.

loans.name: Amon

texts.en: Amon is a 26-year-old married man with two children, living in Kasese, Uganda.  He has operated a stationery shop for two years. His hardships are inadequate capital to purchase stock, high fuel costs, transportation costs, price fluctuations, and inflation. His personal goals are educating his children, building a permanent home, and self education.  His business goal is expanding his business into new markets.  Amon is seeking a loan to buy a photocopying machine.

loans.use: to buy a  photocopying machine

loans.name: Saliya

texts.ru:
Салие 54 года, замужем, мать 7 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Салия на протяжении 35 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 6,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Салии в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  10 овец, 2 коровы и теленок, 4 коз и 2 лошади, продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 15,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Салия обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Салия планирует вложить в оплату обучения младшего сына.
texts.en:
Saliya is 54 years old, she is married and has seven children. She has been doing animal husbandry and field crop cultivation for 35 years as a main source of income for her family, a business which she began with an amount of 6,000 som. Because of her hard work Saliya now has ten sheep, two cows and a calf, four goats and two horses with the sale of milk and dairy products which brings her around 15,000 som (KGS) a month.

Saliya has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS with a goal to further grow her business and buy additional heads of cattle. She plans to invest the profit from the loan to pay for her youngest son's education.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Kuluiypa

texts.ru:
Кулуйпе 55 лет, вдова, мать 2 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Кулуйпа на протяжении 20 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 1,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Кулуйпы в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  15 овец, 5 коров и теленок, 3 козы и 3 лошади, продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 4,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулуйпа обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Кулуйпа планирует вложить в ремонт своего дома.
texts.en:
Kuluiypa is 55 years old, she is a widow and mother of two children. As a main source of income for her family Kuluiypa has been doing animal husbandry for twenty years which she started with an amount of 1,000 som. Because of her hard work Kuluiypa now has fifteen sheep, five cows and a calf, three goats and three horses as well as a sale of milk and dairy products which brings around 4,000 som a month.

With a goal to further grow her business Kuluiypa has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy additional heads of cattle. She plans to invest the income from the loan into renovation of her house.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, sand, window frames, glass, etc.) in order to continue building his house.

loans.name: Leap

texts.en:
Leap is 42 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for more than ten years, earning approximately $8 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about $4 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Leap is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike. This purchase will help her reduce their transportation expenses and carry the vegetables to sell faster and in larger amounts. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her child earn a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
In the photo, Im, who is 47 years old, stands in front of her house in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She lives there with her three younger children, while her oldest child is married and lives away. Im is in the business of cultivating rice on the family's inherited farmland.  She tries hard to generate income for her family. Since she became a single parent, she has strived to work harder to provide the basic needs of all her children. Also, some of Im's children help in the business. Recently, two of her children have taken other jobs to help her earn income. Her daughter works as a farm laborer for a local villager, and her son drives a car for a construction company in the province.

As of now, Im is taking out a loan to pay for plowing fees and to purchase a few sacks of fertilizer for her rice crops. This will help her manage her business well, and she hopes she can obtain a good harvest in the following season. In the future, Im wants to expand her farmland and wants to be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees and purchase a few sacks of fertilizer for her rice crops.

loans.name: Lilya

texts.en:
Lilya is involved in agriculture. She runs a farm where she cultivates land, keeps an orchard of grape trees, and breeds chickens. 

Lilya needs sufficient funds to cultivate the trees and plants on her farm to ensure their stable growth. With the loan's help, Lilya plans to purchase medicine and six bags of fertilizer. This is important for Lilya to gather a rich harvest, from the sales of which she gets the main income for her family. 

Lilya lives in Aghavnadzor village with her husband and three children. She works at the local school as a teacher, but her salary does not allow her to cover the family's costs. Growth of agriculture is important for Lilya to have a stable income and ensure access to education for her children in the future.

loans.use: to pay for medicine and six bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Pan

texts.en:
Pan is a widowed woman who has been living in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is now 70 years old and has three grown-up children, all of whom are already married. Pan has spent most of her lifetime dedicated to growing crops, from which she can generate income to satisfy her family. She primarily plants rice, in addition to sesame seeds and beans. 

To improve her business and collect a fruitful harvest in the coming season, Pan is asking for a loan of 600,000 KHR to add to her capital to rent a plot of land for growing sesame seeds. She is very happy and thankful for constant help from lenders in her business. Through the loan, she hopes to better her living standard.

loans.use: to rent a plot of land for growing sesame seeds.

loans.name: Kelezestom

texts.en:
Kelezestom is a 44-year-old married man with four children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has a produce business that he has run for five years. He started by practicing agriculture. Then, he saved and started buying produce from other farmers. 

Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are affecting the business growth. He would like to educate his children and expand his business into new markets. Kelezestom wants a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Expedicto

texts.en:
Expedicto is a 50-year-old married man with 4 children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He operates a retail shop, and he has been in this business for 3 years.  He started the business with a capital of 100,000 shillings, and he now has 500,000 shillings as working capital. He faces a problem of customers not paying on time.  His personal goal is to educate his children, and his business goal is expanding his business into new markets.
 Expedicto is seeking a loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar for resale in his shop.

loans.use: to buy general merchadise such as soap and sugar to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 28-year-old married man, living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been rearing cattle for two years. He started with two cattle from his father, and he now has five cows that produce ten litres of milk a day. Charles says that price fluctuations and inflation are affecting his business. Charles would like to educate his children and expand his business to a ranch. Charles wants a loan to buy more cattle for rearing.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for rearing.

loans.name: Gerversio

texts.en:
Gerversio is a 28-year-old gentleman who has two children. He runs a dairy business. He started with savings from a saving cooperative for two years. 

Inadequate capital is a factor affecting his operations. He would like to educate his children and have self-education. For the business, he would like to expand it into new markets. Gerversio wants a loan to buy a milk cooler for the business.

loans.use: to buy a milk cooler for his dairy business.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 5 filhos todos maiores de idade, vive na casa própria e sustenta apenas 2 netos que vivem com ela.
É comerciante dona do próprio negocio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (arroz, açúcar, feijão, óleo, sal, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja construir casas para aluguer para aumentar a renda familiar, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo devidamente para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o elevado custo e o bem-estar da família.
texts.en:
She's single and has five children, all of them adults. She lives in a house she owns and only supports two grandchildren who live with her.
She's a trader who runs her own business selling essential goods. With the current loan she intends to purchase goods (rice, sugar, beans, olive oil, salt, etc.) so she can increase the quantity of her mechandise.
In the future she wishes to build houses for renting in order to improve her family's income. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
Her challenge is the high cost of living and the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (rice, sugar, beans, olive oil, salt, etc.).

loans.name: Genaro

texts.en:
Genaro is a small entrepreneur living in his small house at Estefania.  He is 42 years old and single. To earn a living, he buys junk products and resells them to the people in his village; he has done this for four years. This way, he earns about P5,000 each month. 

He is now asking for a loan of P13,000 to buy more old newspapers, plastic bottles, and cans to resell for profit. This will help boost his income and help him someday achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more old newspapers, plastic bottles, and cans to re-sell

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es:
Cindy tiene 27 años, es una mujer buena y amable. Su pareja es Francisco, con quien tiene una pequeña hija llamada Mayte de tan solo 4 años, a quien desea brindarle una buena calidad de vida. Viven en su casa propia, la que construyó con ayuda de su pareja.

Su trabajo es la venta de ropa. A diario visita la casa de sus amigos, vecinos y familiares para ofrecer todas sus prendas. Por lo general sus ventas las realiza al crédito, lleva realizando este negocio por 2 años y lo hace sola, ya sea en su casa o en la de sus diferentes clientes. Le gusta porque le permite tener tiempo para dedicarse a su familia, además que aporta en la economía de su hogar. Desea seguir trabajando y ampliar su negocio vendiendo también zapatos para niños; pero por el momento se concentra en mantenerse vigente en el mercado.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, como lo hizo anteriormente. Y además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1300) comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería conformada por ropa y algunos zapatos en distintos modelos.
texts.en:
Cindy, 27, is a good and friendly woman.  Her partner is Francisco and they have a 4-year old daughter named Mayte.  They live in their own house which they built and she wishes to offer her daughter a good quality of life.

She sells clothing daily when she visits the homes of her friends, neighbors and relatives to offer them items.  She has been in this business for 2 years and usually she sells on credit.  She works alone either in her house or in her customer’s homes.  She likes the business because it allows her to dedicate herself to her family as well as helping pay for household expenses.  She wishes to continue working and enlarging her business by selling children’s shoes.  But for now she is concentrating on keeping current in the market.

This is her second loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support,  That way she can feel more confident to advance in her work.  For this she again promises to make her payments on time as she did previously.  She is content to belong to the communal bank since all the members are very responsible and supportive.

She will use the requested money (1300 sols) to buy merchandise of clothing and some different models of shoes.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and shoes to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro manages a small store in the front of his house. He is married, had 10 children, and four of them attend school. The rest have settled into marriage and live separately from him. His spouse also raises hogs to sell as an additional source of income. 

He takes in about PHP 4,000 each month from his store, and he wants to increase that, so he is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to invest in buying more commodities to sell. He will buy sardines, eggs, biscuits, noodles, soap, and shampoo. This will help meet his customers' demand.

Pedro hopes to keep extending good service and affordable prices to all his customers so he can boost his profits, too.  He will use the additional revenue to pay school fees for his children. The family lived less fortunate, but they were happy and determined to achieve success someday.

loans.use: to buy sardines, eggs, biscuits, noodles, soap, and shampoo to sell in his store

loans.name: Yunusu

texts.en: Yunusu is a 57-year-old married man with 13 children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He has operated a butcher shop for 12 years. His hardships are inadequate capital to purchase stock, price fluctuation, and inflation. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent home for his family.   His business goals are buying land to grow crops and buying cows and goats on a commercial basis. Yunusu intends to use the loan to buy construction materials for his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his house

loans.name: Purisima

texts.en:
Purisima is busy selling vegetables every day. She buys vegetables at the public market at Amulung and re-sells them at her village for profit. She has done this for 10 years. Purisima is now 52 years old and has four children. Three of them finished high school, and her youngest is still in elementary school. 

Her photo shows her busy preparing vegetables to sell. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to increase merchandise she sells and increase her profits, too. She will use the loan to buy more cabbages, eggplant, tomatoes, onions, and string beans to sell. She hopes to continuously earn good profits from her business and to be able to alleviate her family's poor living situation.

loans.use: to buy more cabbages, eggplant, tomatoes, onions and string beans to sell

loans.name: Yerjanik

texts.en: Yerjanik runs a farm where she cultivates land and keeps an orchard with different types of trees. To cultivate the land properly and develop the land and trees, Yerjanik needs sufficient investment. She plans to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Yerjanik lives with her mother and her son, who is in the army at present. Yerjanik works at a military unit at the nearest town. She is the main breadwinner in the family. In order to earn more income, Yerjanik works hard to develop the farm, which she hopes will provide stable income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic, 28, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Jojit, an OFW (overseas contract worker), and she is a mother of one child. Marivic manages the household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Marivic operates a liquified petroleum gas (LPG) business. What she basically does is buy LPG tanks from wholesalers and sells them by the tank with a little profit. LPG tanks can range from small to regular sized tanks. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more LPG tanks to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marivic hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her child a good future and a high-quality education through all her hard work. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of liquified petroleum gas (LPG) tanks needed in her business

loans.name: Maria Joey

texts.en:
This is Maria Joey. She previously accessed an 11,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase scrap materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 11,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy scrap materials. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Maria Joey hopes her business grows more in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase scrap materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Eufemio

texts.en:
This is Eufemio, 40, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Josie, a factory worker and mother to their child. Eufemio, together with his wife, manage their own household while operating their business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Eufemio operates a piggery. He earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes he has the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. Aside from this he also operates a jeepney for additional income. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php 1000 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy feeds and additional hogs. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 
 

Eufemio dreams to give his family a good future. He also dreams that his child will finish his education. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy feed and hogs needed in his business.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Pheap is 32 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling porridge at the market for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $3 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Pheap is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it much stronger to provide better living condition for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Thin

texts.en:
Thin, age 38, lives with her husbands and two school-aged children in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She, together with her husband, devote themselves to a rice farming business. Thin has been doing this for more than 14 years. Despite their hardships, Thin and her husband decided to continue sending their children to school so that they might have a better future.

Thin wants to improve her family’s living condition and pursue a better quality of life. At the present, she is borrowing a loan in the amount of KHR 2,000,000 to purchase a used motorcycle for home use. This motorcycle will help the family in traveling to anywhere around the province. Also, she can reduce some expenses on transportation fees.  For her short term goal, Thin wants to increase her rice production through the expansion of her land size.

loans.use: buy a used motorcycle for home use

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is a Palestinian married young woman.  She is a mother to three sons and two daughters.  Her husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past three years, Ola has been operating a beauty salon located in a good movement area downtown.  Her business has a good reputation among her customers and has been a profitable project, but it also needs more financial support to cover the costs.

Ola is requesting a 2,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing new beauty salon supplies such as hair and body creams, new collection of hair color tubes, hair dryers, and new collection of makeup colors. This will increase the size of Ola's work and improve her family's income.

Ola is photographed in her salon.

loans.use: buy beauty supplies for her salon

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 36-year-old woman living in Kagadi, Uganda.  For ten years she has been selling clothes.  She started as a street vendor and after accumulating enough capital she set up a shop.  Inadequate capital to meet the different tastes is a factor affecting her business.  Grace would like build a permanent home and hire employees to help her in the expansion of the business.

Grace wants a loan to buy bed sheets and blankets to resell.

loans.use: buy bed sheets and blankets to sell

loans.name: Salvatore

texts.en:
Salvatore is a 53-year-old married man with seven children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda.  He is engaged in farming where he has spent over 10 years.  He started by planting 1/4 acre and now has one and half acres of tea plantation.  

Salvatore is faced with the problem of seasonal weather changes, which negatively affect the quality and quantity of tea produced.  He has a personal goal of building a permanent home and a business goal of buying land to expand on the size of his tea plantation.

Salvatore wants a loan to buy more seedlings and manure to improve the quantity and quality of his tea.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and tea seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: restock his store

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 26-year-old married woman with three children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda.  She sells fresh foodstuffs and has been in business for four years. She is faced with the challenges of preserving the food since they are perishable goods and inadequate capital to purchase a variety of food to attract more customers.

Rose has a personal goal of educating her children and a business goal of diversifying her business by opening up a retail shop with general merchandise.  Rose needs a loan to buy tomatoes and cabbages to sell.

loans.use: buy tomatoes and cabbages to sell

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is involved in agriculture. Together with her family, she runs a farm where they cultivate watermelons and melons, and grow apricot and peach trees. The main income Anna and her family is gathered from selling their harvest in the local markets. 

Anna has applied for this loan to plant new young trees in the orchard. She also plans to purchase seeds for land cultivation, as well as fertilizer and medicine for the land. 

Anna lives with her husband, little daughter and parents. She wants to continue the expansion of her farm, which means increased income and better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: buy seeds, saplings, fertilizer and medicine

loans.name: Soem

texts.en:
Rice farming and a sewing business are the main source of Soem’s family’s income. Soem has been operating a sewing business at home for many years. With her good reputation, there are many customers who are fond of using her services. She is an expert in tailoring men’s wear. From this sewing business, Soem is able to generate approximately USD 4.00 per day and uses it to cover her household expenses. Some is now 54 years old and has three children living with her under the same roof in Prey Chor district in Kompong Cham province. 

As of now, Soem has run out of clothing supplies in her business, which is why she is seeking a loan of USD 150 to add to her capital to purchase raw clothing materials for her seamstress shop. With the help of the loan, Soem will be able to stabilize her current business and she hopes this will make additional income for her family. In the future, Soem wishes to own a medium-size seamstress shop that is located in a public gathering place where the customers can gain easy access to her services.

loans.use: buy sewing materials

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 63-year-old married man who owns a shop selling car parts.  He has applied for this loan to increase the quantity of car parts in his shop to increase his income.  

Ibrahim has two sons and two daughters, three of them have their own jobs.

loans.use: buy car parts to sell

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio has been raising pigs for three years. He is happily married with six children. Five of his children go to school while the other one is still an infant.

Gregorio raised three piglets and one pig to be fattened. Aside from the livestock business, he is also engaged in the farming business wherein he grows corn on his one and a half hectare of farm land. Gregorio aims to send his five children into higher levels of education to give them a better way of life. His dreams inspire him to work hard and have patience in everything he does.

Gregorio would like to purchase another pig and hog feed but he struggles financially. So he is requesting a loan PHP 25,000. He believes that this loan would help him maintain and improve his hog raising business.

loans.use: to buy one pig as well as hog feed

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus is a 24-year-old hardworking man with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a metal workshop for three years. His personal goal is to build a permanent house for residence and his business goal is to buy modern machines for his workshop. Justus is requesting a loan to buy building materials for his house.

loans.use: to buy materials to build his house

loans.name: Aseel

texts.en: Aseel is a single 20-year-old lady who has three brothers. She goes to a university and studies accounting, and she has applied for this loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming university fees.

loans.name: Tulio

texts.es:
Tulio tiene 37 años, es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador. Su pareja desde hace 15 años es Rosa, de 38 años de edad, con quien tiene tres hijos de 15, 6 y 3 años. Juntos viven en su  casa propia, la misma que pudieron construir con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo.

Su trabajo es la venta de abarrotes, verduras y otros comestibles. Tiene una pequeña bodega que ha acondicionado en su vivienda, donde todos los días con su pareja atienden a sus clientes. Abren desde las 5 de la mañana y ya tienen alrededor de un año. Lamentablemente aun los ingresos que percibe por las ventas no le alcanza para brindarle a su familia una vida digna, por ese motivo trabaja todavía, desde hace 8 años, como estibador en el puerto fluvial de la ciudad, ahí se encarga de cargar y descargar los botes y canoas. Desde que inició su bodega tuvo muchas dificultades, como la falta de capital para continuar renovando sus artículos, sin embargo con el tiempo ha mejorado y ha aprendido a tener paciencia.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en él. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Y además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 600) comprará productos para su tienda de abarrotes, ya que desea surtir su tienda con mayor diversidad de productos de distintas marcas.
texts.en:
Tulio is 37 years old.  He is a very responsible and hard-working man. His partner for 15 years is Rosa.  She is 38 years of age and they have three children together, ages 15, 6 and 3. Together they live in their own house, the same one that they were able to construct with a lot of effort and [hard] work.

His occupation is the sale of groceries, vegetables, and other food items.  He has a small shop that he has [constructed] in his home, where every day, along with his wife, he serves his customers.  They open at five in the morning and have already been in business for about a year.  Unfortunately, the revenue that he earns from sales is not enough to give his family a dignified life.  For that reason, he still works, as he has for the past eight years, as a dock worker in the river port of the city; there he is responsible for loading and unloading the boats and canoes.  Since he started his store, he has had many difficulties, like a lack of capital to replenish his stock.  However, he has improved with time and has learned to have patience.    

This is his first loan with MFP.  He is, therefore, grateful for the opportunity and the trust that they have put in him.  He has committed himself to making [his loan] payments in a timely manner.  He is also grateful to be part of the community bank to which he belongs since he has seen that the members are responsible and supportive people.  With the requested loan (S/. 600), he will purchase products for his grocery store since he wants to stock his store with a greater variety of products of different brands.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to supply his store.

loans.name: Deyssi

texts.es:
Deyssi es una mujer de 24 años, muy jovial y emprendedora. Su pareja desde hace un año es Wilfredo, de 25 años, fruto de su amor tienen una hija llamada Ashly de tan solo 5 cortos meses, quien es su principal motivo de esfuerzo. Vive en la casa que construyó en el terreno que su padre le ha cedido. 

Profesionalmente se dedica a trabajar en un estudio contable en el área administrativa y eventualmente, en otra empresa, en el área logística. Como resultado de los ingresos que sus trabajos le ha dado pudo ahorrar lo suficiente para emprender su negocio de venta de cervezas al por mayor. Ha instalado su distribuidora en su vivienda y trabaja con el apoyo de dos personas. Al principio sintió mucho temor, pues consideraba que la venta de cervezas podía ser difícil al tratar con los clientes muy bebidos, es por eso que no estableció un lugar de ventas de consumo directo, sino que prefirió vender al por mayor para su consumo en restaurantes, discotecas, bares o eventos casuales. Toda la ganancia que este oficio le genera, sin duda le ha servido para ir cumpliendo poco a poco todas las cosas que se ha propuesto en beneficio de su familia.

Este es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, y así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriormente. Y además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 2500) comprará mayor cantidad de cervezas para que su negocio permanezca constantemente abastecido.
texts.en:
Deyssi is 24 years old and a very cheerful and enterprising woman. She has been married to 25-year-old Wilfredo for one year, and together they have a daughter named Ashly who is only five months old. She is Deyssi's main motivation to work hard. Deyssi lives in the house that she built on land given to her by her father. 

On a professional level Deyssi works for an accounting firm in the administration department, and eventually at another business, in logistics. As a result of the income from her jobs, she was able to save enough to start her business selling beer wholesale. She set up distribution in her home, and works with the help of two people. At the beginning she was very nervous, and she thought that selling beer and working with intoxicated customers would be difficult; that's why she didn't set up a place for direct consumption, but rather started selling wholesale for consumption in restaurants, clubs, bars, or casual events. All of the profit generated by this business without a doubt has been helpful to keep reaching, step by step, for all the things that will benefit her family. 

This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support, and she feels secure developing her business. Also she once again promises to make her payments on time, as she has previously. And furthermore, she is very happy to belong to a community bank, as all of its members are very responsible and united together.

With the amount requested (2500 PEN), Deyssi will buy a large quantity of beer so that her business will remain well supplied.

loans.use: to buy beer for resale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Enos

texts.en: Enos is a 41-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a teacher for 17 years. His personal goal is to build a permanent home and his business goal is to buy land to grow crops. Enos intends to use this loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land for farming

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a 46-year-old married man with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for 18 months. His hardships are high fuel and transportation price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goal is to educate his children and his business goal is to diversify his business to include farming. William is requesting this loan to buy soap and sugar to sell in his shop.

loans.use: to buy soap and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Clovice

texts.en: Clovice is a twenty-six-year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been in the transport business for the last six years and his main hardships are high fuel and transportation costs. He has a vision of acquiring at least six motorycles in the next four years and buying land to grow crops. Clovice needs a loan for construction materials in order to finish his permanent house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for finishing his permanent house

loans.name: Kayan

texts.en:
Kayan is 48 years old and a retired employee. She is a married woman caring for 3 children. Her husband works at a public security department.

Kayan is starting a small retail business at home selling blankets and bed covers. She has applied for this loan to order a larger quantity of bed covers and sheets to increase her profits.

loans.use: to order a larger quantity of bed covers and sheets for resale

loans.name: Meline

texts.en:
Meline runs a farm, where she cultivates land and keeps livestock. The farm currently includes 5 cows and 5 sows. Meline lives with her husband and pensioner father-in-law, who are also involved in agriculture. Meline has applied for this loan to purchase one more cow. She will also purchase 500 litres of fuel to be used in agricultural techniques. 
Meline and her family live in an old house, which needs to be repaired. The stable growth of agriculture is important for the family to make savings, renovate the house and live in better conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and 500 litres of fuel

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik lives in Kajaran town with her husband and son. Hasmik's son works at a local factory. Hasmik and her husband run a farm, where they keep 25 colonies of bees and breed livestock. The main income comes from the sale of honey, meat and milk in Kajaran town and in the regional center, Kapan town. 
In order to expand the farm, Hasmik would like to increase the amount of livestock. This loan will help her to purchase 1 bull and 7 colonies of bees. Hasmik forecasts an increase of income, which will allow her to insure a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for 1 bull and 7 colonies of bees

loans.name: Nare

texts.en: Nare is 22. She lives in Shikahogh village with her parents. For many years Nare's parents have been involved in agriculture, and for the past few years Nare has also been involved in this business. The farm currently comprises 4 cows, 2 pigs and 30 chickens. Nare would like to increase the number of livestock by purchasing 2 pigs. With the loan's help she will also purchase fuel, which the family uses to take agricultural products to neighbouring towns and villages to sell. Expansion of the farm will allow Nare to earn more income and invest in the further development of agriculture.

loans.use: to pay for 2 pigs and fuel

loans.name: Armine

texts.en: Armine lives in Ashotavan village with her husband and two little children. The family earns its income from agriculture: land cultivation and cattle breeding. Armine would like to increase her number of cattle by purchasing two cows. In addition, she wants to gather and collect grass for the cattle to eat during the winter. For this goal, she has to purchase the necessary thread to collect and keep the grass. This loan will also help Armine to purchase fuel for taking her agricultural products to the market. The implementation of these plans is important to Armine, as she will be able to maintain the stable development of her farm and ensure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To pay for two cows, thread, and fuel

loans.name: On

texts.en:
On is 49 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up pigs for more than twenty years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a tax imposer (one who imposes tax on merchants). He earns about $2 per day.

 In order to improve her family’s finances, On is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase farmland to use for cultivating agricultural crops. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for cultivating agricultural crops.

loans.name: Bernandita

texts.en:
Bernandita is 45 years old, married, and lives in the Philippines.

Bernandita is a farmer and she cultivates corn for a living. She has been doing this for sixteen years and every month she earns PHP 4,500 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizer.

Bernandita is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, she hopes to widen her business site.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang is 32 years old and a business-minded woman who seeks to improve her living conditions and provide her two children a better life. She is engaged in a rice farming business and at the same time she is in the business of making red palm sugar for additional income. Heang usually earns around USD 5 per day, which she spends on food and allowances for her two school-aged children.

To improve her business, Heang would like to take out a loan of KHR 1,200,000 to pay for plowing fees and other labor costs. She will strive to work hard towards her goal. She believes that through her effort and patience she will be able to gain a better standard of living and send all of her children to university.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees and other labor costs.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam is a 35-year-old married woman caring for two children. She has an animal sales business with a large number of sheep and goats that she feeds and takes care of and eventually sells. She has applied for this loan to do some enhancements on the barn and buy more food for the animals.

loans.use: to buy more food for her animals

loans.name: Kam

texts.en:
Kam is 29 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Kam was not given the chance to finish her college education. She was born on her family's farm and learned the agricultural business well. She has been involved in the farming business as the main source of her family’s income. She usually grows rice and beans for sale each harvesting season. She works hard and manages her business well to attain her goals. 

Due to a lack of capital, she has difficulties in starting to plant her bean crops. So now she is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to pay for land fees and to purchase bean seed for planting. She believes the loan will be a big help for her to lessen her difficulties and to maintain her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for land fees and purchase bean seed for planting.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en: Marisa is married with 3 children. She is 32 years old and lives in Dimalco, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Marisa owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting corn to earn a living. She has been in this business for 14 years and earns PHP 6,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase farm fertilizers. Marisa is a new member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC. In the future, Marisa's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers

loans.name: Sokheam

texts.en:
Sokheam is 54 years old. She is married and blessed with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than 10 years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is employed in the factory. He earns about $9 per day. 

In order to improve her business, Sokheam is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a walking tractor to use for tilling her farmland. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a walking tractor for tilling her farmland.

loans.name: Rukhsat

texts.ru: Рухсат пожилая замужняя женщина. Имеет пятерых детей.Ее вид деятельности заключается в том что она печет лепешки.Каждое утро она печет лепешки и продает на рынке.В этом ей помогают ее дети.Это их основной доход.Но этот доход они тратят только на семейные нужды.У них очень плохие условия проживания.В доме где они живут очень тесно.Поэтому Рухсат решила на маленьком участке которое они имеют построить дом.На полученный кредит она хочет купить строительные материалы и начать стройку.Заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en: Rukhsat is an elderly married woman. She has five children. Her business is baking flatbreads. Every morning she makes the breads and sells on the market. Her children help her in this business. This is their main source of income. They spend this income only on their family needs. They live in bad living conditions and the house they live in is very small. This is why Rukhsat has decided to build a house on a small parcel of land they own. She wants to use the loan to buy building materials and begin construction. She is thanking for your help in advance.

loans.use: purchase of building materials.

loans.name: Venera

texts.ru:
Венере 40 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. Венера работает уборщицей в спортивной школе и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 10 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 10,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Венеры в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  1 корова и теленок, 5 коз, продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 5,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Венера обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Венера планирует вложить в ремонт своего дома.
texts.en:
Venera is 40 years old, she is married and has four children. For an additional source of income for her family Venera works as a janitor in a sports school. During the last ten years she has been doing animal husbandry which she started with an amount of 10,000 som. Because of her hard work Venera now has one cow and a calf, five goats, as well as the sale of milk and dairy products which brings around 5,000 KGS a month.

With the goal to further grow her business she has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som to buy additional heads of cattle. Venera plans to invest the income from the loan into renovation of her house.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 47-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of educating his children up to the university level. He has been operating a retail shop and he used his personal savings to start this business. His main hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and inadequate capital to buy enough stock. He has a vision of buying land one day to grow crops so as to increase his income sources. Robert is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise such as salt and bread to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt and bread for resale

loans.name: Jungie

texts.en:
Jungie is married and has three children. He is 41 years old and resides at Dimalco, Bonifacio, Philippines.

Jungie is operating a venture raising crops, planting and harvesting corn for sale in the local community to earn a living. He has been in this business for 15 years. Each month, he earns 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business.

He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This year, Jungie joined GDMPC. In the future, Jungie wants to save a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is a married woman with five children. Lourdes is 58 years old and resides in Bagumbang, Bonifacio, Philippines. Lourdes buys and sells fish for a living, and she's been in this business for 14 years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP from doing this. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more fish to sell. Lourdes became a member of GDMPC in 2010. In the future, Lourdes wants to build a house and put her children through school.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 38 años, es una mujer muy amable, buena y emprendedora. Hace 13 años convive con José, junto a él tiene dos hijos menores: José Enrique de 12 y Blanca de 5 años. La casa donde viven es alquilada desde hace un año y ahí comparten su lucha diaria por mejorar.

Se dedica a la venta de cervezas, gaseosas y helados de todos los sabores de una marca muy reconocida en la ciudad. Ha establecido recientemente su pequeño negocio en la puerta de su vivienda, pero se dedica a esta actividad hace 8 años, siempre ha trabajado sola porque así se siente más tranquila, ya que considera que de esa forma mantiene el orden y no tiene ninguna presión al momento de trabajar. Algunas veces prepara queques y los vende por las calles o también ofreciéndolo de casa en casa. Se dedica a este trabajo por lo general durante las mañanas, ya que por las tardes, desde hace 15 años, contribuye brindando su apoyo en un programa de enseñanza educativa de estimulación temprana para niños en una escuela de su barrio y eso le genera un ingreso económico extra. Se siente muy feliz porque sabe que todas las actividades laborales que realiza le produce los ingresos económicos que necesita para solventar los gastos básicos de su hogar; sin embargo, sabe que tiene que continuar esforzándose muchísimo para mantener esta situación. Espera seguir trabajando para hacer crecer aún más su negocio y más adelante comprarse un terreno para construir su casa.

Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir, una vez más, con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Y le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias entre sí.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 3000) comprará, principalmente, mayor cantidad de gaseosas. También los ingredientes que necesita para la preparación de los queques que vende.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 38 and is a very friendly, good, and enterprising woman.  She has lived with José for 13 years, and they have 2 young children.  José Enrique is 12, and Blanca is 5.  They have rented the house in which they live for 1 year and there is where they share their daily fight to improve.

Elizabeth sells beer, soft drinks, and ice cream of all flavors from a very well-known brand in the city.  She recently established a small business in front of her home, but she has done this work for 8 years.  She has always worked alone because she feels more at peace that way.  She thinks she stays organized this way and doesn't feel stressed out at work.  Sometimes, she makes cakes and sells them in the streets.  She also offers them door to door.  She generally does this work in the mornings, since in the afternoons, for 15 years now, she offers her help at an early education program at a school in her neighborhood to earn extra money.  She is very happy because she knows that all of her work activities produce income that she needs to pay for her home's basic expenses.  Nevertheless, she knows that she has to continue working very hard to maintain this situation.  She hopes to keep working to grow her business more.  In the future, she wants to buy land to build a house.

This is her eighth credit with Microfinanzas Prisma.  She is thankful for the opportunity and trust that they offer her.  She promises to make her payments again in a punctual manner.  She is happy to be part of her communal bank, since she has seen that the members are very responsible people and supportive of one another.

With the requested amount of 3,000 PEN, she will buy a larger quantity of soft drinks.  She will also buy the ingredients she needs to make the cakes that she sells.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to sell and to buy ingredients to make desserts.

loans.name: Jerly

texts.en: Jerly is from Migpange, Bonifacio. She is 48 years old. Jerly is a widow and has four children. To make a living, she manages a fishpond where she raises fish, crabs, and shrimp to sell. She has been active in her business for 15 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2011, Jerly joined GDMPC. Jerly is requesting a loan of 4,500 PHP, which will be used to buy young fish to raise and some twine. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy young fish to raise and some twine

loans.name: Doli

texts.es:
Doli tiene 51 años, es una mujer amable, buena y muy trabajadora. Su pareja es Aurelio, de 60 años, con quien tiene seis hijos, a quienes brindó educación y crió con buenos modales y valores. Vive en su casa propia, la que pudo construir hace 8 años con el apoyo de su cónyuge, ahí vive actualmente solo con una hija y tres nietos.

Su negocio es la venta de ropa, zapatos y otros accesorios de uso personal. Toda su mercadería es enviada por su hija desde otra ciudad. Todos los días va en busca de sus clientes por las calles de la ciudad, lleva consigo toda su mercadería para ofrecerlas de casa en casa. Su modalidad de trabajo es al contado o al crédito y la cobranza lo realiza en forma diaria, semanal o quincenal. Por otra parte, cuando no consigue vender todo en la ciudad, viaja a los centros poblados que se encuentran cerca de la ribera de los ríos, ahí consigue vender todo y regresa a casa muy contenta después de aproximadamente 10 días de haber salido de la ciudad. Empezó con este oficio hace un año y algunas veces recibe el apoyo de su hijo, quien tiene un vehículo y le ayuda en el traslado de su mercadería.
