Anteriormente vendía comida pero después de 6 años prefirió cambiar por la excesiva competencia que había en su sector. Actualmente tiene buenas ventas y como resultado de ello obtiene buenas ganancias, por lo que espera seguir creciendo y conseguir un puesto de ventas estable.

Este es el noveno crédito que tiene con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes lo hacen posible. Por otro lado, está muy comprometida, una vez más, en cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.
El monto solicitado (S/. 3000) invertirá en la compra de más mercadería (ropa, zapatillas y sandalias) para continuar vendiendo.
texts.en:
Doli is 51 years old and a good woman, friendly and hard working. Her partner is Aurelio, age 60, with whom she has six children; she gave her children an education and raised them with good manners and values. She lives in her home, which she was was able to build eight years ago with the help of her spouse; currently only one daughter and three nephews / nieces live with her. 

Her business is selling clothing, shoes, and other personal accessories. All of her merchandise is sent by her daughter from another city. Every day she goes looking for customers in the streets of the city, taking with her all of her merchandise to offer from house to house. Her sales are cash or credit, and she collects payment daily, weekly, or biweekly. In any case, when she can't manage to sell everything in the city, she travels to the small communities located near the riverbanks; there she can sell everything, and she returns home very happy after about 10 days outside the city. 

Doli started this business a year ago. Sometimes she gets help from her son, who has a vehicle and helps her transport merchandise. Previously she sold food, but after six years she decided to change jobs due to the excessive competition in that field. Currently she has very good sales, and as a result she earns a good income; she hopes to keep growing and get a stable retail location. 

This is the ninth loan she's had with MFP, and she appreciates all who make it possible. Also she is very committed, once again, in making her monthly payments on time. And she is very happy to belong to a community bank, as all of its members are very good, friendly, and supportive. 

The requested amount (3000 PEN) will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise (clothing, shoes, sandals) so that she can keep selling.

loans.use: to buy closing and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Gissela

texts.es:
Gissela tiene 36 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Tiene dos hijos, de 18 y 7 años, a quienes atiende desde que se quedó sola hace muchos años. Vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más quiere es poder ver a sus hijos culminar una carrera profesional.

Su actividad laboral es la venta de cosméticos y productos de perfumería. Todos los días sale a visitar a sus diferentes amistades, vecinos y familiares para ofrecer su mercadería, pero en algunas ocasiones sus clientes acudan a su casa. Lleva realizando 18 años este trabajo y lo hace sola, aprendió y reforzó sus técnicas de venta. Es consciente que tiene que trabajar mucho para poder tener éxito en este tipo de negocio, pues espera mantener a su clientela. Para el futuro desea establecer su propia tienda de cosméticos.

Este es el décimo crédito que tiene con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, como lo hizo en anteriores ocasiones. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son personas muy responsables y solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 4000) comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería, conformada por perfumes y cosméticos para continuar vendiendo e incrementar la cantidad de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gissela is 36 and is a very enterprising and hard-working woman.  She has 2 children, who are 18 and 7, for whom she has cared since she has been alone for many years.  She lives in her parents' home and what she wants most is to be able to see her children become professionals.

She makes a living selling cosmetics and perfume.  She goes out every day to visit various friends, neighbors, and family members to sell her merchandise.  On some occasions, her customers come to her house.  She has done this work by herself for 18 years.  She learned it and strengthened her sales techniques.  She knows she has to work hard to be able to be successful in this type of business and she hopes to keep her customers.  In the future, she wants to have her own cosmetics store.

This is her tenth credit with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support since she feels surer about getting ahead in her work.  She promises to make her payments in a punctual manner again like she has done with her previous loans.  She is very happy to belong to her communal bank because the members are very responsible and supportive people.

With the requested amount (4,000 PEN) she will buy a larger quantity of merchandise, made up of perfumes and cosmetics, to continue selling and increasing her number of customers.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and cosmetics to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is married. She is 39 years old and lives in Migpange, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental with her three kids. Teresita operates a sari-sari store to earn a living. She has been in this business for two years, and she earns 3,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. She joined GDMPC in 2008. In the future, Teresita will use her income to support her three kids in their studies (until they finish college) and also pay for their daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee

loans.name: Mariane

texts.en: Mariane is a married woman with 2 children. Mariane is 30 years old, and she lives at Migpange, in Bonifacio, the Philippines.  Mariane buys and sells shrimp for a living, and she's been 12 years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP 18,000 doing this type of work. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more shrimp to sell.  Mariane is been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Mariane wants to build a house and to complete her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more shrimp to sell.
